<p style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt"><span style="font-size:20.0pt;line-height:105%;font-family:"Arial",sans-serif">PowerShell with Objects Programmer’s Guide</span></p>
#Introduction<a name="_Toc464196014"></a>
<p>Use Provisioning Services’ programming interfaces to manageyour implementation from a command line or from scripts. Only users withcorrect administrative privileges can use programming commands.Non-administrators, that do not have elevated privileges and attempt to use thesecommands, will receive the ‘Invalid access’ message.</p>
<p>Four different programming interfaces exist:</p>
<p style="margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in"><span style="font-family:Symbol">·<span style="font:7.0pt "Times New Roman""></span></span>Management Command Line Interface (MCLI)</p>
<p style="margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in"><span style="font-family:Symbol">·<span style="font:7.0pt "Times New Roman""></span></span>Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) Server Programmer Interface</p>
<p style="margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in"><span style="font-family:Symbol">·<span style="font:7.0pt "Times New Roman""></span></span>PowerShell Programmer Interface with Objects</p>
<p style="margin-left:.25in;text-indent:-.25in"><span style="font-family:Symbol">·<span style="font:7.0pt "Times New Roman""></span></span>PowerShell Programmer Interface (Deprecated)</p>
<p>This document provides the information needed to use thisinterface.</p>
##Using the PowerShell Programmer Interface withObjects<a name="_Toc464196015"></a>
<p>Use the information that follows to manage a ProvisioningService’s implementation from the PowerShell Interface with Objects.</p>
#Installation of PowerShell Snap-In<a name="_Toc464196016"></a>
<p>The PowerShell snap-in (Citrix.PVS.SnapIn.dll) can beinstalled using the Provisioning Server Console install.</p>
##Registration of McliPSSnapIn.dll usingImport-Module<a name="_Toc464196017"></a>
<p>If the snap-in later needs to be registered in PowerShell,this can be manually done by running one of the following command inPowerShell. The path where the Citrix.PVS.SnapIn.dll is installed needs to beused.</p>
<p>Import-Module “path\Citrix.PVS.SnapIn.dll”</p>
##Registration of Citrix.PVS.SnapIn.dll usingAdd-PSSnapin<a name="_Toc464196018"></a>
<p>If the snap-in later needs to be registered in PowerShell,this can be manually done by running one of the following commands at the DOScommand prompt. After the command is run and PowerShell is started, the snap-inneeds to be added using the command “Add-PSSnapin -Name Citrix.PVS.SnapIn”.</p>
###64-bit Registration<a name="_Toc464196019"></a>
<p><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">%systemroot%\Microsoft.NET\Framework64\v4.0.30319\installutil.exeCitrix.PVS.SnapIn.dll</span></p>
###32-bit Registration<a name="_Toc464196020"></a>
<p><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">%systemroot%\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\installutil.exeCitrix.PVS.SnapIn.dll</span></p>
##Alternative Registration of Citrix.PVS.SnapIn.dllin PowerShell<a name="_Toc464196021"></a>
<p>Another way to register is by running one of the followingcommands at the PowerShell command prompt:</p>
###64-bit Registration in PowerShell<a name="_Toc464196022"></a>
<p><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$installutil= $env:systemroot + '\Microsoft.NET\Framework64\v4.0.30319\installutil.exe'</span></p>
<p><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">;$installutilCitrix.PVS.SnapIn.dll</span></p>
<p><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Add-PSSnapin-Name Citrix.PVS.SnapIn</span></p>
###32-bit Registration in PowerShell<a name="_Toc464196023"></a>
<p><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$installutil= $env:systemroot + '\Microsoft.NET\Framework32\v4.0.30319\installutil.exe'</span></p>
<p><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">;$installutilCitrix.PVS.SnapIn.dll</span></p>
<p><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Add-PSSnapin-Name Citrix.PVS.SnapIn</span></p>
#Uninstall of PowerShell Snap-In<a name="_Toc464196024"></a>
<p>The PowerShell snap-in (Citrix.PVS.SnapIn.dll) can beuninstalled using the Provisioning Server Console install.</p>

##Alternative Unregister of Citrix.PVS.SnapIn.dll inPowerShell<a name="_Toc464196028"></a>
<p>Another way to unregister is by running one of the followingcommands at the PowerShell command prompt:</p>
###64-bit Unregister in PowerShell<a name="_Toc464196029"></a>
<p><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$installutil= $env:systemroot + '\Microsoft.NET\Framework64\v4.0.30319\installutil.exe'</span></p>
<p><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">;$installutil-u Citrix.PVS.SnapIn.dll</span></p>
###32-bit Unregister in PowerShell<a name="_Toc464196030"></a>

<p><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">;$installutil-u Citrix.PVS.SnapIn.dll</span></p>
#Setup of the SOAP Server Communication<a name="_Toc464196031"></a>
<p>Unless the defaults are fine, use this command to set thevalues for the SOAP Server connection:</p>
##Set-PvsConnection<a name="_Toc464196032"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set the SoapServer connection, and if -Persist isspecified the connection settings are saved in the registry. A PvsConnectionobject can be used as the parameter.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsConnection Connection: PvsConnection object withchanged property value(s) to be set. The object can come from a pileline.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">These values are in the PvsConnection object, andonly will be set if the value has changed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or Server: Name or IP of the Server toconnect to. Default=localhost</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Port: The Port to use to connect.Default=54321</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string User: User name to use for Authentication. Ifit has a value, it will be *****. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Domain: Domain name to use forAuthentication. If it has a value, it will be *****. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Password: Password to use for Authentication.If it has a value, it will be *****. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Persist: True when the connection settingsshould be, for Set, or have been, for Get, saved to the registry.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsConnection can be created or modified usingmethods below:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.8in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">New-Object Citrix.PVS.SnapIn.PvsConnection: Createsdefault Server=localhost, Port=54321, and no authentication.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.8in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">New-ObjectCitrix.PVS.SnapIn.PvsConnection(Citrix.PVS.SnapIn copyFrom): Creates withsettings of the copyFrom Citrix.PVS.SnapIn.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.8in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SetServerToLocalHostDefaultSettings:Server=localhost, Port=54321, and no authentication.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.8in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Copy(Citrix.PVS.SnapIn copyFrom): Modifies thesettings to match the copyFrom Citrix.PVS.SnapIn.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.8in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Equals(Citrix.PVS.SnapIn compareTo): Returns truewhen the settings match what is in the compareTo.</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">When Connection is not passed, the parameters beloware used:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional field values to set:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or Server: Name or IP of the Server toconnect to. Default=localhost</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Port: The Port to use to connect.Default=54321</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string User: User name to use for Authentication. Ifit has a value, it will be *****. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Domain: Domain name to use forAuthentication. If it has a value, it will be *****. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Password: Password to use for Authentication.If it has a value, it will be *****. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Persist: True when the connection settingsshould be, for Set, or have been, for Get, saved to the registry.</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter PassThru: If -PassThru is specified,the resulting PvsConnection object is returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to haveconfirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Set PvsConnection for Individual Fields
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsConnection into a $o variable. Change the$o field values and then Set the PvsConnection with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o = Get-PvsConnection -Fields Port</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o.Port = 54322</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set-PvsConnection $o</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Set PvsConnection for a Field Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsConnection into a $o variable for thefield that has the wrong value. Change the $o field to the correct value and thenSet the PvsConnection with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsConnection -Fields Port | Where-Object{$_.Port -ne 54322} | foreach { $o = $_; $o.Port = 54322; $o } |Set-PvsConnection</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The "foreach { $o = $_; $o.X = Y; $o }"sets the field X to value Y and returns the object again so it can be piped tothe Set command for update.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Set PvsConnection Port with Parameter
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set the PvsConnection Port using the Port parameterinstead of a PvsConnection object.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set-PvsConnection -Port 54322</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.8in;text-indent:-2.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This is the only Set command that has fieldparameters.</span></p>
#Command Specific Help<a name="_Toc464196033"></a>
<p>All of the documentation for specific commands is includedin the command-line help by calling Get-Help and the name of the command, forexample “Get-Help Get-PvsDevice”. The documentation for the specific commandincludes information about the object that is may get or set. The documentationof all of the objects is included in the “Objects, in the Citrix.PVS.SnapInNamespace” section.</p>
#Error Handling<a name="_Toc464196034"></a>
<p>For the Citrix.PVS.SnapIn, if an error occurs, aPvsException will be in the Exception member of the $error. The “Error codes”information is included in this document.</p>
<p>The members of a PvsException are:</p>
<p style="margin-left:99.0pt;text-indent:-85.5pt">InnerException:The exception that occured. This exception maybe an EAException or otherstandard Exception.</p>
<p style="margin-left:99.0pt;text-indent:-85.5pt">ToString():Has the formatted full Message of the InnerException.</p>
<p style="margin-left:99.0pt;text-indent:-85.5pt">If theInnerException GetType().Name equals "EAException", then The membersof it are:</p>
<p style="margin-left:99.0pt;text-indent:-85.5pt"> returnCode: The number, as shown below in the Error codes. The name of theerror, for example "NotImplemented", is not included in theEAException.</p>
<p style="margin-left:99.0pt;text-indent:-85.5pt"> Message: The message, as shown below in the Error codes. The [v1], [v2], [v3],[v4], and [v5] will be replaced with values as required.</p>
<p style="margin-left:99.0pt;text-indent:-85.5pt"> Details: Has the Details for the EAException if there are any. OtherException,ManagementInterfaceError and PvsStatusException will have Details.</p>
<p style="margin-left:99.0pt;text-indent:-85.5pt"> ToString(): Has the Message as shown below in the Error codes. If there isDetails, it will be returned or included, and if partialReturn, they will beincluded.</p>
<p style="margin-left:99.0pt;text-indent:-85.5pt"> partialReturn: Might have a list of EAException objects if any of the itemsprocessed during the command had any issues.</p>
<p style="margin-left:99.0pt;text-indent:-85.5pt"> Severity: Can have the values Critical, Error, Warning or Duplicate.</p>
<p style="margin-left:99.0pt;text-indent:-85.5pt"> Source: Has the value that is displayed in the Console as a Title or Type forthe error.</p>
<p style="margin-left:99.0pt;text-indent:-85.5pt"></p>

#Error codes<a name="_Toc464196054"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.3in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">For the Citrix.PVS.SnapIn, if an error occurs, aPvsException will be in the Exception member of the $error.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.3in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The members of a PvsException are:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">InnerException: The exception that occured. Thisexception maybe an EAException or other standard Exception.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ToString(): Has the formatted full Message of theInnerException.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.3in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If the InnerException GetType().Name equals"EAException", then The members of it are:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">returnCode: The number, as shown below in the Errorcodes. The name of the error, for example "NotImplemented", is notincluded in the EAException.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Message: The message, as shown below in the Errorcodes. The [v1], [v2], [v3], [v4], and [v5] will be replaced with values asrequired.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Details: Has the Details for the EAException ifthere are any. OtherException, ManagementInterfaceError and PvsStatusExceptionwill have Details.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ToString(): Has the Message as shown below in theError codes. If there is Details, it will be returned or included, and ifpartialReturn, they will be included.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">partialReturn: Might have a list of EAExceptionobjects if any of the items processed during the command had any issues.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Severity: Can have the values Critical, Error, Warningor Duplicate.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Source: Has the value that is displayed in theConsole as a Title or Type for the error.</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.3in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">0 Success: The command succeeded.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.3in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">1 NotImplemented: The [v1] feature has not beenimplemented.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.3in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">2 InvalidCommand: The [v1] command does not exist.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.3in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">3 InvalidField: The [v1] field does not exist.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.3in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">4 InvalidFieldFormat: The [v1] field is notformatted properly, the correct format is [v2].</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.3in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">5 InvalidParameter: The [v1] parameter is not valid.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.3in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">6 InvalidParameterFormat: The [v1] parameter is notformatted property, the correct format is [v2].</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.3in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">7 ReadOnlyField: Unable to change the [v1] fieldbecause it is read-only.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.3in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">8 RequiredFieldMissing: The required [v1] field ismissing.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.3in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">9 RequiredFieldsMissing: The required [v1] or [v2]field is missing.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">10 RequiredParameterMissing: The required [v1]parameter is missing.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">11 RequiredParametersMissing: The required [v1] or[v2] parameter is missing.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">12 InternalIdAndNameFieldsMustBeDefined: An internalerror occurred. The [v1] field is not the next FieldSettings object after theID.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">13 NoFarmAccess: The domain/user does not haveaccess to the Farm.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">14 InvalidForeignKeyValue: The [v1] field with value[v2] is an invalid foreign key.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">15 SetupError: The system was not configuredcorrectly.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">16 Executing: The [v1] command can only be calledone at a time. Wait for the command to finish before running again.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">17 NoDiskMapped: A vDisk has not yet been mapped.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">18 DatabaseError: A database error occurred.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">19 DuplicateKey: To avoid creating a duplicate key,the Add or Set command was cancelled.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">20 DatabaseErrorMissed: An internal error occurred.An uncaught database error occurred.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">21 AddCommandFailed: No objects were added duringthe last 'Add' command.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">22 InsufficientPrivileges: Access denied. Theappropriate privileges are not assigned to perform this task.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">23 ZeroObjectsAffected: No object was added,updated, or deleted in the last operation.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">24 OtherException: An unexpected MAPI erroroccurred.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">25 InvalidFieldLength: The [v1] field value is toolong, maximum length is [v2].</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">26 InvalidFieldValueMinMax: The [v1] field value isinvalid, the minimum is [v2] and the maximum is [v3].</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">27 InvalidFieldValue: The [v1] field can only havevalues [v2] or [v3].</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">28 TooManyParameters: More parameters were specifiedthan permitted.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">29 TooFewParameters: Not enough identifyingparameters specified.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">30 FollowingParametersMissing: To use the [v1]parameter, [v2] or [v3] must also be used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">31 InconsistentData: The action is canceled becausethe Store directory date/times does not match. Update the Store directories tomatch.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">32 DatabaseOpenFailed: Unable to contact thedatabase server. Ensure Provisioning Services is configured correctly.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">33 DatabaseVersionWrong: The wrong database versionis being used.  Found version number: [v1] Expected version number:[v2]</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">34 DatabaseVersionNotFound: The database versionnumber does not exist or was not found. Ensure Provisioning Services isconfigured correctly.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">35 SomeRequiredParametersMissing: Requiredparameters are missing.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">36 PartialError: The following items failed:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.9in;text-indent:-.3in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">item1 Error message...</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.9in;text-indent:-.3in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">item2 Error message...</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">37 NoItemsToProcess: There are no items to process.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">38 NoDefaultCollectionDefined: Unable to add aDevice until a default Collection is set.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">39 NoDefaultSiteDefined: A default Site is not set,no Devices can be added.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">40 InvalidCollection: The specified Collection doesnot exist.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">41 InvalidAuthGroup: The specified AuthGroup doesnot exist.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">42 InvalidGroup: The specified Group does not exist.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">43 InvalidDevice: The specified Device does notexist.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">44 InvalidDiskLocator: The specified vDisk does notexist.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">45 InvalidServer: The specified Server does notexist.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">46 InvalidServerSite: Server specified is not in theSite specified.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">47 InvalidStoreSite: Store specified is not for theSite specified.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">48 InvalidSiteView: The specified Site View does notexist.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">49 InvalidSite: The specified Site does not exist.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">50 InvalidDeviceDiskLocator: The specified Device orvDisk does not exist.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">51 InvalidDeviceImport: Import failed because thefile must have Device Name, Mac Address, Site Name, and Collection Name, andthey must be tab or comma-delimited.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">52 InvalidServerFrom: The Server to copy [v1]=[v2]was not found.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">53 InvalidServerTo: No Server to copy to ([v1]=[v2])was found.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">54 InvalidDeviceFrom: The Device to copy [v1]=[v2]was not found.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">55 InvalidDeviceTo: No Devices to copy to are found.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">56 InvalidDiskFrom: The vDisk to copy [v1]=[v2] wasnot found.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">57 InvalidDiskTo: No vDisk to copy to ([v1]=[v2])was found.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">58 InvalidDiskPath: The path '[v1]' to the vDiskfile is not found.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">59 VDiskFileNotFound: [v1]: vDisk file was notfound.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">60 InvalidDiskServer: There is no Server that canserve the vDisk [v1] or the Store to which this vDisk belongs. Verify that oneor more Servers belonging to the Store are online and that there is sufficientfree space for the operation you are attempting.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">61 InvalidDiskForServer: Server [v1] cannot accessall versions of vDisk [v2], the vDisk was updated on at least one other Server.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">62 SameSiteRequired: Objects within the same Sitemust be selected.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">63 TooFewFields: Not enough fields for a record.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">64 ADerrorDC: Unable to connect to the DomainController (if any) or the default rootDSE. Error code: [v1], message: [v2],provider: [v3].</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">65 ADerrorOU: Unable to get the Organizational Unitsetting (if any). Error code: [v1], message: [v2], provider: [v3].</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">66 ADerrorDefaultContainer: Unable to get thedefault computer accounts container (default location is Active Directoryroot> Computers). Error code: [v1], message: [v2], provider: [v3].</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">67 ADerrorCreate: Unable to create the computeraccount in Active Directory. Ensure the account does not already exist and thatthe appropriate permissions are available to perform this task. Error code:[v1], message: [v2], provider: [v3].</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">68 ADerrorNewAccount: Unable to get the newlycreated Active Directory computer account. Error code: [v1], message: [v2],provider: [v3].</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">69 ADerrorSam: Unable to set the Active DirectorysamAccountName property. Ensure the appropriate permissions exist to performthis task. Error code: [v1], message: [v2], provider: [v3].</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">70 ADerrorUserAccount: Unable to set the ActiveDirectory userAccountControl property. <p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">71 ADerrorSave: Unable to save Active Directorychange. Ensure the appropriate permissions exist to perform this task. Errorcode: [v1], message: [v2], provider: [v3].</span></p>

Ensure the appropriate permissions exist to perform thistask. Error code: [v1], message: [v2], provider: [v3].</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">73 ADerrorAddTrustee: Unable to add trustee (ifany). Error code: [v1], message: [v2], provider: [v3].</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">74 ADerrorEnableAccount: Unable to enable the ActiveDirectory account. Error code: [v1], message: [v3], provider: [v2].</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">75 ADerrorAlreadyExists: The computer name isalready in use. Error code: [v1], message: [v3], provider: [v2]. Select aunique name for this machine.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">76 ADerrorGeneral: A general Active Directory erroroccurred. Error code: [v1], message: [v2], provider: [v3].</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">77 ADerrorDirectorySearch: Unable to find ActiveDirectory items meeting the search criteria entered. Error code: [v1], message:[v2], provider: [v3].</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">78 ADerrorSearchComputerAccount: Unable to performthe computer accounts search. Error code: [v1], message: [v2], provider: [v3].</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.6in;text-indent:-.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">79 ADerrorComputerAccountNotFound: Specifiedcomputer account not found. Error code: [v1], message: [v2], provider: [v3].</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] FarmViewId: GUID of the Farm View to Add allDevices to the Domain.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] FarmViewName: Name of the Farm View to Addall Devices to the Domain.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or one of these required ; resolutions</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] CollectionName: Name of the Collection toAdd all Devices to the Domain.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteViewName: Name of the Site View to Addall Devices to the Domain.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Domain: Domain to add the Device(s) to. Ifnot included, the first Domain Controller found on the Server is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] OrganizationUnit: Organizational Unit toadd the Device(s) to. This parameter is optional. If it is not specified, thedevice is added to the built in Computers container. Child OU's should bedelimited with forward slashes, e.g. "ParentOU/ChildOU". Specialcharacters in an OU name, such as '"', '#', '+', ',', ';', '>', '=',must be escaped with a backslash. For example, an OU called"commaIn,TheMiddle" must be specified as"commaIn\,TheMiddle". The old syntax of delimiting child OU's with acomma is still supported, but deprecated. Note that in this case, the child OUcomes first, e.g. "ChildOU,ParentOU".</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DeviceId, CollectionId, SiteViewId or FarmViewId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to haveconfirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Add-PvsDeviceToDomain for Name with Domain and OrganizationUnit
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Add-PvsDeviceToDomain -Name theDevice -DomaintheDomain -OrganizationUnit theOrganizationUnit</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The Get-PvsDevice output is piped to theAdd-PvsDeviceToDomain.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDevice -Name theDevice -Fields Guid |Add-PvsDeviceToDomain -Domain theDomain -OrganizationUnit theOrganizationUnit</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The Get-PvsFarmView output is piped to theAdd-PvsDeviceToDomain.</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Add-PvsDeviceToDomain -CollectionName theCollection-SiteName theSite -Domain theDomain -OrganizationUnit theOrganizationUnit</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CollectionId can be used instead of CollectionNameso that the SiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The Get-PvsCollection output is piped to theAdd-PvsDeviceToDomain.</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The Get-PvsSiteView output is piped to theAdd-PvsDeviceToDomain.</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid can be used instead of Name so that theSiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>

##Add-PvsDiskLocatorToDevice<a name="_Toc464196109"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Assign a Disk Locator to a Device, a Collection orView.</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] FarmViewName: Name of the Farm View toAssign a Disk Locator to all Devices.</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Domain: Domain the account is a member of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name: Name of the Device for the account.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsADAccount: If successful, the PvsADAccount objectis returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsADAccount
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsADAccount in the Domain named theDomainfor the Device named theDevice.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsADAccount -Domain theDomain -Name theDevice</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the Parameters of an Audit Action.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This required</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">AuditActionId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Name or AuditParameterName: Name of the parameter.Max Length=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Value: Value of the parameter. Max Length=1000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsAuditActionParameter[]: If successful, thePvsAuditActionParameter object(s) are returned.</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsAuditActionParameter for theAuditActionId e8baa554-7c2d-49e5-9f6b-e0bc46179fc7.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuditActionParameter -AuditActionId"e8baa554-7c2d-49e5-9f6b-e0bc46179fc7"</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsAuditActionParameter for theAuditActionId e8baa554-7c2d-49e5-9f6b-e0bc46179fc7 and54ee6180-7fbc-42a2-9499-2e4936f039dc.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuditActionParameter -AuditActionId"e8baa554-7c2d-49e5-9f6b-e0bc46179fc7","54ee6180-7fbc-42a2-9499-2e4936f039dc"</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuditTrail is called and only thePvsAuditTrail.Attachment with bit 4 (Parameters) set are used to callGet-PvsAuditActionParameter.</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Name or AuditPropertyName: Name of the property. MaxLength=50</span></p>

##Get-PvsAuditActionSibling<a name="_Toc464196126"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the Sibling of an Audit Action. It is the 2ndobject involved with the action.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or AuditActionId: GUID of the AuditAction to Get Sibling for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">AuditActionId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid or AuditActionId: GUID of the action.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Type: Type of object that action was performed on.Values are: 1 (AuthGroup), 2 (Collection), 3 (Device), 4 (Disk), 5(DiskLocator), 6 (Farm), 7 (FarmView), 8 (Server), 9 (Site), 10 (SiteView), 11(Store), 12 (System), and 13 (UserGroup)</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ObjectId: GUID of the object of the action.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ObjectName: Name of the object of the action. MaxLength=1000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Path: Path of the object of the action. An exampleis Site\Collection for a Device. Default="" Max Length=101</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteId: GUID of the Site for the object of theaction. 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 when not valid.Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SubId: GUID of the Collection or Store of theaction. 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 when not valid.Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsAuditAction[]: If successful, the PvsAuditActionobject(s) are returned.</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsAuditActionSibling for the AuditActionIde8baa554-7c2d-49e5-9f6b-e0bc46179fc7.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuditActionSibling -Guid"e8baa554-7c2d-49e5-9f6b-e0bc46179fc7"</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get PvsAuditActionSibling for Multiple AuditActionId
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsAuditActionSibling for the AuditActionIde8baa554-7c2d-49e5-9f6b-e0bc46179fc7 and 54ee6180-7fbc-42a2-9499-2e4936f039dc.</span></p>

####EXAMPLE 3: Get PvsAuditActionSibling for Get-PvsAuditTrail Results withSiblings

7020(SetListUserGroupCustomPropertyDelete), and 7021(SetListUserGroupCustomPropertyAdd)</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site to get the AuditTrail for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to get the AuditTrail for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] StoreId: GUID of the Store to get the AuditTrail for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] StoreName: Name of the Store to get theAudit Trail for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">AuditActionId, ParentId, RootId, SiteId,CollectionId, SiteViewId, FarmViewId, ServerId, DeviceId, StoreId orDiskLocatorId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid or AuditActionId: GUID of the action.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Time: Date/Time the action occurred down to themillisecond. Has the date and time including milliseconds. Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">UserName: User that performed the action. MaxLength=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Domain: Domain of the user that performed theaction. Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Type: Type of object that action was performed on.Values are: 0 (Many), 1 (AuthGroup), 2 (Collection), 3 (Device), 4 (Disk), 5(DiskLocator), 6 (Farm), 7 (FarmView), 8 (Server), 9 (Site), 10 (SiteView), 11(Store), 12 (System), and 13 (UserGroup)</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Action: Name of the action taken. This is a numberthat is converted to a string for display. Values are: 1 (AddAuthGroup), 2(AddCollection), 3 (AddDevice), 4 (AddDiskLocator), 5 (AddFarmView), 6(AddServer), 7 (AddSite), 8 (AddSiteView), 9 (AddStore), 10 (AddUserGroup), 11(AddVirtualHostingPool), 12 (AddUpdateTask), 13 (AddDiskUpdateDevice), 1001(DeleteAuthGroup), 1002 (DeleteCollection), 1003 (DeleteDevice), 1004(DeleteDeviceDiskCacheFile), 1005 (DeleteDiskLocator), 1006 (DeleteFarmView),1007 (DeleteServer), 1008 (DeleteServerStore), 1009 (DeleteSite), 1010(DeleteSiteView), 1011 (DeleteStore), 1012 (DeleteUserGroup), 1013(DeleteVirtualHostingPool), 1014 (DeleteUpdateTask), 1015(DeleteDiskUpdateDevice), 1016 (DeleteDiskVersion), 2001(RunAddDeviceToDomain), 2002 (RunApplyAutoUpdate), 2003(RunApplyIncrementalUpdate), 2004 (RunArchiveAuditTrail), 2052(RunCancelDiskMaintenance), 2053 (RunActivateDevice), 2054 (RunAddDiskVersion),2055 (RunExportDisk), 2056 (RunAssignDisk), 2057 (RunRemoveDisk), 2058(RunDiskUpdateStart), 2059 (RunDiskUpdateCancel), 2060 (RunSetOverrideVersion),2061 (RunCancelTask), 2062 (RunClearTask), 2063 (RunForceInventory), 2064RunUpdateBDM, 2065 (RunStartDeviceDiskTempVersionMode), 2066(RunStopDeviceDiskTempVersionMode), 3001 (RunWithReturnCreateDisk), 3002(RunWithReturnCreateDiskStatus), 3003 (RunWithReturnMapDisk), 3004(RunWithReturnRebalanceDevices), 3005 5002(RunByteArrayOutputExportOemLicenses), 6001 (SetAuthGroup), 6002(SetCollection), 6003 (SetDevice), 6004 (SetDisk), 6005 (SetDiskLocator), 6006(SetFarm), 6007 (SetFarmView), 6008 (SetServer), 6009 (SetServerBiosBootstrap),6010 (SetServerBootstrap), 6011 (SetServerStore), 6012 (SetSite), 6013(SetSiteView), 6014 (SetStore), 6015 (SetUserGroup), 6016SetVirtualHostingPool, 6017 SetUpdateTask, 6018 7015(SetListDiskLocatorCustomPropertyAdd), 7016 (SetListServerCustomProperty), 7017(SetListServerCustomPropertyDelete), 7018 (SetListServerCustomPropertyAdd),7019 (SetListUserGroupCustomProperty), 7020(SetListUserGroupCustomPropertyDelete), and 7021 (SetListUserGroupCustomPropertyAdd)</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ObjectId: GUID of the object of the action.Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ObjectName: Name of the object of the action.Default="" Max Length=1000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Path: Path of the object of the action. An exampleis Site\Collection for a Device. Default="" Max Length=101</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteId: GUID of the Site for the object of theaction. 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 when not valid.Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SubId: GUID of the Collection or Store of theaction. 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 when not valid.Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ParentId: GUID of the parent action (one thattriggered this action) if one exists. 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 whennot valid. Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">RootId: GUID of the root action (one that triggeredthis group of actions) if one exists. 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 whennot valid. Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Attachments: An or'ed value that indicates if thereare any details for this action. A value of 15 indicates that there areChildren, Sibling, Parameters and Properties for the action. Values are: 0(None), 1 (Children), 2 (Sibling), 4 (Parameters), and 8 (Properties) Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsAuditTrail[]: If successful, the PvsAuditTrailobject(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsAuditTrail for Farm
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsAuditTrail for the Farm.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuditTrail</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get PvsAuditTrail for FarmView
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsAuditTrail for the FarmView namedtheFarmView.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuditTrail -FarmViewName theFarmView</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Get PvsAuditTrail for Site
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsAuditTrail for the Site named theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuditTrail -SiteName theSite</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 4: Get PvsAuditTrail for SiteView
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsAuditTrail for the SiteView named theSiteViewin the Site named theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuditTrail -SiteViewName theSiteView-SiteName theSite</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteViewId can be used instead of SiteViewName sothat the SiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 5: Get PvsAuditTrail for Collection
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsAuditTrail for the Collection namedtheCollection in the Site named theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuditTrail -CollectionName theCollection-SiteName theSite</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CollectionId can be used instead of CollectionNameso that the SiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 6: Get PvsAuditTrail for Device
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsAuditTrail for the Device namedtheDevice.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuditTrail -DeviceName theDevice</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 7: Get PvsAuditTrail for Device MAC
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsAuditTrail for the Device with MAC02-50-F2-00-00-01.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuditTrail -DeviceMac"02-50-F2-00-00-01"</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 8: Get PvsAuditTrail for Server
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsAuditTrail for the Server namedtheServer.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuditTrail -ServerName theServer</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 9: Get PvsAuditTrail for Store
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsAuditTrail for the Store named theStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuditTrail -StoreName theStore</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 10: Get PvsAuditTrail for DiskLocator
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsAuditTrail for the DiskLocator namedtheDiskLocator in the Site named theSite and Store named theStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuditTrail -DiskLocatorName theDiskLocator-SiteName theSite -StoreName theStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorId can be used instead of DiskLocatorNameso that the SiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 11: Get PvsAuditTrail for User
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsAuditTrail for the User named theUser inDomain theDomain.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuditTrail -UserName theUser -DomainNametheDomain</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 12: Get PvsAuditTrail for January
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsAuditTrail for January.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuditTrail -BeginDate "01/01/201500:00" -EndDate "01/31/2015 23:59"</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 13: Get PvsAuditTrail for DiskLocator and Server Type Actions
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsAuditTrail for 5 (DiskLocator) and 8(Server) type actions.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuditTrail -Type 5 8</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 14: Get PvsAuditTrail for DiskLocator and Server Type Actions
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsAuditTrail for the 1003 (DeleteDevice) and1007 (DeleteServer) actions.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuditTrail -Action 1003 1007</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 15: Get PvsAuditTrail with Children
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the 4fd16fc1-8dcc-4097-be5a-d0485bd7433bPvsAuditTrail and if it has children, the child PvsAuditTrail are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$x = Get-PvsAuditTrail -AuditActionId"4fd16fc1-8dcc-4097-be5a-d0485bd7433b"</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">if (($x.Attachments -band 1) -eq 1) {Get-PvsAuditTrail -ParentId $x.AuditActionId }</span></p>
##Get-PvsAuthGroup<a name="_Toc464196128"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the fields for an AuthGroup, all AuthGroups inthe system, AuthGroups with Farm, Site or Collection Authorization. AllAuthGroups in the system are returned if no parameters are passed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or AuthGroupId: GUID of the AuthGroup toGet.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or AuthGroupName: Name of theAuthGroup to Get.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site to Get allAuthGroups with Authorization for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to Get allAuthGroups with Authorization for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] CollectionId: GUID of the Collection to Getall AuthGroups with Authorization for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or this optional ; resolution</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] CollectionName: Name of the Collection toGet all AuthGroups with Authorization for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Farm: If -Farm is specified,AuthGroups with Farm Authorization should be returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site to Get allAuthGroups with Authorization for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to Get allAuthGroups with Authorization for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the members belowcan be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">AuthGroupId, SiteId or CollectionId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid or AuthGroupId: Read-only GUID that uniquelyidentifies this AuthGroup.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Name or AuthGroupName: Name of the Active Directoryor Windows Group. Max Length=450</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Description: User description. Default=""Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Role: Role of the AuthGroup for a Collection. rolecan only be used with CollectionId or CollectionName. 300 is CollectionAdministrator, and 400 is Collection Operator. Default=999</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsAuthGroup[]: If successful, the PvsAuthGroupobject(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsAuthGroup for System
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsAuthGroup for the System.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuthGroup</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get PvsAuthGroup for Farm
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsAuthGroup for the Farm.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuthGroup</span></p>

##Get-PvsCreateDiskStatus<a name="_Toc464196134"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the Percent Finished for an active CreateDisk.When finished, the PvsDiskLocator created is returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name: Name of the Disk file that is beingcreated.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid StoreId: GUID of the Store that the Disk willbe a member of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string StoreName: Name of the Store that the Diskwill be a member of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">StoreId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">UInt32 or PvsDiskLocator: If not finished, thepercent complete is returned in an UInt32. If finished and successful, thePvsDiskLocator is returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Start-PvsCreateDiskStatus
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This example shows how to useGet-PvsCreateDiskStatus during Start-PvsCreateDisk processing.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$thePvsDiskLocator = Start-PvsCreateDiskStatus -NametheDiskName -Size 20480 -StoreName theStore -SiteName theSite -VHDX -Dynamic</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">while ($thePvsDiskLocator -eq$null)                           #while the create is processing</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">{</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.4in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">%percentFinished = Get-PvsCreateDiskStatus -NametheDiskName -StoreName theStore  # get percent finished orDiskLocator when done</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.4in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">if (%percentFinished.GetType().Name =="PvsDiskLocator")</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.4in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">{</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.8in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$thePvsDiskLocator = %percentFinished</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.4in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">}</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.4in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">else</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.4in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">{</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.8in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">%percentFinished.ToString() + "% finished"                 #display percent finished</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.8in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Start-Sleep -seconds10                                    #wait 10 seconds more</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.4in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">}</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">}</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">"Successful"</span></p>
##Get-PvsDevice<a name="_Toc464196135"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the fields for a Device, all Devices in aCollection, Site, Farm View, or Farm. All Devices are returned if no parametersare passed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or DeviceId: GUID of the Device to Get.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or DeviceName: Name of Device to Get.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsPhysicalAddress[] DeviceMac: MAC of the Device toGet.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] CollectionId: GUID of the Collection to Getall Devices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] ServerId: GUID of the Server to Get allDevices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] ServerName: Name of the Server to Get allDevices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] DiskLocatorId: GUID of the DiskLocator to Getall Devices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteViewId: GUID of the Site View to Get allDevices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] FarmViewId: GUID of the Farm View to Get allDevices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] FarmViewName: Name of the Farm View to Getall Devices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] BdmBoot: Include only the BDM Devices whenset to 1. PXE devices if set to 0. If not included, all Devices are returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or one of these optional ; resolutions</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] CollectionName: Name of the Collection toGet all Devices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] DiskLocatorName: Name of the DiskLocator toGet all Devices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteViewName: Name of the Site View to Getall Devices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] StoreId: GUID of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] StoreName: Name of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DeviceName, CollectionId, ServerId, DiskLocatorId,SiteViewId, SiteId or FarmViewId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid or DeviceId: Read-only GUID that uniquelyidentifies this Device.</span></p>
