<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Name or DeviceName: Computer name with no spaces.ASCII computer name characters Max Length=15</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CollectionId: GUID of the Collection this Device isto be a member of. It is not used with CollectionName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CollectionName: Name of the Collection this Deviceis to be a member of. SiteName or SiteId must also be used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteId: GUID of the Site the CollectionName is to bea member of. This or SiteName is used with CollectionName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteName: Name of the Site the CollectionName is tobe a member of. This or SiteId is used with CollectionName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Description: User description. Default=""Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DeviceMac: Ethernet address can have the formXX-XX-XX-XX-XX-XX. Uniquely identifies the Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">BootFrom: Device to boot from. Choices are 1 forvDisk, 2 for Hard Disk, and 3 for Floppy. This cannot be Set for a Device withPersonal vDisk. Min=1, Max=3, Default=1</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ClassName: Used by Automatic Update feature to matchnew versions of Disks to a Device. This cannot be Set for a Device withPersonal vDisk. Default="" Max Length=41</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Port: UDP port to use with Stream Service. Min=1025,Max=65534, Default=6901</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Enabled: True when it can be booted, falseotherwise. This cannot be Set for a Device with Personal vDisk. Default=true</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LocalDiskEnabled: If there is a local disk menuchoice for the Device, this is true. This cannot be Set for a Device withPersonal vDisk. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Role: Read-only Role of the user for this item. 100is Farm Administrator, 200 is Site Administrator, 300 is CollectionAdministrator, and 400 is Collection Operator. Default=999</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Authentication: Device log in authentication.Choices are 0 for none, 1 for User Name/Password, and 2 for Extern. This cannotbe Set for a Device with Personal vDisk. Min=0, Max=2, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">User: Name of user to authenticate before the bootprocess continues. This cannot be Set for a Device with Personal vDisk.Default="" ASCII Max Length=20</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Password: Password of user to authenticate beforethe boot process continues. This cannot be Set for a Device with PersonalvDisk. Default="" ASCII Max Length=100</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Active: True if the Device is currently active,false otherwise. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Template: True if the Device is the template in itsCollection, false otherwise. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">AdTimestamp: The time the Active Directory machineaccount password was generated. Do not set this field, it is only setinternally by PVS. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">AdSignature: The signature of the Active Directorymachine account password. Do not set this field, it is only set internally byPVS. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LogLevel: Level to perform logging at. Values are: 0(None), 1 (Fatal), 2 (Error), 3 (Warning), 4 (Info), 5 (Debug), and 6 (Trace).Min=0, Max=6, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DomainName: Fully qualified name of the domain thatthe Device belongs to. Do not set this field, it is only set internally by PVS.Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DomainObjectSID: The value of the objectSID ADattribute of the same name for the Device's computer account. Do not set thisfield, it is only set internally by PVS. Default="" Max Length=186</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DomainControllerName: The name of the DC used tocreate the host's computer account. Do not set this field, it is only setinternally by PVS. Default="" Max Length=4000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DomainTimeCreated: The time that the computeraccount was created. Has the date and time including milliseconds. Do not setthis field, it is only set internally by PVS. Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Type: 1 when it performs test of Disks, 2 when itperforms maintenance on Disks, 3 when it has a Personal vDisk, 4 when it has aPersonal vDisk and performs tests, 0 otherwise. Min=0, Max=4, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvdDriveLetter: Read-only Personal vDisk Driveletter. Range is E to U and W to Z. Default="" Max Length=1</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LocalWriteCacheDiskSize: The size in GB to formatthe Device cache file disk. If the value is 0, then the disk is not formatted.Min=0, Max=2048, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">VirtualHostingPoolId: GUID that uniquely identifiesthe Virtual Hosting Pool for a VM. This is needed when Adding a VM device.Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">TemporaryVersionSet: Read-only true when temporaryversion is set. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">BdmBoot: Use PXE boot when set to false, BDM bootwhen set to true. Default is PXE Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">BdmType: Use PXE boot when set to 0, BDM (Bios) bootwhen set to 1 and BDM (Uefi) boot when set to 2.  Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">BdmFormat: 1 use VHD for BDMboot, 2 use ISO, 3 useUSB. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">BdmUpdated: Timestamp of the last BDM boot diskupdate. Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">BdmCreated: Timstamp when BDM device wascreated  Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">XsPvsProxyUuid: UUID of XenServer PVS_proxyDefault=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">XsPvsProxyEnabled: Enable XenServer PVS proxy whenset to true Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsDevice[]: If successful, the PvsDevice object(s)are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsDevice for Farm
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDevice for the Farm.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDevice</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get PvsDevice for FarmView
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDevice for the FarmView namedtheFarmView.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDevice -FarmViewName theFarmView</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Get PvsDevice for Site
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDevice for the Site named theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDevice -SiteName theSite</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 4: Get PvsDevice for SiteView
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDevice for the SiteView named theSiteViewin the Site named theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDevice -SiteViewName theSiteView -SiteNametheSite</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteViewId can be used instead of SiteViewName sothat the SiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 5: Get PvsDevice for Collection
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDevice for the Collection namedtheCollection in the Site named theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDevice -CollectionName theCollection-SiteName theSite</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CollectionId can be used instead of CollectionNameso that the SiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 6: Get PvsDevice for DiskLocator
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDevice for the DiskLocator namedtheDiskLocator in the Site named theSite and Store named theStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDevice -DiskLocatorName theDiskLocator-SiteName theSite -StoreName theStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorId can be used instead of DiskLocatorNameso that the SiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 7: Get PvsDevice for Device
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsDevice for the Device named theDevice.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDevice -Name theDevice</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 8: Get PvsDevice and Enable
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDevice that are not Enabled and thenEnables them.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDevice -Fields Enabled | Where-Object{$_.Enabled -eq $false} | foreach { $o = $_; $o.Enabled = $true; $o } |Set-PvsDevice</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The "foreach { $o = $_; $o.X = Y; $o }"sets the field X to value Y and returns the object again so it can be piped tothe Set command for update.</span></p>
##Get-PvsDeviceBootstrap<a name="_Toc464196136"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all Bootstrap files for a Device, and theMenuText for each.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or DeviceId: GUID of the Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or DeviceName: Name of the Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsPhysicalAddress[] DeviceMac: MAC of the Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DeviceId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">These fields exist in the DeviceBootstrap arraywithin each PvsDeviceBootstrap returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Each array item is a PvsDeviceBootstrapList object.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Name or Bootstrap: Name of the bootstrap file. Max Length=259</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MenuText: Text that is displayed in the Boot Menu.If this field has no value, the bootstrap value is used. Default=""ASCII Max Length=64</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsDeviceBootstrap[]: If successful, thePvsDeviceBootstrap object(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsDeviceBootstrap for Device
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDeviceBootstrap for the Device namedtheDevice.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceBootstrap -Name theDevice</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get PvsDeviceBootstrap for Device MAC
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDeviceBootstrap for the Device with MAC02-50-F2-00-00-01.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceBootstrap -DeviceMac"02-50-F2-00-00-01"</span></p>
##Get-PvsDeviceCount<a name="_Toc464196137"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get count of Devices in a Collection or View.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid CollectionId: GUID of the Collection to get theDevice Count of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid SiteViewId: GUID of the Site View to get theDevice Count of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid FarmViewId: GUID of the Farm View to get theDevice Count of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string FarmViewName: Name of the Farm View to getthe Device Count of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or one of these required ; resolutions</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string CollectionName: Name of the Collection to getthe Device Count of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string SiteViewName: Name of the Site View to getthe Device Count of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid SiteId: GUID of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string SiteName: Name of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CollectionId, SiteViewId or FarmViewId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">UInt32: If successful, the numeric value is returned</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get-PvsDeviceCount Returns the Number (or Count) of PvsDevice inPvsCollection
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceCount -CollectionName theCollection-SiteName theSite</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CollectionId can be used instead of CollectionNameso that the SiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get-PvsDeviceCount Returns the Number (or Count) of PvsDevice inPvsFarmView
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceCount -FarmViewName theFarmView</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Get-PvsDeviceCount Returns the Number (or Count) of PvsDevice inPvsSiteView
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceCount -SiteViewName theSiteView-SiteName theSite</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteViewId can be used instead of SiteViewName sothat the SiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>
##Get-PvsDeviceDiskLocatorEnabled<a name="_Toc464196138"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Return true if a Device/DiskLocator is enabled.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid Guid or DeviceId: Device GUID, to see if theDiskLocator for it is enabled.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or DeviceName: Device name, to see ifthe DiskLocator for it is enabled.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsPhysicalAddress[] DeviceMac: MAC of the Device,to see if the DiskLocator for it is enabled.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid DiskLocatorId: DiskLocator GUID, to see if itis enabled for the Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or this required ; resolution</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string DiskLocatorName: DiskLocator name, to see ifit is enabled for the Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid StoreId: GUID of the Store that is needed whena DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string StoreName: Name of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DeviceId or DiskLocatorId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">String: If successful, the String value is returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get-PvsDeviceDiskLocatorEnabled Determine ifPvsDevice/PvsDiskLocator is Enabled
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceDiskLocatorEnabled -Name theDevice-DiskLocatorName theDiskLocator -StoreName theStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorId can be used instead of DiskLocatorNameso that the StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
##Get-PvsDeviceDiskTempVersion<a name="_Toc464196139"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get Temporary Disk Version information for a Device,DiskLocator, Disk Version, Site or Farm.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or DeviceId: GUID of the Device to getthe temporary disk version information for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or DeviceName: Name of the Device toget the temporary disk version information for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsPhysicalAddress[] DeviceMac: MAC of the Device toget the temporary disk version information for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site to get temporarydisk version information for, and also resolution for DiskLocatorName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to get temporarydisk version information for, and also resolution for DiskLocatorName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] DiskLocatorId: GUID of the Disk Locator toget temporary disk version information for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or this optional ; resolution</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] DiskLocatorName: Name of the Disk Locatorto get temporary disk version information for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This optional ; resolution</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Version: Version of the DiskLocatorspecified to get temporary disk version information for. Needs theDiskLocatorId or DiskLocatorName too.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site to get temporarydisk version information for, and also resolution for DiskLocatorName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to get temporarydisk version information for, and also resolution for DiskLocatorName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] StoreId: GUID of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] StoreName: Name of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DeviceId, SiteId or DiskLocatorId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid or DeviceId: Read-only GUID that uniquelyidentifies the Device with temporary version.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Name or DeviceName: Read-only Computer name thatuniquely identifies the Device with temporary version. ASCII computer namecharacters</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorId: Read-only GUID that uniquelyidentifies then Disk Locator with temporary version.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorName: Read-only Name of the Disk LocatorFile with temporary version. It is unique within the Store. ASCII</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteId: Read-only GUID of the Site the Device andDiskLocator are a member of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteName: Read-only Name of the Site the Device andDiskLocator are a member of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">StoreId: Read-only GUID of the Store that the DiskLocator is a member of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">StoreName: Read-only Name of the Store that the DiskLocator is a member of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Version: Read-only Disk version the temporary isfor.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsDeviceDiskTempVersion[]: If successful, the PvsDeviceDiskTempVersionobject(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsDeviceDiskTempVersion for Device
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsDeviceDiskTempVersion for the Devicenamed theDevice.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceDiskTempVersion -Name theDevice</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get PvsDeviceDiskTempVersion for DiskLocator
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDeviceDiskTempVersion for the DiskLocatornamed theDiskLocator in the Site named theSite and Store named theStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceDiskTempVersion -DiskLocatorNametheDiskLocator -SiteName theSite -StoreName theStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorId can be used instead of DiskLocatorNameso that the SiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Get PvsDeviceDiskTempVersion for DiskLocator with Version
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceDiskTempVersion -DiskLocatorNametheDiskLocator -Version 4 -SiteName theSite -StoreName theStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorId can be used instead of DiskLocatorNameso that the StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 4: Get PvsDeviceDiskTempVersion for Site
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDeviceDiskTempVersion for the Site namedtheSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceDiskTempVersion -SiteName theSite</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 5: Get PvsDeviceDiskTempVersion for Farm
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDeviceDiskTempVersion for the Farm.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceDiskTempVersion</span></p>
##Get-PvsDeviceInfo<a name="_Toc464196140"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the fields and status for a Device, all Devicesin a Collection, Site, Farm View, or Farm. All Devices are returned if noparameters are passed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or DeviceId: GUID of the Device to Get.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or DeviceName: Name of Device to Get.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsPhysicalAddress[] DeviceMac: MAC of the Device toGet.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] CollectionId: GUID of the Collection to Getall Devices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] ServerId: GUID of the Server to Get allDevices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] ServerName: Name of the Server to Get allDevices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] DiskLocatorId: GUID of the DiskLocator to Getall Devices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteViewId: GUID of the Site View to Get allDevices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] FarmViewId: GUID of the Farm View to Get allDevices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] FarmViewName: Name of the Farm View to Getall Devices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] BdmBoot: Include only the BDM Devices whenset to 1. PXE devices if set to 0. If not included, all Devices are returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or one of these optional ; resolutions</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] CollectionName: Name of the Collection toGet all Devices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] DiskLocatorName: Name of the DiskLocator toGet all Devices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteViewName: Name of the Site View to Getall Devices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter OnlyActive: If -OnlyActive isspecified, include only the active Devices, otherwise all Devices are returned.Only active Devices are always returned for ServerId, ServerName, or version.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint MakLicenseActivated: Optional MAK licensingindicator value to only return active Devices for. Values are: 0 (MAK notused), 1 (Not Activated), 2 (Activated).</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Version: Version of the Disk to Get all activeDevices for. This is used with DiskLocatorId or DiskLocatorName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] StoreId: GUID of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] StoreName: Name of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DeviceName, CollectionId, ServerId, DiskLocatorId,SiteViewId, SiteId or FarmViewId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid or DeviceId: Read-only GUID that uniquelyidentifies this Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Name or DeviceName: Computer name with no spaces.ASCII computer name characters Max Length=15</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CollectionId: GUID of the Collection this Device isto be a member of. It is not used with CollectionName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CollectionName: Name of the Collection this Deviceis to be a member of. SiteName or SiteId must also be used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteId: GUID of the Site the CollectionName is to bea member of. This or SiteName is used with CollectionName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteName: Name of the Site the CollectionName is tobe a member of. This or SiteId is used with CollectionName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Description: User description. Default=""Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DeviceMac: Ethernet address can have the formXX-XX-XX-XX-XX-XX. Uniquely identifies the Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">BootFrom: Device to boot from. Choices are 1 forvDisk, 2 for Hard Disk, and 3 for Floppy. This cannot be Set for a Device withPersonal vDisk. Min=1, Max=3, Default=1</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ClassName: Used by Automatic Update feature to matchnew versions of Disks to a Device. This cannot be Set for a Device withPersonal vDisk. Default="" Max Length=41</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Port: UDP port to use with Stream Service. Min=1025,Max=65534, Default=6901</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Enabled: True when it can be booted, falseotherwise. This cannot be Set for a Device with Personal vDisk. Default=true</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LocalDiskEnabled: If there is a local disk menuchoice for the Device, this is true. This cannot be Set for a Device withPersonal vDisk. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Role: Read-only Role of the user for this item. 100is Farm Administrator, 200 is Site Administrator, 300 is CollectionAdministrator, and 400 is Collection Operator. Default=999</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Authentication: Device log in authentication.Choices are 0 for none, 1 for User Name/Password, and 2 for Extern. This cannotbe Set for a Device with Personal vDisk. Min=0, Max=2, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">User: Name of user to authenticate before the bootprocess continues. This cannot be Set for a Device with Personal vDisk.Default="" ASCII Max Length=20</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Password: Password of user to authenticate beforethe boot process continues. This cannot be Set for a Device with PersonalvDisk. Default="" ASCII Max Length=100</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Active: True if the Device is currently active,false otherwise. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Template: True if the Device is the template in itsCollection, false otherwise. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">AdTimestamp: The time the Active Directory machineaccount password was generated. Do not set this field, it is only setinternally by PVS. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">AdSignature: The signature of the Active Directorymachine account password. Do not set this field, it is only set internally byPVS. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LogLevel: Level to perform logging at. Values are: 0(None), 1 (Fatal), 2 (Error), 3 (Warning), 4 (Info), 5 (Debug), and 6 (Trace).Min=0, Max=6, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DomainName: Fully qualified name of the domain thatthe Device belongs to. Do not set this field, it is only set internally by PVS.Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DomainObjectSID: The value of the objectSID ADattribute of the same name for the Device's computer account. Do not set thisfield, it is only set internally by PVS. Default="" Max Length=186</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DomainControllerName: The name of the DC used tocreate the host's computer account. Do not set this field, it is only setinternally by PVS. Default="" Max Length=4000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DomainTimeCreated: The time that the computeraccount was created. Has the date and time including milliseconds. Do not setthis field, it is only set internally by PVS. Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Type: 1 when it performs test of Disks, 2 when itperforms maintenance on Disks, 3 when it has a Personal vDisk, 4 when it has aPersonal vDisk and performs tests, 0 otherwise. Min=0, Max=4, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvdDriveLetter: Read-only Personal vDisk Driveletter. Range is E to U and W to Z. Default="" Max Length=1</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LocalWriteCacheDiskSize: The size in GB to formatthe Device cache file disk. If the value is 0, then the disk is not formatted.Min=0, Max=2048, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">VirtualHostingPoolId: GUID that uniquely identifiesthe Virtual Hosting Pool for a VM. This is needed when Adding a VM device.Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">TemporaryVersionSet: Read-only true when temporaryversion is set. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">BdmBoot: Use PXE boot when set to false, BDM bootwhen set to true. Default is PXE Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">BdmType: Use PXE boot when set to 0, BDM (Bios) bootwhen set to 1 and BDM (Uefi) boot when set to 2.  Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">BdmFormat: 1 use VHD for BDMboot, 2 use ISO, 3 useUSB. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">BdmUpdated: Timestamp of the last BDM boot diskupdate. Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">BdmCreated: Timstamp when BDM device was created  Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">XsPvsProxyUuid: UUID of XenServer PVS_proxyDefault=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">XsPvsProxyEnabled: Enable XenServer PVS proxy whenset to true Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Ip: Read-only IP of the Device. It is equal to0.0.0.0 if the Device is not active.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerPortConnection: Read-only Port of the Serverthat the Device is using. It is equal to 0 if the Device is not active.Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerIpConnection: Read-only IP of the Server thatthe Device is using. It is equal to 0.0.0.0 if the Device is not active.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerId: Read-only GUID of the Server that theDevice is using. It is equal to 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 if theDevice is not active.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerName: Read-only Name of the Server that theDevice is using. It is equal to "" if the Device is not active.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorId: Read-only GUID of the Disk Locatorthat the Device is using. It is equal to 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000if the Device is not active.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorName: Read-only name of the Disk LocatorFile that the Device is using. It is equal to the list of Disk Locator namesfor the Device if the Device is not active.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskVersion: Read-only version of the Disk LocatorFile that the Device is using. It is equal to 0 if the Device is not active.Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskVersionAccess: State of the Disk Version. Valuesare: 0 (Production), 1 (Maintenance), 2 (MaintenanceHighestVersion), 3(Override), 4 (Merge), 5 (MergeMaintenance), 6 (MergeTest), and 7 (Test). It isequal to 0 if the Device is not active. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskFileName: Name of the Disk File including theextension. It is equal to "" if the Device is not active.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Status: 1 or 2 numbers in the format n,n. They arethe number of retries and if ram cache is being used, ram cache percent used.It is equal to "" if the Device is not active.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LicenseType: 0 when None, 1 for Desktop, 2 forServer, 5 for OEM SmartClient, 6 for XenApp, 7 for XenDesktop. It is equal to 0if the Device is not active. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MakLicenseActivated: Read-only indicator if MAKlicensing is being used and is activated. Values are: 0 (MAK not used), 1 (NotActivated), 2 (Activated). It is equal to 0 if the Device is not active.Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Model: Oem Only: Read-only model of the computer.Values are OptiPlex 745, 755, 320, 760, FX160, or Default. It is equal to"" if the Device is not active.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">License: Oem Only: Read-only type of the license.Values are 0 when None, 1 or 2 when Desktop. It is equal to 0 if the Device isnot active. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsDeviceInfo[]: If successful, the PvsDeviceInfoobject(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsDeviceInfo for Farm
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDeviceInfo for the Farm.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceInfo</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get PvsDeviceInfo for FarmView
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDeviceInfo for the FarmView namedtheFarmView.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceInfo -FarmViewName theFarmView</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Get PvsDeviceInfo for Site
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDeviceInfo for the Site named theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceInfo -SiteName theSite</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 4: Get PvsDeviceInfo for SiteView
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDeviceInfo for the SiteView namedtheSiteView in the Site named theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceInfo -SiteViewName theSiteView-SiteName theSite</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteViewId can be used instead of SiteViewName sothat the SiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 5: Get PvsDeviceInfo for Collection
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDeviceInfo for the Collection namedtheCollection in the Site named theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceInfo -CollectionName theCollection-SiteName theSite</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CollectionId can be used instead of CollectionNameso that the SiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 6: Get PvsDeviceInfo for DiskLocator
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDeviceInfo for the DiskLocator namedtheDiskLocator in the Site named theSite and Store named theStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceInfo -DiskLocatorName theDiskLocator-SiteName theSite -StoreName theStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorId can be used instead of DiskLocatorNameso that the SiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 7: Get PvsDeviceInfo for Device
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsDeviceInfo for the Device namedtheDevice.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceInfo -Name theDevice</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 8: Get PvsDeviceInfo and Enable
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDeviceInfo that are not Enabled and thenEnables them.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceInfo -Fields Enabled | Where-Object{$_.Enabled -eq $false} | foreach { $o = $_; $o.Enabled = $true; $o } |Set-PvsDevice</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The "foreach { $o = $_; $o.X = Y; $o }"sets the field X to value Y and returns the object again so it can be piped tothe Set command for update.</span></p>
##Get-PvsDevicePersonality<a name="_Toc464196141"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the Device Personality names and values.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or DeviceId: GUID of the Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or DeviceName: Name of the Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsPhysicalAddress[] DeviceMac: MAC of the Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DeviceId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">These fields exist in the DevicePersonality arraywithin each PvsDevicePersonality returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Each array item is a PvsDevicePersonalityListobject.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Name: Name of the Device personality item. MaxLength=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Value: Value for the Device personality item. MaxLength=1000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsDevicePersonality[]: If successful, thePvsDevicePersonality object(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsDevicePersonality for Device
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDevicePersonality for the Device namedtheDevice.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDevicePersonality -Name theDevice</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get PvsDevicePersonality for Device MAC
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDevicePersonality for the Device with MAC02-50-F2-00-00-01.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDevicePersonality -DeviceMac"02-50-F2-00-00-01"</span></p>
##Get-PvsDeviceStatus<a name="_Toc464196142"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the DeviceStatus fields for a Device or allDevices for a Server, Disk Locator, or Farm. All Devices are returned if noparameters are passed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or DeviceId: GUID of the Device to Getstatus for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or DeviceName: Name of Device to Getstatus for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsPhysicalAddress[] DeviceMac: MAC of the Device toGet status for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] ServerId: GUID of the Server to Get allDevice Status for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] ServerName: Name of the Server to Get allDevice Status for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] DiskLocatorId: GUID of the Disk Locator toGet all DeviceStatus for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] CollectionId: GUID of the Collection to Getall DeviceStatus for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or one of these optional ; resolutions</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] DiskLocatorName: Name of the Disk LocatorFile to Get all DeviceStatus for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] CollectionName: Name of the Collection toGet all DeviceStatus for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] StoreId: GUID of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] StoreName: Name of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DeviceId, ServerId, DiskLocatorId or CollectionId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid or DeviceId: Read-only GUID of the Device. Canbe used with Get Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Name or DeviceName: Read-only Name of the Device.Can be used with Get Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Ip: Read-only IP of the Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerPortConnection: Read-only Port of the Serverthat the Device is using. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerIpConnection: Read-only IP of the Server thatthe Device is using.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerId: Read-only GUID of the Server that theDevice is using.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerName: Read-only Name of the Server that the Deviceis using.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorId: Read-only GUID of the Disk Locatorthat the Device is using.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorName: Read-only name of the Disk LocatorFile that the Device is using.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskVersion: Read-only version of the Disk LocatorFile that the Device is using. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskVersionAccess: State of the Disk Version. Valuesare: 0 (Production), 1 (Maintenance), 2 (MaintenanceHighestVersion), 3(Override), 4 (Merge), 5 (MergeMaintenance), 6 (MergeTest), and 7 (Test)Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskFileName: Name of the Disk File including theextension.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Status: 1 or 2 numbers in the format n,n. They arethe number of retries and if ram cache is being used, ram cache percent used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LicenseType: 0 when None, 1 for Desktop, 2 forServer, 5 for OEM SmartClient, 6 for XenApp, 7 for XenDesktop. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MakLicenseActivated: Read-only indicator if MAKlicensing is being used and is activated. Values are: 0 (MAK not used), 1 (NotActivated), 2 (Activated). Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsDeviceStatus[]: If successful, thePvsDeviceStatus object(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsDeviceStatus for Farm
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDeviceStatus for the Farm.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceStatus</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get PvsDeviceStatus for FarmView
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDeviceStatus for the FarmView namedtheFarmView.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceStatus -FarmViewName theFarmView</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Get PvsDeviceStatus for Site
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDeviceStatus for the Site named theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceStatus -SiteName theSite</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 4: Get PvsDeviceStatus for SiteView
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDeviceStatus for the SiteView namedtheSiteView in the Site named theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceStatus -SiteViewName theSiteView-SiteName theSite</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteViewId can be used instead of SiteViewName sothat the SiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 5: Get PvsDeviceStatus for Collection
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDeviceStatus for the Collection namedtheCollection in the Site named theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceStatus -CollectionName theCollection-SiteName theSite</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CollectionId can be used instead of CollectionNameso that the SiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 6: Get PvsDeviceStatus for DiskLocator
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDeviceStatus for the DiskLocator namedtheDiskLocator in the Site named theSite and Store named theStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceStatus -DiskLocatorName theDiskLocator-SiteName theSite -StoreName theStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorId can be used instead of DiskLocatorNameso that the SiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 7: Get PvsDeviceStatus for Device
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsDeviceStatus for the Device namedtheDevice.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDeviceStatus -Name theDevice</span></p>
##Get-PvsDirectory<a name="_Toc464196143"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Look for Directories or Drives on the Serverspecified. Return a String array of the Directories or Drives found.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid Guid or ServerId: GUID of the Server to get alist of Directories or Drives.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or ServerName: Name of the Server to geta list of Directories or Drives.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Path: Path to get list of Directories for. Ifnot specified, the Drives are returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[]: If successful, the array of directorynames is returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get-PvsDirectory for Name
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDirectory -Name theServer -Path"C:\directory"</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get-PvsDirectory for PvsServer Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The Get-PvsServer output is piped to theGet-PvsDirectory.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsServer -Name theServer -Fields Guid |Get-PvsDirectory -Path "C:\directory"</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
##Get-PvsDisk<a name="_Toc464196144"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the fields for a single disk.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or DiskLocatorId: GUID of the DiskLocator.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or this required ; resolution</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or DiskLocatorName: Name of the DiskLocator.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] StoreId: GUID of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] StoreName: Name of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Class: Class of the Disk. Max Length=40</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ImageType: Type of this image (software type). MaxLength=40</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskSize: Read-only size of the image. The value is0 when it is not available. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">VhdBlockSize: Block size in KB. For VHD it is onlyused with Dynamic type. Tested sizes for VHD are 512, 2048, and 16384. VHDMin=512, Max=16384, Default=2048. For VHDX it is used for all types. Testedsize for VHDX is 32768. VHDX Min=1024, Max= 262144, Default=32768. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LogicalSectorSize: Logical Sector Size. Values are:512, 4096, Default=512</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">WriteCacheSize: RAM cache size (MB). Not 0 when usedwith Cache in Device RAM, and Cache in Device RAM with Overflow on Hard Disk. Avalue of 0 will disable the RAM use for Cache in Device RAM with Overflow onHard Disk. Min=0, Max=131072, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">AutoUpdateEnabled: Automatically update this imagefor matching Devices when set to true. Default false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ActivationDateEnabled: Use activation date toactivate image when set to true. Default false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">AdPasswordEnabled: Enable AD password managementwhen set to true.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">HaEnabled: Enable HA when set to true.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PrinterManagementEnabled: Invalid printers will bedeleted from the Device when set to true.</span></p>
