<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">WriteCacheType: 0 (Private), (other values arestandard image) 1 (Cache on Server), 3 (Cache in Device RAM), 4 (Cache onDevice Hard Disk), 6 (Device RAM Disk), 7 (Cache on Server, Persistent), or 9(Cache in Device RAM with Overflow on Hard Disk). Min=0, Max=9, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LicenseMode: 0 (None), 1 (Multiple Activation Key),or 2 (Key Management Service). Min=0, Max=2, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ActiveDate: Date to activate the disk ifAutoUpdateEnabled and activationDateEnabled are true. Has the date. Empty whenthe AutoUpdateEnabled or activationDateEnabled are false.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LongDescription: Description of the Disk. MaxLength=399</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SerialNumber: User defined serial number. MaxLength=36</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Date: User defined date. Max Length=40</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Author: User defined author. Max Length=40</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Title: User defined title. Max Length=40</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Company: User defined company. Max Length=40</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">InternalName: User defined name. Max Length=63</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">OriginalFile: User defined original file. MaxLength=127</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">HardwareTarget: User defined hardware target. MaxLength=127</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MajorRelease: User defined major release number.Min=0, Max=4294967295, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MinorRelease: User defined minor release number.Min=0, Max=4294967295, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Build: User defined build number. Min=0,Max=4294967295, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">VHDX: If VHDX is true, the format of the image isVHDX. Otherwise it is VHD. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsDisk[]: If successful, the PvsDisk object(s) arereturned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsDisk for DiskLocator
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsDisk for the DiskLocator namedtheDiskLocator in the Site named theSite and Store named theStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDisk -Name theDiskLocator -SiteName theSite-StoreName theStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid can be used instead of Name so that theSiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
##Get-PvsDiskInfo<a name="_Toc464196145"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the fields for a Disk and Disk Locator or allDisks and Disk Locators for a Device, Server, Store, Site, or Farm. All Disksand DiskLocators are returned if no parameters are passed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or DiskLocatorId: GUID of the DiskLocator to Get.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] DeviceId: GUID of the Device to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] DeviceName: Name of the Device to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsPhysicalAddress[] DeviceMac: MAC of the Device toGet all DiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] ServerId: GUID of the Server to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] ServerName: Name of the Server to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] UpdateTaskId: GUID of the Update Task to Getall DiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or one of these optional ; resolutions</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or DiskLocatorName: Name of the DiskLocator File to Get.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] StoreId: GUID of the Store to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] StoreName: Name of the Store to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] UpdateTaskName: Name of the Update Task toGet all DiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Single: If -Single is specified,include single server connection. If this and All are not included, bothconnection types are included.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter All: If -All is specified, includeall server connections for the store. If this and Single are not included, bothconnection types are included.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter OnlyActive: If -OnlyActive isspecified, include only the active DiskLocators. If not included, allDiskLocators are returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter UpdateDevice: If -UpdateDevice isspecified, include only DiskLocators that have an Update Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] StoreId: GUID of the Store to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] StoreName: Name of the Store to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorId, DeviceId, ServerId, UpdateTaskId orSiteId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid or DiskLocatorId: Read-only GUID that uniquelyidentifies this Disk Locator.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Name or DiskLocatorName: Name of the Disk LocatorFile. It is unique within the Store. ASCII Max Length=52</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteId: GUID of the Site this DiskLocator is to be amember of. It is not used with SiteName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteName: Name of the Site this DiskLocator is to bea member of. It is not used with SiteId.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">StoreId: GUID of the Store that this Disk Locator isa member of. SiteName or SiteId must also be used. It is not used withStoreName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">StoreName: Name of the Store that this Disk Locatoris a member of. SiteName or SiteId must also be used. It is not used withStoreId.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Description: User description. Default=""Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MenuText: Text that is displayed in the Boot Menu.If this field has no value, the name value is used. Default="" ASCIIMax Length=64</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerId: GUID of the single Server that this DiskLocator is assigned to. It is not used with ServerName.Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerName: Name of the single Server that this DiskLocator is assigned to. It is not used with ServerId. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Enabled: True when this disk can be booted, falseotherwise. Default=true</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Role: Read-only Role of the user for this item. 100is Farm Administrator, 200 is Site Administrator, 300 is CollectionAdministrator, and 999 is read-only. Default=999</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Mapped: True if the Disk is currently mapped, falseotherwise. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">EnabledForDevice: True when this disk is enabled forthe Device specified, false otherwise. This is only returned when a Device isspecified. Default=true</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Active: True if the DiskLocator is currently active,false otherwise. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">RebalanceEnabled: True when this Server canautomatically rebalance Devices, false otherwise. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">RebalanceTriggerPercent: Percent over fair load thattriggers a dynamic Device rebalance. Min=5, Max=5000, Default=25</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SubnetAffinity: Qualifier for subnet affinity whenassigning a Server. 0=None, 1=Best Effort, 2=Fixed. Min=0, Max=2, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskUpdateDeviceId: GUID of the DiskUpdateDevicethat is used when updates are performed.Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskUpdateDeviceName: Name of the DiskUpdateDevicethat is used when updates are performed. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">TemporaryVersionSet: Read-only true when temporaryversion(s) are set. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Class: Class of the Disk. Max Length=40</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ImageType: Type of this image (software type). MaxLength=40</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskSize: Read-only size of the image. The value is0 when it is not available. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">VhdBlockSize: Block size in KB. For VHD it is onlyused with Dynamic type. Tested sizes for VHD are 512, 2048, and 16384. VHDMin=512, Max=16384, Default=2048. For VHDX it is used for all types. Testedsize for VHDX is 32768. VHDX Min=1024, Max= 262144, Default=32768. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LogicalSectorSize: Logical Sector Size. Values are:512, 4096, Default=512</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">WriteCacheSize: RAM cache size (MB). Not 0 when usedwith Cache in Device RAM, and Cache in Device RAM with Overflow on Hard Disk. Avalue of 0 will disable the RAM use for Cache in Device RAM with Overflow onHard Disk. Min=0, Max=131072, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">AutoUpdateEnabled: Automatically update this imagefor matching Devices when set to true. Default false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ActivationDateEnabled: Use activation date toactivate image when set to true. Default false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">AdPasswordEnabled: Enable AD password managementwhen set to true.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">HaEnabled: Enable HA when set to true.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PrinterManagementEnabled: Invalid printers will bedeleted from the Device when set to true.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">WriteCacheType: 0 (Private), (other values arestandard image) 1 (Cache on Server), 3 (Cache in Device RAM), 4 (Cache onDevice Hard Disk), 6 (Device RAM Disk), 7 (Cache on Server, Persistent), or 9(Cache in Device RAM with Overflow on Hard Disk). Min=0, Max=9, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LicenseMode: 0 (None), 1 (Multiple Activation Key),or 2 (Key Management Service). Min=0, Max=2, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ActiveDate: Date to activate the disk ifAutoUpdateEnabled and activationDateEnabled are true. Has the date. Empty whenthe AutoUpdateEnabled or activationDateEnabled are false.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LongDescription: Description of the Disk. MaxLength=399</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SerialNumber: User defined serial number. MaxLength=36</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Date: User defined date. Max Length=40</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Author: User defined author. Max Length=40</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Title: User defined title. Max Length=40</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Company: User defined company. Max Length=40</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">InternalName: User defined name. Max Length=63</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">OriginalFile: User defined original file. MaxLength=127</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">HardwareTarget: User defined hardware target. MaxLength=127</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MajorRelease: User defined major release number.Min=0, Max=4294967295, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MinorRelease: User defined minor release number.Min=0, Max=4294967295, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Build: User defined build number. Min=0,Max=4294967295, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">VHDX: If VHDX is true, the format of the image isVHDX. Otherwise it is VHD. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DeviceCount: Read-only count of Devices. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Locked: True if the Disk is currently locked, falseotherwise. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsDiskInfo[]: If successful, the PvsDiskInfoobject(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsDiskInfo for Farm
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDiskInfo for the Farm.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskInfo</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get PvsDiskInfo for Site
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDiskInfo for the Site named theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskInfo -SiteName theSite</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Get PvsDiskInfo for Site and Store
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDiskInfo for the Site named theSite andStore named theStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskInfo -SiteName theSite -StoreNametheStore</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 4: Get PvsDiskInfo for DiskLocator
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsDiskInfo for the DiskLocator namedtheDiskLocator in the Site named theSite and Store named theStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskInfo -Name theDiskLocator -SiteNametheSite -StoreName theStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid can be used instead of Name so that theSiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 5: Get PvsDiskInfo and Enable
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDiskInfo that are not Enabled and thenEnables them.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskInfo -Fields Enabled | Where-Object{$_.Enabled -eq $false} | foreach { $o = $_; $o.Enabled = $true; $o } |Set-PvsDiskLocator</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The "foreach { $o = $_; $o.X = Y; $o }"sets the field X to value Y and returns the object again so it can be piped tothe Set command for update.</span></p>
##Get-PvsDiskInventory<a name="_Toc464196146"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the fields for Inventory Status of a DiskVersion or all Disk Versions for a Disk Locator.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or DiskLocatorId: GUID of the DiskLocator to Get Disk Version Inventory of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or this required ; resolution</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or DiskLocatorName: Name of the DiskLocator to Get Disk Version Inventory of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Version: Specific Version to Get.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] StoreId: GUID of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] StoreName: Name of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">(DiskLocatorId and Version) or DiskLocatorId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Version: Version number. The base disk is version 0,the other version numbers are in part of the file name.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerId: GUID of the Server that the Disk VersionInventory is being reported about.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerName: Name of the Server that the Disk VersionInventory is being reported about.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">FilePath: Path used to access the disk version fromthe Server. Empty if the information is not available.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">FileTime: Date/Time of the date version file. Hasthe date and time without milliseconds. Empty if the information is notavailable.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PropertiesTime: Date/Time of the disk properties.Has the date and time without milliseconds. Empty if the information is notavailable.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">State: The number code of the inventory state.Values are: 0 (Up to date), 1 (version file is missing), 2 (version file is outof date), 3 (properties are missing), 4 (properties are out of date), 5 (serveris not reachable).</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Active: 1 if the Server is currently active, 2 ifunknown, and 0 otherwise.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsDiskInventory[]: If successful, thePvsDiskInventory object(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsDiskInventory for DiskLocator
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDiskInventory for the DiskLocator namedtheDiskLocator in the Site named theSite and Store named theStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskInventory -Name theDiskLocator -SiteNametheSite -StoreName theStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid can be used instead of Name so that theSiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
##Get-PvsDiskLocator<a name="_Toc464196147"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the fields for a Disk Locator or all DiskLocators for a Device, Server, Store, Site, or Farm. All DiskLocators arereturned if no parameters are passed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or DiskLocatorId: GUID of the DiskLocator to Get.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] DeviceId: GUID of the Device to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] DeviceName: Name of the Device to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsPhysicalAddress[] DeviceMac: MAC of the Device toGet all DiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] ServerId: GUID of the Server to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] ServerName: Name of the Server to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] UpdateTaskId: GUID of the Update Task to Getall DiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or one of these optional ; resolutions</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or DiskLocatorName: Name of the DiskLocator File to Get.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] StoreId: GUID of the Store to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] StoreName: Name of the Store to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] UpdateTaskName: Name of the Update Task toGet all DiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Single: If -Single is specified,include single server connection. If this and All are not included, bothconnection types are included.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter All: If -All is specified, includeall server connections for the store. If this and Single are not included, bothconnection types are included.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter OnlyActive: If -OnlyActive isspecified, include only the active DiskLocators. If not included, allDiskLocators are returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter UpdateDevice: If -UpdateDevice isspecified, include only DiskLocators that have an Update Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] StoreId: GUID of the Store to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] StoreName: Name of the Store to Get allDiskLocators for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorId, DeviceId, ServerId, UpdateTaskId,SiteId or StoreId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid or DiskLocatorId: Read-only GUID that uniquelyidentifies this Disk Locator.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Name or DiskLocatorName: Name of the Disk LocatorFile. It is unique within the Store. ASCII Max Length=52</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteId: GUID of the Site this DiskLocator is to be amember of. It is not used with SiteName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteName: Name of the Site this DiskLocator is to bea member of. It is not used with SiteId.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">StoreId: GUID of the Store that this Disk Locator isa member of. SiteName or SiteId must also be used. It is not used withStoreName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">StoreName: Name of the Store that this Disk Locatoris a member of. SiteName or SiteId must also be used. It is not used withStoreId.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Description: User description. Default=""Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MenuText: Text that is displayed in the Boot Menu.If this field has no value, the name value is used. Default="" ASCIIMax Length=64</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerId: GUID of the single Server that this DiskLocator is assigned to. It is not used with ServerName.Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerName: Name of the single Server that this DiskLocator is assigned to. It is not used with ServerId. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Enabled: True when this disk can be booted, falseotherwise. Default=true</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Role: Read-only Role of the user for this item. 100is Farm Administrator, 200 is Site Administrator, 300 is CollectionAdministrator, and 999 is read-only. Default=999</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Mapped: True if the Disk is currently mapped, falseotherwise. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">EnabledForDevice: True when this disk is enabled forthe Device specified, false otherwise. This is only returned when a Device isspecified. Default=true</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Active: True if the DiskLocator is currently active,false otherwise. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">RebalanceEnabled: True when this Server canautomatically rebalance Devices, false otherwise. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">RebalanceTriggerPercent: Percent over fair load thattriggers a dynamic Device rebalance. Min=5, Max=5000, Default=25</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SubnetAffinity: Qualifier for subnet affinity whenassigning a Server. 0=None, 1=Best Effort, 2=Fixed. Min=0, Max=2, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskUpdateDeviceId: GUID of the DiskUpdateDevicethat is used when updates are performed.Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskUpdateDeviceName: Name of the DiskUpdateDevicethat is used when updates are performed. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">TemporaryVersionSet: Read-only true when temporaryversion(s) are set. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsDiskLocator[]: If successful, the PvsDiskLocatorobject(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsDiskLocator for Farm
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDiskLocator for the Farm.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskLocator</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get PvsDiskLocator for Site
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDiskLocator for the Site named theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskLocator -SiteName theSite</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Get PvsDiskLocator for Site and Store
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDiskLocator for the Site named theSiteand Store named theStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskLocator -SiteName theSite -StoreNametheStore</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 4: Get PvsDiskLocator for DiskLocator
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsDiskLocator for the DiskLocator namedtheDiskLocator in the Site named theSite and Store named theStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskLocator -Name theDiskLocator -SiteNametheSite -StoreName theStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid can be used instead of Name so that theSiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 5: Get PvsDiskLocator and Enable
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDiskLocator that are not Enabled and thenEnables them.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskLocator -Fields Enabled | Where-Object{$_.Enabled -eq $false} | foreach { $o = $_; $o.Enabled = $true; $o } |Set-PvsDiskLocator</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The "foreach { $o = $_; $o.X = Y; $o }"sets the field X to value Y and returns the object again so it can be piped tothe Set command for update.</span></p>
##Get-PvsDiskLocatorCount<a name="_Toc464196148"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get count of Disk Locators for a Site and Type.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid SiteId: GUID of the Site to get the DiskLocator Count of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string SiteName: Name of the Site to get the DiskLocator Count of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Single: If -Single is specified,include single server connection. If this and All are not included, bothconnection types are included.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter All: If -All is specified, includeall server connections for the store. If this and Single are not included, bothconnection types are included.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">UInt32: If successful, the numeric value is returned</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get-PvsDiskLocatorCount Returns the Number (or Count) ofPvsDiskLocator in PvsSite
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskLocatorCount -SiteName theSite</span></p>
##Get-PvsDiskLocatorLock<a name="_Toc464196149"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the fields for all the locks of a Disk Locator.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or DiskLocatorId: GUID of the DiskLocator to Get the Locks.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or this required ; resolution</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or DiskLocatorName: Name of DiskLocator to Get the Locks.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] StoreId: GUID of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] StoreName: Name of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Exclusive: True when the lock is exclusive, falsewhen it is shared. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DeviceId: GUID of the Device that has the lock, willbe 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 if a Server has the lock.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DeviceName: Name of the Device that has the lock,will not be included if a Server has the lock.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerId: GUID of the Server that has the lock, willbe 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 if a Device has the lock.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerName: Name of the Server that has the lock,will not be included if a Device has the lock.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ReadOnly: True when lock is because file system isread only, false when file system is read write Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsDiskLocatorLock[]: If successful, thePvsDiskLocatorLock object(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsDiskLocatorLock for DiskLocator
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDiskLocatorLock for the DiskLocator namedtheDiskLocator in the Site named theSite and Store named theStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskLocatorLock -Name theDiskLocator-SiteName theSite -StoreName theStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid can be used instead of Name so that theSiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
##Get-PvsDiskUpdateDevice<a name="_Toc464196150"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the fields and status for a Disk Update Device,or all Disk Update Devices for a Site, Server, DiskLocator or Farm. All DiskUpdate Devices are returned if no parameters are passed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or DeviceId: GUID of the Disk UpdateDevice to Get.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or DeviceName: Name of Disk UpdateDevice to Get.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsPhysicalAddress[] DeviceMac: MAC of the DiskUpdate Device to Get.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] ServerId: GUID of the Server to Get all DiskUpdate Devices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] ServerName: Name of the Server to Get allDisk Update Devices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] DiskLocatorId: GUID of the DiskLocator to Getthe Disk Update Device for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] UpdateTaskId: GUID of the Update Task to Getall Disk Update Devices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or one of these optional ; resolutions</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] DiskLocatorName: Name of the DiskLocator toGet the Disk Update Device for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] UpdateTaskName: Name of the Update Task toGet all Disk Update Devices for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter OnlyActive: If -OnlyActive isspecified, include only the active Disk Update Devices. Only active Disk UpdateDevices are always returned for ServerId or ServerName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint MakLicenseActivated: Optional MAK licensingindicator value to only return active Disk Update Devices for. Values are: 0(MAK not used), 1 (Not Activated), 2 (Activated).</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] StoreId: GUID of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] StoreName: Name of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DeviceId, ServerId, DiskLocatorId, UpdateTaskId orSiteId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid or DeviceId: Read-only GUID that uniquelyidentifies this Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Name or DeviceName: Computer name with no spaces.ASCII computer name characters Max Length=15</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">VirtualHostingPoolId: GUID of the Virtual HostingPool. It is not used with VirtualHostingPoolName. Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">VirtualHostingPoolName: Name of the Virtual HostingPool.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorId: GUID of the Disk Locator to updatewith this Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorName: Name of the Disk Locator File toupdate with this Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteId: GUID of the Site this Disk Update Device isto be a member of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteName: Name of the Site this Disk Update Deviceis to be a member of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">StoreId: GUID of the Store that the Disk Locator isa member of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">StoreName: Name of the Store that the Disk Locatoris a member of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Description: User description. Default=""Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DeviceMac: Ethernet address can have the formXX-XX-XX-XX-XX-XX. Uniquely identifies the Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Port: UDP port to use with Stream Service. Min=1025,Max=65534, Default=6901</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Active: True if the Device is currently active,false otherwise. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">AdTimestamp: The time the Active Directory machineaccount password was generated. Do not set this field, it is only setinternally by PVS. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">AdSignature: The signature of the Active Directorymachine account password. Do not set this field, it is only set internally byPVS. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LogLevel: Level to perform logging at. Values are: 0(None), 1 (Fatal), 2 (Error), 3 (Warning), 4 (Info), 5 (Debug), and 6 (Trace).Min=0, Max=6, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DomainName: Fully qualified name of the domain thatthe Device belongs to. Do not set this field, it is only set internally by PVS.Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DomainObjectSID: The value of the objectSID ADattribute of the same name for the Device's computer account. Do not set thisfield, it is only set internally by PVS. Default="" Max Length=186</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DomainControllerName: The name of the DC used tocreate the host's computer account. Do not set this field, it is only setinternally by PVS. Default="" Max Length=4000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DomainTimeCreated: The time that the computeraccount was created. Has the date and time including milliseconds. Do not setthis field, it is only set internally by PVS. Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Ip: Read-only IP of the Device. It is equal to0.0.0.0 if the Device is not active.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerPortConnection: Read-only Port of the Serverthat the Device is using. It is equal to 0 if the Device is not active.Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerIpConnection: Read-only IP of the Server thatthe Device is using. It is equal to 0.0.0.0 if the Device is not active.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerId: Read-only GUID of the Server that theDevice is using. It is equal to 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 if theDevice is not active.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerName: Read-only Name of the Server that theDevice is using. It is equal to "" if the Device is not active.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskVersion: Read-only version of the Disk LocatorFile that the Device is using. It is equal to 0 if the Device is not active.Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Status: 1 or 2 numbers in the format n,n. They arethe number of retries and if ram cache is being used, ram cache percent used.It is equal to "" if the Device is not active.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LicenseType: 0 when None, 1 for Desktop, 2 forServer, 5 for OEM SmartClient, 6 for XenApp, 7 for XenDesktop. It is equal to 0if the Device is not active. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MakLicenseActivated: Read-only indicator if MAKlicensing is being used and is activated. Values are: 0 (MAK not used), 1 (NotActivated), 2 (Activated). It is equal to 0 if the Device is not active.Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Model: Oem Only: Read-only model of the computer.Values are OptiPlex 745, 755, 320, 760, FX160, or Default. It is equal to"" if the Device is not active.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">License: Oem Only: Read-only type of the license.Values are 0 when None, 1 or 2 when Desktop. It is equal to 0 if the Device isnot active. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsDiskUpdateDevice[]: If successful, thePvsDiskUpdateDevice object(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsDiskUpdateDevice for Farm
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDiskUpdateDevice for the Farm.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskUpdateDevice</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get PvsDiskUpdateDevice for Site
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDiskUpdateDevice for the Site namedtheSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskUpdateDevice -SiteName theSite</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Get PvsDiskUpdateDevice for Server
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDiskUpdateDevice for the Server namedtheServer.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskUpdateDevice -ServerName theServer</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 4: Get PvsDiskUpdateDevice for DiskLocator
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDiskUpdateDevice for the DiskLocatornamed theDiskLocator in the Site named theSite and Store named theStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskUpdateDevice -DiskLocatorNametheDiskLocator -SiteName theSite -StoreName theStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorId can be used instead of DiskLocatorNameso that the SiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 5: Get PvsDiskUpdateDevice for Device
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsDiskUpdateDevice for the Device namedtheDevice.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskUpdateDevice -Name theDevice</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 6: Get PvsDiskUpdateDevice for Device MAC
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsDiskUpdateDevice for the Device with MAC02-50-F2-00-00-01.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskUpdateDevice -DeviceMac"02-50-F2-00-00-01"</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 7: Get PvsDiskUpdateDevice for UpdateTask
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsDiskUpdateDevice for the UpdateTask namedtheUpdateTask in the Site named theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskUpdateDevice -UpdateTaskNametheUpdateTask -SiteName theSite</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">UpdateTaskId can be used instead of UpdateTaskNameso that the SiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>
##Get-PvsDiskUpdateStatus<a name="_Toc464196151"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the status of an Update Task, or all UpdateTasks for a Site or Farm. All Disk Update Tasks are returned if no parametersare passed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] UpdateTaskId: GUID of the Update Task to Get.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] DeviceId: GUID of the Disk Update Device toGet Disk Update Status for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] DeviceName: Name of the Disk Update Deviceto Get Disk Update Status for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsPhysicalAddress[] DeviceMac: MAC of the DiskUpdate Device to Get Disk Update Status for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or DiskUpdateTaskId: GUID of the DiskUpdate Task and Device relationship to Get Disk Update Status for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site to Get all UpdateTasks for. Also used with UpdateTaskName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to Get allUpdate Tasks for. Also used with UpdateTaskName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or this optional ; resolution</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] UpdateTaskName: Name of the Update Task toGet.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site to Get all UpdateTasks for. Also used with UpdateTaskName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to Get allUpdate Tasks for. Also used with UpdateTaskName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">UpdateTaskId, DeviceId or SiteId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid or DiskUpdateTaskId: GUID that uniquelyidentifies this Update Task and Device relationship.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">UpdateTaskId: GUID that uniquely identifies theUpdate Task.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">UpdateTaskName: Name of the Update Task.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Description: User description of the Update Task.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorId: GUID of the Disk Locator to update.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Name or DiskLocatorName: Name of the Disk LocatorFile to update.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">VirtualHostingPoolId: GUID of the Virtual HostingPool being used for the update.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">VirtualHostingPoolName: Name of the Virtual HostingPool being used for the update.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DeviceId: GUID that Device being used to do theupdate.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DeviceName: Name of the Device being used to do theupdate.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteId: GUID of the Site that this Update Task Nameis a member of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteName: Name of the Site that this Update TaskName is a member of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">StoreId: GUID of the Store that the Disk Locator isa member of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">StoreName: Name of the Store that the Disk Locatoris a member of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PreviousResult: Status of the last run. Values are:0 (Ready), 1 (Update Pending), 2 (Preparing Image), 3 (Starting VM), 4 (UpdateIn Progress), 5 (Stopping VM), 6 (Submitting Image), 7 (Reverting Image), 8(Invalid), 9 (Aborted), 10 (Completed Successfully), 11 (No Updates) Min=0,Max=11, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PreviousResultMessage: Message string that includesthe results of the last run. Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CurrentStatus: Current status of the update. Valuesare: 0 (Ready), 1 (Update Pending), 2 (Preparing Image), 3 (Starting VM), 4(Update In Progress), 5 (Stopping VM), 6 (Submitting Image), 7 (RevertingImage), 8 (Invalid), 9 (Aborted), 10 (Completed Successfully), 11 (No Updates)Min=0, Max=11, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CurrentStatusMessage: Message string that includesthe results of the run. Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsDiskUpdateStatus[]: If successful, thePvsDiskUpdateStatus object(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsDiskUpdateStatus for Farm
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDiskUpdateStatus for the Farm.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskUpdateStatus</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get PvsDiskUpdateStatus for Site
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDiskUpdateStatus for the Site namedtheSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskUpdateStatus -SiteName theSite</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Get PvsDiskUpdateStatus for Server
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDiskUpdateStatus for the Server namedtheServer.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskUpdateStatus -ServerName theServer</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 4: Get PvsDiskUpdateStatus for DiskLocator
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDiskUpdateStatus for the DiskLocatornamed theDiskLocator in the Site named theSite and Store named theStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskUpdateStatus -DiskLocatorNametheDiskLocator -SiteName theSite -StoreName theStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorId can be used instead of DiskLocatorNameso that the SiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 5: Get PvsDiskUpdateStatus for Device
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsDiskUpdateStatus for the Device namedtheDevice.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskUpdateStatus -Name theDevice</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 6: Get PvsDiskUpdateStatus for Device MAC
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsDiskUpdateStatus for the Device with MAC02-50-F2-00-00-01.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskUpdateStatus -DeviceMac "02-50-F2-00-00-01"</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 7: Get PvsDiskUpdateStatus for UpdateTask
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsDiskUpdateStatus for the UpdateTask namedtheUpdateTask in the Site named theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskUpdateStatus -UpdateTaskNametheUpdateTask -SiteName theSite</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">UpdateTaskId can be used instead of UpdateTaskNameso that the SiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 8: Get PvsDiskUpdateStatus for DiskUpdateTaskId
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsDiskUpdateStatus for the Device namedtheDevice then uses the DiskUpdateTaskId of the PvsDiskUpdateStatus to get thefuture Get-PvsDiskUpdateStatus.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$u = Get-PvsDiskUpdateStatus -DeviceName theDevice-Fields DiskUpdateTaskId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskUpdateStatus -Guid $u.DiskUpdateTaskId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
##Get-PvsDiskVersion<a name="_Toc464196152"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the fields for a Disk Version or all DiskVersions for a Disk Locator.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or DiskLocatorId: GUID of the DiskLocator to Get Disk Versions of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or this required ; resolution</span></p>
