<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or DiskLocatorName: Name of the DiskLocator to Get Disk Versions of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Version: Specific Version to Get.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Type: When set to 1, get the Maintenance orMaintenanceHighestVersion access version if it exists. When set to 2, get theTest access versions if any exist. When set to 3, get the Override accessversion if it exists.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] StoreId: GUID of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] StoreName: Name of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">(DiskLocatorId and Version) or DiskLocatorId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Version: Read-only version number. The base disk isversion 0, the other version numbers are in part of the file name. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Description: User description. Default=""Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Type: Read-only type of the Disk Version. Valuesare: 0 (Base), 1 (Manual), 2 (Automatic), 3 (Merge), and 4 (MergeBase) Min=0,Max=4, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CreateDate: Read-only Date/Time that the DiskVersion was created. Default=getdate</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ScheduledDate: Date/Time that the Disk Version isscheduled to become available. Has the date, hour and minute. Empty when thedisk version is made available immediately. Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DeleteWhenFree: Read-only true if the Disk Versionis no longer needed because of a merge. If not current booted by a Device, itcan be deleted. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Access: Read-only access of the Disk Version. Valuesare: 0 (Production), 1 (Maintenance), 2 (MaintenanceHighestVersion), 3(Override), 4 (Merge), 5 (MergeMaintenance), 6 (MergeTest), and 7 (Test) Min=0,Max=7, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Name or DiskFileName: Name of the Disk Fileincluding the extension. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DeviceCount: Read-only count of Devices. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">GoodInventoryStatus: True when the up to date fileis accessible by all Servers, false otherwise. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">TaskId: When a Merge is occurring, this will be setwith the task number of the process that is occurring. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CanDelete: Read-only true when the version can bedeleted. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CanMerge: Read-only true when the version can beupdate merged. Will be set for the highest version number. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CanMergeBase: Read-only true when the version can bebase merged. Will be set for the highest version number. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CanPromote: Read-only true when the version can bepromoted. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CanRevertTest: Read-only true when the version canbe reverted to Test Access. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CanRevertMaintenance: Read-only true when theversion can be reverted to Maintenance Access. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CanSetScheduledDate: Read-only true when the versioncan have the scheduled date modified. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CanOverride: Read-only true when the version can beset as the Override. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">IsPending: Read-only true when the versionScheduledDate has not occurred. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">TemporaryVersionSet: Read-only true when temporaryversion(s) are set. Some changes cannot be made to the version when this isset. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsDiskVersion[]: If successful, the PvsDiskVersionobject(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsDiskVersion for DiskLocator
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDiskVersion for the DiskLocator namedtheDiskLocator in the Site named theSite and Store named theStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskVersion -Name theDiskLocator -SiteNametheSite -StoreName theStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid can be used instead of Name so that theSiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get PvsDiskVersion for DiskLocator
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the first base PvsDiskVersion for theDiskLocator named theDiskLocator in Site named theSite and Store namedtheStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskVersion -Name theDiskLocator -Version 0-SiteName theSite -StoreName theStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid can be used instead of Name so that theSiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Get Maintenance PvsDiskVersion for DiskLocator
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the Maintenance PvsDiskVersion for theDiskLocator named theDiskLocator in Site named theSite and Store namedtheStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskVersion -Name theDiskLocator -Type 1-SiteName theSite -StoreName theStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid can be used instead of Name so that theSiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 4: Get Test PvsDiskVersion for DiskLocator
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all Test PvsDiskVersion for the DiskLocatornamed theDiskLocator in Site named theSite and Store named theStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskVersion -Name theDiskLocator -Type 2-SiteName theSite -StoreName theStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid can be used instead of Name so that theSiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 5: Get Override PvsDiskVersion for DiskLocator
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the Override PvsDiskVersion for the DiskLocatornamed theDiskLocator in Site named theSite and Store named theStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskVersion -Name theDiskLocator -Type 3-SiteName theSite -StoreName theStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid can be used instead of Name so that theSiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
##Get-PvsExists<a name="_Toc464196153"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Return true if a Site, Server, Collection, View,Device, Store, Update Task or Virtual Hosting Pool Name is already used. If aCollectionName, SiteViewName, UpdateTaskName or VirtualHostingPoolName isspecified, SiteName or SiteId must be included.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string SiteName: Name of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string ServerName: Server name, to see if it isalready used in the Farm.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string FarmViewName: Farm View name, to see if it isalready used in the Farm.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string DeviceName: Device name, to see if it isalready used in the Farm.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsPhysicalAddress[] DeviceMac: Device MAC, to seeif it is already used in the Farm.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string StoreName: Store name, to see if it isalready used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or one of these required ; resolutions</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string CollectionName: Collection name, to see if itis already used in a Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string SiteViewName: Site View name, to see if it isalready used in the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string VirtualHostingPoolName: Virtual Hosting Poolname, to see if it is already used in a Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string UpdateTaskName: Update Task name, to see ifit is already used in a Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string DiskLocatorName: DiskLocator name, to see ifit is already used in a Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string SiteName: Name of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid SiteId: GUID of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid StoreId: GUID of the Store that is needed whena DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string StoreName: Store name, to see if it isalready used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Boolean: If successful, $true or $false is returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get-PvsExists Determine if SiteName Already Exists
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsExists -SiteName theName</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get-PvsExists Determine if ServerName Already Exists
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsExists -ServerName theName</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Get-PvsExists Determine if FarmViewName Already Exists
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsExists -FarmViewName theName</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 4: Get-PvsExists Determine if DeviceName Already Exists
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsExists -DeviceName theName</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 5: Get-PvsExists Determine if DeviceMac Already Exists
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsExists -DeviceMac"00-11-22-33-44-55"</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 6: Get-PvsExists Determine if StoreName Already Exists
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsExists -StoreName theName</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 7: Get-PvsExists Determine if CollectionName Already Exists

####EXAMPLE 1: Get-PvsMinimumLastAutoAddDeviceNumber
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This example gets the highest auto-add number usedso far for a PvsDevice that starts with the AutoAddPrefix and AutoAddSuffix ofthe PVsCollection.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsMinimumLastAutoAddDeviceNumber-CollectionName theCollection -SiteName theSite</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CollectionId can be used instead of CollectionNameso that the SiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get-PvsMinimumLastAutoAddDeviceNumber for AutoAddPrefix withAutoAddSuffix and AutoAddNumberLength
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This example gets the highest auto-add number usedso far for a PvsDevice with name length up to 10 characters and starts with theAutoAddPrefix and AutoAddSuffix specified.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsMinimumLastAutoAddDeviceNumber -CollectionNametheCollection -SiteName theSite -AutoAddPrefix "P" -AutoAddSuffix"S" -AutoAddNumberLength 10</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CollectionId can be used instead of CollectionNameso that the SiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>
##Get-PvsMountedDisk<a name="_Toc464196160"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the mounted disk, if there is one.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid ServerId: GUID of the Server.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string ServerName: Name of the Server.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid StoreId: GUID of the Store.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string StoreName: Name of the Store.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerId or StoreId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsDiskLocator: If successful, the mappedPvsDiskLocator is returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get-PvsMountedDisk
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This example gets the PvsMappedDisk. If no disk ismapped, null is returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$thePvsDiskLocator = Get-PvsMappedDisk</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">if ($thePvsDiskLocator -ne $null)</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">{</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.4in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$thePvsDiskLocator.Name    #display the name of the mapped PvsDiskLocator</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">}</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get-PvsMountedDisk for ServerName
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This example gets any mapped disk for theServerName. If no disk is mapped, null is returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$thePvsDiskLocator = Get-PvsMappedDisk -ServerNametheServer</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">if ($thePvsDiskLocator -ne $null)</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">{</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.4in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$thePvsDiskLocator.Name    #display the name of the mapped PvsDiskLocator</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">}</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Get-PvsMountedDisk for StoreName
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This example gets any mapped disk for the StoreName.If no disk is mapped, null is returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$thePvsDiskLocator = Get-PvsMappedDisk -StoreNametheStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">if ($thePvsDiskLocator -ne $null)</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">{</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.4in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$thePvsDiskLocator.Name    #display the name of the mapped PvsDiskLocator</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">}</span></p>
##Get-PvsMountedDriveLetter<a name="_Toc464196161"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If there is currently a Mounted Drive, return theLetter of the Drive.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">String: If successful, the String value is returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get-PvsMountedDriveLetter
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This example gets any mapped disk drive letter. Ifno disk is mapped, a string with length greater than 0 is returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$theDriveLetter = Get-PvsMappedDisk</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">if ($theDriveLetter -ne $null -and$theDriveLetter.length -gt 0)</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">{</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.4in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$theDriveLetter    # display thedrive letter</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">}</span></p>
##Get-PvsNewDiskVersion<a name="_Toc464196162"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get new Disk versions for the Store on the Serverspecified.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] ServerId: GUID of the Server to look for newDisk versions.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] ServerName: Name of the Server to look fornew Disk versions.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] StoreId: GUID of the Store that the Serverservices to look for new Disk versions.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] StoreName: Name of the Store that theServer services to look for new Disk versions.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter AutoAddEnabled: If -AutoAddEnabledis specified, undefined Disk versions found will be automatically added.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerId or StoreId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Name: Name of the disk file without the extension.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Status: Status of the disk file. Values are: 0(Valid), 1 (Missing Properties File), 2 (Access Denied), 3 (Access Denied andMissing Properties File), 4 (Invalid Disk File), 5 (Manifest Invalid)</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsNewDiskVersion[]: If successful, thePvsNewDiskVersion object(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsNewDiskVersion
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsNewDiskVersion in the Store namedtheStore using the Server named theServer.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsNewDiskVersion -ServerName theServer-StoreName theStore</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get PvsNewDiskVersion with AutoAdd
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsNewDiskVersion and Auto Adds them in theStore named theStore using the Server named theServer.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsNewDiskVersion -ServerName theServer-StoreName theStore -AutoAddEnabled</span></p>
##Get-PvsServer<a name="_Toc464196163"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the fields for a Server, all Servers in a Sitethat use a Store, service a DiskLocator, or for the whole Farm. All Servers arereturned if no parameters are passed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or ServerId: GUID of the Server to Get.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or ServerName: Name of the Server toGet.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site to Get all Servers.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to Get allServers.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] DiskLocatorId: GUID of the Disk Locator toGet all Servers.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or this optional ; resolution</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] DiskLocatorName: Name of the Disk LocatorFile to Get all Servers.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional ; resolutions</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] StoreId: GUID of the Store to Get all Servers.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] StoreName: Name of the Store to Get allServers.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter All: If -All is specified, withStoreId or StoreName all Servers for the Store including ones with invalidpaths will be returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site to Get all Servers.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to Get allServers.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] StoreId: GUID of the Store to Get allServers.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] StoreName: Name of the Store to Get allServers.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerId, SiteId, DiskLocatorId or StoreId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid or ServerId: Read-only GUID that uniquelyidentifies this Server.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Name or ServerName: Computer name with no spaces.ASCII computer name characters Max Length=21</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteId: GUID of the Site this Server is to be amember of. It is not used with SiteName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteName: Name of the Site this Server is to be amember of. It is not used with SiteId.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Description: User description. Default=""Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">AdMaxPasswordAge: Number of days before a passwordexpires. Min=1, Max=30, Default=7</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LicenseTimeout: Amount of seconds before a licensetimes out. Min=15, Max=300, Default=30</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">VDiskCreatePacing: VDisk create time pacing inmiliseconds. Min=0, Max=5, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">FirstPort: Number of the first UDP port for use bythe Stream Service, First and Last must allow at least 5 ports. Min=1025,Max=65534, Default=6910</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LastPort: Number of the last UDP port for use by theStream Service, First and Last must allow at least 5 ports. Min=1025,Max=65534, Default=6930</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ThreadsPerPort: Number of worker threads per IOport. Required that (threadPerPort * numberPorts * numberIPs) <= 1000.Min=1, Max=60, Default=8</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">BuffersPerThread: Number of buffers per workerthread. Min=1, Max=128, Default=24</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerCacheTimeout: Number of seconds to wait beforeconsidering another Server is down. Min=5, Max=60, Default=8</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">IoBurstSize: Number of bytes read/writes can send ina burst of packets. Required that IoBurstSize/(MaxTransmissionUnits-76)<=32.Min=4096, Max=61440, Default=32768</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MaxTransmissionUnits: Ethernet maximum transmissionunit size for the protocol for use for Server and Device. Required thatIoBurstSize/(MaxTransmissionUnits-76)<=32. Min=502, Max=16426, Default=1506</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MaxBootDevicesAllowed: Maximum number of Devicesallowed to boot simultaneously. Min=1, Max=1000, Default=500</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MaxBootSeconds: Maximum number of seconds for aDevice to boot. Min=10, Max=900, Default=60</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">BootPauseSeconds: Number of seconds that a Devicewill pause during login if its server busy. Min=1, Max=60, Default=10</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">AdMaxPasswordAgeEnabled: Age the password, when setto true. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">EventLoggingEnabled: Enable event logging, when setto true. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">NonBlockingIoEnabled: Use non-Blocking IO, when setto true. Default=true</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Role: Read-only Role of the user for this item. 100is Farm Administrator, and 200 is Site Administrator. Default=999</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Ip: One or more streaming ip addresses.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">InitialQueryConnectionPoolSize: Initial size ofdatabase connection pool for non-transactional queries. Min=1, Max=1000,Default=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">InitialTransactionConnectionPoolSize: Initial sizeof database connection pool for transactional queries. Min=1, Max=1000,Default=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MaxQueryConnectionPoolSize: Maximum size of databaseconnection pool for non-transactional queries. Min=1, Max=32767, Default=1000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MaxTransactionConnectionPoolSize: Maximum size ofdatabase connection pool for transactional queries. Min=1, Max=32767,Default=1000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">RefreshInterval: Interval, in number of seconds, theserver should wait before refreshing settings. If set to 0, unused databaseconnections are never released. Min=0, Max=32767, Default=300</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">UnusedDbConnectionTimeout: Interval, in number ofseconds, a connection should go unused before it is to be released. Min=0,Max=32767, Default=300</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">BusyDbConnectionRetryCount: Number of times a faileddatabase connection will be retried. Min=0, Max=32767, Default=2</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">BusyDbConnectionRetryInterval: Interval, in numberof milliseconds, the server should wait before retrying to connect to adatabase. Min=0, Max=10000, Default=25</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LocalConcurrentIoLimit: Maximum concurrent IOtransactions it performs for vDisks that are local. A value of 0 disables thefeature. Min=0, Max=128, Default=4</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">RemoteConcurrentIoLimit: Maximum concurrent IOtransactions it performs for vDisks that are remote. A value of 0 disables thefeature. Min=0, Max=128, Default=4</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">RamDiskIpAddress: IP address to use for transferringthe RAM Disk. When equal to 0.0.0.0 the server IP is used with the first partreplaced with 233. Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">RamDiskTimeToLive: Time to live for the invitationpacket sent to Devices. Min=1, Max=255, Default=1</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">RamDiskInvitationType: Either false for Fixed, ortrue for Variable. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">RamDiskInvitationPeriod: The amount of time inseconds that invitations are sent to Devices. Min=1, Max=300, Default=10</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Active: 1 if the Server is currently active, 2 ifunknown, and 0 otherwise. Min=0, Max=2, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LogLevel: Level to perform logging at. Values are: 0(None), 1 (Fatal), 2 (Error), 3 (Warning), 4 (Info), 5 (Debug), and 6 (Trace).Min=0, Max=6, Default=4</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LogFileSizeMax: Maximum size log files can reach inMegabytes. Min=1, Max=50, Default=5</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LogFileBackupCopiesMax: Maximum number of log filebackups. Min=1, Max=50, Default=4</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PowerRating: A strictly relative rating of thisServer's capabilities when compared to other Servers in the Store(s) it belongstoo; can be used to help tune load balancing. Min=0.1, Max=1000, Default=1</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerFqdn: Read-only fully qualified domain name.Default="" Max Length=1024</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ManagementIp: IP address used for management communicationsbetween Servers. Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LastCeipUploadAttempt: Time that this server lastattempted a CEIP upload. Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LastBugReportAttempt: Time that this server lastattempted to upload or generate a bug report bundle. Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LastBugReportStatus: Status of the last bug reporton this server. Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LastBugReportResult: Status of the last bug reporton this server. Default="" Max Length=4000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LastBugReportSummary: Summary of the last bug reporton this server. Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsServer[]: If successful, the PvsServer object(s)are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsServer for Farm
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsServer for the Farm.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsServer</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get PvsServer for Site
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsServer for the Site named theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsServer -SiteName theSite</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Get PvsServer for Site and Store
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsServer for the Site named theSite andStore named theStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsServer -SiteName theSite -StoreName theStore</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 4: Get PvsServer for DiskLocator
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsServer for the DiskLocator namedtheDiskLocator in the Site named theSite and Store named theStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsServer -DiskLocatorName theDiskLocator-SiteName theSite -StoreName theStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorId can be used instead of DiskLocatorNameso that the SiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 5: Get PvsServer for Server
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsServer for the Server named theServer.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsServer -Name theServer</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 6: Get PvsServer Not Active and Start
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsServer that are not Active and then Startthem.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsServer -Fields Active | Where-Object{$_.Active -eq 0} | Start-PvsStreamService</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
##Get-PvsServerBiosBootstrap<a name="_Toc464196164"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Oem Only: Get the bootstrap fields for the Serverdell_bios.bin BIOS bootstrap file.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or ServerId: GUID of the Server to Getthe dell_bios.bin BIOS bootstrap file from.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or ServerName: Name of the Server toGet the dell_bios.bin BIOS bootstrap file from.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Enabled: Automatically update the BIOS on the targetdevice with these setting when set to true, otherwise do not use thesesettings. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DhcpEnabled: Use DHCP to retrieve target device IPwhen set to true, otherwise use the static domain, dnsIpAddresstrue anddnsIpAddress2 settings. Default=true</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Lookup: Use DNS to find the Server when set to truewith the ServerName host value, otherwise use the bootservertrue_Ip,bootservertrue_Port, bootserver2_Ip, bootserver2_Port, bootserver3_Ip,bootserver3_Port, bootserver4_Ip, and bootserver4_Port settings. Default=true</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">VerboseMode: Display verbose diagnostic informationwhen set to true. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">InterruptSafeMode: Interrupt safe mode (use iftarget device hangs during boot) when set to true. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PaeMode: PAE mode (use if PAE enabled in boot.ini oftarget device) when set to true. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">BootFromHdOnFail: For network recovery reboot tohard drive when set to true, restore network connection when set to false.Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">RecoveryTime: When bootFromHdOnFail is 1, this isthe number of seconds to wait before reboot to hard drive. Min=10, Max=60000,Default=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PollingTimeout: Login polling timeout in milliseconds.Min=1000, Max=60000, Default=5000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">GeneralTimeout: Login general timeout inmilliseconds. Min=1000, Max=60000, Default=5000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Name or ServerName: Host to use for DNS lookup. Onlyused when Lookup is true. Default=IMAGESERVER1</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Bootserver1_Ip: 1st boot server IP. Only used whenLookup is false.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Bootserver1_Port: 1st boot server port. Only usedwhen Lookup is false. Min=1025, Max=65536, Default=6910</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Bootserver2_Ip: 2nd boot server IP. Only used whenLookup is false. Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Bootserver2_Port: 2nd boot server port. Only usedwhen Lookup is false. Min=1025, Max=65536, Default=6910</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Bootserver3_Ip: 3rd boot server IP. Only used whenLookup is false. Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Bootserver3_Port: 3rd boot server port. Only usedwhen Lookup is false. Min=1025, Max=65536, Default=6910</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Bootserver4_Ip: 4th boot server IP. Only used whenLookup is false. Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Bootserver4_Port: 4th boot server port. Only usedwhen Lookup is false. Min=1025, Max=65536, Default=6910</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Domain: Domain of the primary and secondary DNSservers. Only used when DhcpEnabled is false.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DnsIpAddress1: Primary DNS server IP. Only used whenDhcpEnabled is false.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DnsIpAddress2: Secondary DNS server IP. Only usedwhen DhcpEnabled is false.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsServerBiosBootstrap[]: If successful, the PvsServerBiosBootstrapobject(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsServerBiosBootstrap for Server
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsServerBiosBootstrap for the Server namedtheServer.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsServerBiosBootstrap -Name theServer</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Bootserver2_Port: 2nd boot server port. Min=1025,Max=65536, Default=6910</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Bootserver4_Gateway: 4th boot server gateway.Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Bootserver4_Port: 4th boot server port. Min=1025,Max=65536, Default=6910</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">VerboseMode: Display verbose diagnostic informationwhen set to true. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">InterruptSafeMode: Interrupt safe mode (use iftarget device hangs during boot) when set to true. Default=false</span></p>

##Get-PvsServerBootstrapName<a name="_Toc464196166"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the bootstrap names for a Server.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or ServerId: GUID of the Server to Getbootstrap names for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or ServerName: Name of the Server toGet bootstrap names for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsServerBootstrapName[]: If successful, thePvsServerBootstrapName object(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsServerBootstrapName for Server
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsServerBootstrapName for the Server namedtheServer.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsServerBootstrapName -Name theServer</span></p>
##Get-PvsServerCount<a name="_Toc464196167"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get count of Servers in a Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid Guid or SiteId: GUID of the Site to get theServer Count of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or SiteName: Name of the Site to get theServer Count of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">UInt32: If successful, the numeric value is returned</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get-PvsServerCount Returns the Number (or Count) of PvsServer inPvsSite
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsServerCount -Name theSite</span></p>
##Get-PvsServerInfo<a name="_Toc464196168"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the fields and status for a Server, all Serversin a Site that use a Store, service a DiskLocator, or for the whole Farm. AllServers are returned if no parameters are passed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or ServerId: GUID of the Server to Get.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or ServerName: Name of the Server toGet.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site to Get all Servers.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to Get allServers.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] DiskLocatorId: GUID of the Disk Locator toGet all Servers.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or this optional ; resolution</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] DiskLocatorName: Name of the Disk LocatorFile to Get all Servers.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional ; resolutions</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] StoreId: GUID of the Store to Get allServers.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] StoreName: Name of the Store to Get allServers.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter All: If -All is specified, withStoreId or StoreName all Servers for the Store including ones with invalidpaths will be returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site to Get all Servers.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to Get all Servers.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] StoreId: GUID of the Store to Get allServers.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] StoreName: Name of the Store to Get allServers.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerId, SiteId, DiskLocatorId or StoreId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid or ServerId: Read-only GUID that uniquely identifiesthis Server.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Name or ServerName: Computer name with no spaces.ASCII computer name characters Max Length=21</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteId: GUID of the Site this Server is to be amember of. It is not used with SiteName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteName: Name of the Site this Server is to be a memberof. It is not used with SiteId.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Description: User description. Default=""Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">AdMaxPasswordAge: Number of days before a passwordexpires. Min=1, Max=30, Default=7</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LicenseTimeout: Amount of seconds before a licensetimes out. Min=15, Max=300, Default=30</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">VDiskCreatePacing: VDisk create time pacing inmiliseconds. Min=0, Max=5, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">FirstPort: Number of the first UDP port for use bythe Stream Service, First and Last must allow at least 5 ports. Min=1025,Max=65534, Default=6910</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LastPort: Number of the last UDP port for use by theStream Service, First and Last must allow at least 5 ports. Min=1025,Max=65534, Default=6930</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ThreadsPerPort: Number of worker threads per IOport. Required that (threadPerPort * numberPorts * numberIPs) <= 1000.Min=1, Max=60, Default=8</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">BuffersPerThread: Number of buffers per workerthread. Min=1, Max=128, Default=24</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerCacheTimeout: Number of seconds to wait beforeconsidering another Server is down. Min=5, Max=60, Default=8</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">IoBurstSize: Number of bytes read/writes can send ina burst of packets. Required that IoBurstSize/(MaxTransmissionUnits-76)<=32.Min=4096, Max=61440, Default=32768</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MaxTransmissionUnits: Ethernet maximum transmissionunit size for the protocol for use for Server and Device. Required thatIoBurstSize/(MaxTransmissionUnits-76)<=32. Min=502, Max=16426, Default=1506</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MaxBootDevicesAllowed: Maximum number of Devicesallowed to boot simultaneously. Min=1, Max=1000, Default=500</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MaxBootSeconds: Maximum number of seconds for aDevice to boot. Min=10, Max=900, Default=60</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">BootPauseSeconds: Number of seconds that a Devicewill pause during login if its server busy. Min=1, Max=60, Default=10</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">AdMaxPasswordAgeEnabled: Age the password, when setto true. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">EventLoggingEnabled: Enable event logging, when setto true. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">NonBlockingIoEnabled: Use non-Blocking IO, when setto true. Default=true</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Role: Read-only Role of the user for this item. 100is Farm Administrator, and 200 is Site Administrator. Default=999</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Ip: One or more streaming ip addresses.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">InitialQueryConnectionPoolSize: Initial size ofdatabase connection pool for non-transactional queries. Min=1, Max=1000,Default=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">InitialTransactionConnectionPoolSize: Initial sizeof database connection pool for transactional queries. Min=1, Max=1000,Default=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MaxQueryConnectionPoolSize: Maximum size of databaseconnection pool for non-transactional queries. Min=1, Max=32767, Default=1000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MaxTransactionConnectionPoolSize: Maximum size ofdatabase connection pool for transactional queries. Min=1, Max=32767,Default=1000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">RefreshInterval: Interval, in number of seconds, theserver should wait before refreshing settings. If set to 0, unused databaseconnections are never released. Min=0, Max=32767, Default=300</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">UnusedDbConnectionTimeout: Interval, in number ofseconds, a connection should go unused before it is to be released. Min=0,Max=32767, Default=300</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">BusyDbConnectionRetryCount: Number of times a faileddatabase connection will be retried. Min=0, Max=32767, Default=2</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">BusyDbConnectionRetryInterval: Interval, in numberof milliseconds, the server should wait before retrying to connect to adatabase. Min=0, Max=10000, Default=25</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LocalConcurrentIoLimit: Maximum concurrent IOtransactions it performs for vDisks that are local. A value of 0 disables thefeature. Min=0, Max=128, Default=4</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">RemoteConcurrentIoLimit: Maximum concurrent IOtransactions it performs for vDisks that are remote. A value of 0 disables thefeature. Min=0, Max=128, Default=4</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">RamDiskIpAddress: IP address to use for transferringthe RAM Disk. When equal to 0.0.0.0 the server IP is used with the first partreplaced with 233. Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">RamDiskTimeToLive: Time to live for the invitationpacket sent to Devices. Min=1, Max=255, Default=1</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">RamDiskInvitationType: Either false for Fixed, ortrue for Variable. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">RamDiskInvitationPeriod: The amount of time inseconds that invitations are sent to Devices. Min=1, Max=300, Default=10</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Active: 1 if the Server is currently active, 2 ifunknown, and 0 otherwise. Min=0, Max=2, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LogLevel: Level to perform logging at. Values are: 0(None), 1 (Fatal), 2 (Error), 3 (Warning), 4 (Info), 5 (Debug), and 6 (Trace).Min=0, Max=6, Default=4</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LogFileSizeMax: Maximum size log files can reach inMegabytes. Min=1, Max=50, Default=5</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LogFileBackupCopiesMax: Maximum number of log filebackups. Min=1, Max=50, Default=4</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PowerRating: A strictly relative rating of thisServer's capabilities when compared to other Servers in the Store(s) it belongstoo; can be used to help tune load balancing. Min=0.1, Max=1000, Default=1</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerFqdn: Read-only fully qualified domain name.Default="" Max Length=1024</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ManagementIp: IP address used for managementcommunications between Servers. Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LastCeipUploadAttempt: Time that this server lastattempted a CEIP upload. Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LastBugReportAttempt: Time that this server lastattempted to upload or generate a bug report bundle. Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LastBugReportStatus: Status of the last bug reporton this server. Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LastBugReportResult: Status of the last bug reporton this server. Default="" Max Length=4000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">LastBugReportSummary: Summary of the last bug reporton this server. Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ContactIp: Read-only contact IP for the Server.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ContactPort: Read-only contact port for the Server.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DeviceCount: Read-only count of Devices. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsServerInfo[]: If successful, the PvsServerInfoobject(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsServerInfo for Farm
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsServerInfo for the Farm.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsServerInfo</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get PvsServerInfo for Site
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsServerInfo for the Site named theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsServerInfo -SiteName theSite</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Get PvsServerInfo for Site and Store
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsServerInfo for the Site named theSite andStore named theStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsServerInfo -SiteName theSite -StoreNametheStore</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 4: Get PvsServerInfo for DiskLocator
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsServerInfo for the DiskLocator namedtheDiskLocator in the Site named theSite and Store named theStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsServerInfo -DiskLocatorName theDiskLocator-SiteName theSite -StoreName theStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorId can be used instead of DiskLocatorNameso that the SiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 5: Get PvsServerInfo for Server
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsServerInfo for the Server named theServer.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsServerInfo -Name theServer</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 6: Get PvsServerInfo Not Active and Start
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsServerInfo that are not Active and thenStart them.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsServerInfo -Fields Active | Where-Object{$_.Active -eq 0} | Start-PvsStreamService</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
##Get-PvsServerName<a name="_Toc464196169"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Return the name of the Server the SoapServer isrunning on.</span></p>
