##Get-PvsServerStatus<a name="_Toc464196170"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the Server Status fields for a Server.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or ServerId: GUID of the Server to Getstatus for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or ServerName: Name of Server to Getstatus for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid or ServerId: Read-only GUID of the Server. Canbe used with Get Server.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Name or ServerName: Read-only Name of the Server.Can be used with Get Server.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Ip: Read-only contact IP for the Server.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Port: Read-only contact port for the Server.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DeviceCount: Read-only count of Devices. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Status: Status of the server, 0 if down, 1 if up and2 if unknown. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsServerStatus[]: If successful, thePvsServerStatus object(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsServerStatus for Server
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsServerStatus for the Server namedtheServer.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsServerStatus -Name theServer</span></p>
##Get-PvsServerStore<a name="_Toc464196171"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the directory and cache paths of a Server forone or all Stores.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] ServerId: GUID of a Server.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] ServerName: Name of a Server.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] StoreId: GUID of the Store.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] StoreName: Name of the Store.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">(ServerId and StoreId), ServerId or StoreId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">StoreId: GUID of the Store. StoreName can be usedinstead.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">StoreName: Name of the Store. StoreId can be usedinstead.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerId: GUID of the server that uses the Store.ServerName can be used instead.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerName: Name of the server that uses the Store.ServerId can be used instead.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Path: Directory path that the Server uses to accessthe Store. Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CachePath: Cache path(s) that the Server uses withthe Store. If none are specified the caches will be placed in the StorecachePath. Default=None</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsServerStore[]: If successful, the PvsServerStoreobject(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsServerStore for Server
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsServerStore for the Server namedtheServer.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsServerStore -ServerName theServer</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get PvsServerStore for Server and Store
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsServerStore for the Server namedtheServer and Store named theStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsServerStore -ServerName theServer -StoreNametheStore</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the fields for a Site or all Sites. All Sitesare returned if no parameters are passed.</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DefaultCollectionId: GUID of the Collection to placenew Devices into automatically. Not used with defaultCollectionName.Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DefaultCollectionName: Name of the Collection toplace new Devices into automatically. Not used with DefaultCollectionId. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">InventoryFilePollingInterval: The number of secondsbetween polls for Disk changes in the Stores. Min=1, Max=600, Default=60</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskUpdateServerId: GUID of the Disk Update Serverfor the Site. Not used with DiskUpdateServerName.Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskUpdateServerName: Name of the Disk Update Serverfor the Site. Not used with DiskUpdateServerId. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MakUser: User name used for MAK activation.Default="" Max Length=64</span></p>

####EXAMPLE 2: Get PvsSite
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsSite for the Site named theSite.</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">StoreId, ServerId or SiteId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid or StoreId: Read-only GUID that uniquelyidentifies this Store.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Name or StoreName: Name of the Store. Max Length=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteId: GUID of the Site where Administrators ofthat Site can change this Store. Not used for Farm Stores. SiteName can be usedinstead. Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteName: Name of the Site where Administrators ofthat Site can change this Store. Not used for Farm Stores. SiteId can be usedinstead. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Description: User description. Default=""Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Path: Default directory path that the Servers use toaccess this Store. Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CachePath: Default Cache path(s) that the Serversuse with this Store. If none are specified the caches will be placed in theWriteCache subdirectory of the Store path. Default=None</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Role: Read-only Role of the user for this item. 100is Farm Administrator, 200 is Site Administrator, and 999 is read-only.Default=999</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PathType: Read-only field indicating if the vdisksare on a server's local hard disk or on a remote share.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsStore[]: If successful, the PvsStore object(s)are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsStore for Farm

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsStore</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get PvsStore for Site
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsStore for the Site named theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsStore -SiteName theSite</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Get PvsStore for Server
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsStore for the Server named theServer.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsStore -ServerName theServer</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 4: Get PvsStore

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint State: The TaskState to get Tasks for. Valuesare: 0 (Processing), 1 (Cancelled), and 2 (Complete).</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">TaskId or SiteId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">TaskId: Unique ID of the task.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteId: GUID of the Site that this Task is beingprocessed in. Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteName: Name of the Site that that this Task isbeing processed in.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Handle: Handle to a running function.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerFqdn: Qualified name of the server.Default="" Max Length=1024</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Ip: IP Address of the remote host.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Port: Port number of the remote service.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">StartTime: Time the task was started. Has the dateand time without milliseconds.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ExpirationTime: Time the task record may be removedfrom the database if the task does not complete. Has the date and time withoutmilliseconds.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">State: State of the Task. Values are: 0(Processing), 1 (Cancelled), and 2 (Complete). Min=0, Max=2</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CommandType: Type of the command. Values are: Add,Delete, Get, Info, Run, RunWithReturn, Set and SetList. Default=""Max Length=13</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Command: Command being processed.Default="" Max Length=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MapiException: Exception result in XML format.Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Results: Result in XML format. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsTask[]: If successful, the PvsTask object(s) arereturned.</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsTask</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get PvsTask for Site
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsTask for the Site named theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsTask -SiteName theSite</span></p>

##Get-PvsTaskStatus<a name="_Toc464196179"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the status of a Task in percent complete.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint TaskId: Id of the Task to get the Status of.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">TaskId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">UInt32: If successful, the numeric value is returned</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get-PvsTaskStatus for Start-PvsBoot to PvsTask
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$thePvsTask = Start-PvsBoot -NametheDevice                    #start the task</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">while ($thePvsTask.State -eq0)                                #while the task is processing</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">{</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.4in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">%percentFinished = Get-PvsTaskStatus -Object$thePvsTask   # get percent finished</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.4in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">%percentFinished.ToString() + "%finished"                 #display percent finished</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.4in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Start-Sleep -seconds 10                                    #wait 10 seconds more</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.4in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$thePvsTask = Get-PvsTask -Object$thePvsTask              #get the current PvsTask object</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">}</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">if ($thePvsTask.State -eq2)                                   #check to see if completed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">{</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.4in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">"Successful"</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">}</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">else</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">{</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.4in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">"Cancelled"</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">}</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get-PvsTaskStatus for taskId
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsTaskStatus -taskId 101</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] StoreId: GUID of the Store that the Serverservices to look for undefined Disks.</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerId or StoreId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Name: Name of the disk file without the extension.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Status: Status of the disk file. Values are: 0(Valid), 1 (Missing Properties File), 2 (Access Denied), 3 (Access Denied andMissing Properties File), 4 (Invalid Disk File), 5 (Manifest Missing orInvalid), 6 (Both VHD and VHDX)</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">VHDX: If VHDX is true, the format of the image isVHDX. Otherwise it is VHD. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsUndefinedDisk[]: If successful, thePvsUndefinedDisk object(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsUndefinedDisk
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsUndefinedDisk in the Store named theStoreusing the Server named theServer.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsUndefinedDisk -ServerName theServer-StoreName theStore</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get PvsUndefinedDisk with AutoAdd
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsUndefinedDisk and Auto Adds them in theStore named theStore using the Server named theServer.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsUndefinedDisk -ServerName theServer-StoreName theStore -AutoAddEnabled</span></p>
##Get-PvsUpdateTask<a name="_Toc464196181"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the fields for an Update Task or all UpdateTasks in a Site or the whole Farm. All Update Tasks are returned if noparameters are passed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or UpdateTaskId: GUID of the Update Taskto Get.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site to Get all UpdateTasks for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to Get allUpdate Tasks for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or this optional ; resolution</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or UpdateTaskName: Name of the UpdateTask to Get.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site to Get all UpdateTasks for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to Get allUpdate Tasks for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">UpdateTaskId or SiteId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid or UpdateTaskId: Read-only GUID that uniquelyidentifies this Update Task.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Name or UpdateTaskName: Name of the Update Task. Itis unique within the Site. Max Length=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteId: GUID of the Site that this Update Task is amember of. It is not used with SiteName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteName: Name of the Site that this Update Task isa member of. It is not used with SiteId.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Description: User description. Default=""Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Enabled: True when it will be processed, falseotherwise. Default=true</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Hour: The hour of the day to perform the task.Min=0, Max=23, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Minute: The minute of the hour to perform the task.Min=0, Max=59, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Recurrence: The update will reoccur on thisschedule. 0 = None, 1 = Daily, 2 = Every Weekday, 3 = Weekly, 4 = Monthly Date,5 = Monthly Type. Min=0, Max=5, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DayMask: Days selected values. 1 = Monday, 2 =Tuesday, 4 = Wednesday, 8 = Thursday, 16 = Friday, 32 = Saturday, 64 = Sunday,128 = Day. Default=0. This is used with Weekly and Monthly Type recurrence.Min=1, Max=255, Default=4</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Date: Days of the month. Numbers from 1-31 are theonly valid values. This is used with Monthly Date recurrence.Default="" Max Length=83</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MonthlyOffset: When to happen monthly. 0 = None, 1 =First, 2 = Second, 3 = Third, 4 = Forth, 5 = Last. This is used with MonthlyType recurrence. Min=0, Max=5, Default=3</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">EsdType: Esd to use. Valid values are SCCM or WSUS.If no value, a custom script is run on the client. Default="" MaxLength=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PreUpdateScript: Script file to run before theupdate starts. Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PreVmScript: Script file to run before the VM isloaded. Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PostUpdateScript: Script file to run after theupdate finishes. Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PostVmScript: Script file to run after the VM isunloaded. Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Domain: Domain to add the Disk Update Device(s) to.If not included, the first Domain Controller found on the Server is used.Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">OrganizationUnit: Organizational Unit to add theDisk Update Device(s) to. This parameter is optional. If it is not specified,the device is added to the built in Computers container. Child OU's should bedelimited with forward slashes, e.g. "ParentOU/ChildOU". Specialcharacters in an OU name, such as '"', '#', '+', ',', ';', '>', '=',must be escaped with a backslash. For example, an OU called "commaIn,TheMiddle"must be specified as "commaIn\,TheMiddle". The old syntax ofdelimiting child OU's with a comma is still supported, but deprecated. Notethat in this case, the child OU comes first, e.g. "ChildOU,ParentOU".Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PostUpdateApprove: Access to place the version inafter the update has occurred. 0 = Production, 1 = Test, 2 = Maintenance.Min=0, Max=2, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsUpdateTask[]: If successful, the PvsUpdateTaskobject(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsUpdateTask for Farm
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsUpdateTask for the Farm.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsUpdateTask</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get PvsUpdateTask for Site
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsUpdateTask for the Site named theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsUpdateTask -SiteName theSite</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Get PvsUpdateTask
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get PvsUpdateTask for UpdateTask named theUpdateTaskin Site named theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsUpdateTask -Name theUpdateTask -SiteNametheSite</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid can be used instead of Name so that theSiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>
##Get-PvsUploadCeip<a name="_Toc464196182"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Perform a one time upload of CEIP data. Returnupload Id if successful.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string OneTimeUpload: If -OneTimeUpload isspecified, perform a one time upload.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to have confirmationwithout the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">String: If successful, the String value is returned.</span></p>
##Get-PvsVersion<a name="_Toc464196183"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the version information.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MapiVersion: Version of the system inmajor.minor.point.build format.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DbVersion: Version of the database schema as anumber. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Type: Type of system. Values are 0 (Normal), 1(OROM), and 2 (Secure). Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DbEdition: Edition of the database. If 'ExpressEdition', monitor dbSize.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DbSize: Size of the database in MB. Monitor thisvalue if the edition is 'Express Edition' and this value is close to reachingthe 4000 MB maximum. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">MapiVersionNumber: Internal version number of thesystem. It is a number that is increaed by 100 for each major and minorrelease. Point releases are the numbers between each 100. Value is 0 when thesystem does not support MapiVersionNumber. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsVersion[]: If successful, the PvsVersionobject(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsVersion
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsVersion for the PVS SoapServer connectedto.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsVersion</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Get the PvsVersion MapiVersion
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsVersion for the PVS SoapServer connectedto.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsVersion -Fields MapiVersion</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
##Get-PvsVirtualHostingPool<a name="_Toc464196184"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the fields for a Virtual Hosting Pool or allVirtual Hosting Pools in a Site or the whole Farm. All Virtual Hosting Poolsare returned if no parameters are passed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or VirtualHostingPoolId: GUID of theVirtual Hosting Pool to Get.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site to Get all VirtualHosting Pools for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to Get allVirtual Hosting Pools for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or this optional ; resolution</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or VirtualHostingPoolName: Name of theVirtual Hosting Pool to Get.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site to Get all VirtualHosting Pools for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to Get allVirtual Hosting Pools for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">VirtualHostingPoolId or SiteId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">If only selected fields are needed, pass them in theFields parameter as a string array.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid or VirtualHostingPoolId: Read-only GUID thatuniquely identifies this Virtual Hosting Pool.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Name or VirtualHostingPoolName: Name of the VirtualHosting Pool. It is unique within the Site. Max Length=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteId: GUID of the Site that this Virtual HostingPool is a member of. It is not used with SiteName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SiteName: Name of the Site that this Virtual HostingPool is a member of. It is not used with SiteId.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Type: Type of the Virtual Hosting Pool. 0 = CitrixXenServer, 1 = Microsoft SCVMM/Hyper-V, 2 = VMWare vSphere/ESX. Min=0, Max=2,Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Description: User description. Default=""Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Server: Name or IP of the Host Server. MaxLength=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Port: Port of the Host Server. Min=80, Max=65534,Default=80</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Datacenter: Datacenter of the Virtual Hosting Pool.Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">UpdateLimit: Number of updates at the same time.Min=2, Max=1000, Default=1000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">UpdateTimeout: Timeout for updates. Min=2, Max=240,Default=60</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ShutdownTimeout: Timeout for shutdown. Min=2,Max=30, Default=10</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">UserName: Name to use when logging into the Server.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Password: Password to use when logging into theServer.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">XdHostingUnitUuid: UUID of XenDesktop Hosting UnitDefault=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">XsPvsProxyEnabled: Enable XenServer PVS proxy whenset to true Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PrepopulateEnabled: Enable prepopulate when set totrue Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">XsPvsSiteUuid: UUID of XenServerPVS_site  Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsVirtualHostingPool[]: If successful, thePvsVirtualHostingPool object(s) are returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Get PvsVirtualHostingPool for Farm
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsVirtualHostingPool for the Farm.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsVirtualHostingPool</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to assignAuthorization to for the AuthGroup.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] CollectionId: GUID of the Collection toassign Authorization to for the AuthGroup.</span></p>

##Import-PvsDevices<a name="_Toc464196187"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Import Devices from the contents of the comma or tabdelimited fileName specified. Each record needs to have Device Name, MacAddress, Site Name, Collection Name, optional Description and optional Type.Description must exist for Type to be included, but it can have 0 length. Typecan be 1 when it performs test of Disks, 2 when it performs maintenance onDisks, and 0 otherwise.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or FileName: Name of the file toimport the Devices from. This must be a full file path name.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] CollectionId: GUID of the Collection toimport the Devices into.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site to import theDevices into.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to import theDevices into.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or this optional ; resolution</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] CollectionName: Name of the Collection toimport the Devices into.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter CopyTemplate: If -CopyTemplate isspecified, the Template Device for the collection, if it exists, will be usedfor the property settings of the imported Devices.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter DoNotCreateNewSites: If-DoNotCreateNewSites is specified, new Sites found in the file will not becreated.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter DoNotCreateNewCollections: If-DoNotCreateNewCollections is specified, new Collections found in the file willnot be created.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site to import theDevices into.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to import theDevices into.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CollectionId or SiteId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of this operationis "medium". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "medium" or"low" to have confirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Import-PvsDevices

##Import-PvsDisk<a name="_Toc464196188"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Import a Disk. It will add a Disk Locator for theDisk to the Site. A manifest file must exist in the Store. If successful, thenew PvsDiskLocator is returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This required ; resolution</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or DiskLocatorName: Name of the DiskLocator File. It is unique within the Store. ASCII Max Length=52</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid ServerId: GUID of the single Server that thisDisk Locator is assigned to. It is not used with ServerName.Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string ServerName: Name of the single Server thatthis Disk Locator is assigned to. It is not used with ServerId.Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Description: User description.Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string MenuText: Text that is displayed in the BootMenu. If this field has no value, the name value is used. Default=""ASCII Max Length=64</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Enabled: True when this disk can bebooted, false otherwise. Default=true</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter RebalanceEnabled: True when thisServer can automatically rebalance Devices, false otherwise. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint RebalanceTriggerPercent: Percent over fair loadthat triggers a dynamic Device rebalance. Min=5, Max=5000, Default=25</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint SubnetAffinity: Qualifier for subnet affinitywhen assigning a Server. 0=None, 1=Best Effort, 2=Fixed. Min=0, Max=2, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter VHDX: If -VHDX is specified, VHDXwill be used for the format of the image. VHDX has a Block size of 32 MB. VHDis the default.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid SiteId: GUID of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string SiteName: Name of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid StoreId: GUID of the Store that is needed whena DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string StoreName: Name of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">ServerId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to haveconfirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsDiskLocator: If successful, the newPvsDiskLocator object is returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Import-PvsDisk for VHDX to PvsDiskLocator
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This example imports a VHDX Disk and uses thedefault settings for all other optional parameters.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$thePvsDiskLocator = Import-PvsDisk -NametheDiskLocator -SiteName theSite -StoreName theStore -VHDX</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">if ($thePvsDiskLocator -eq$null)      # check that the PvsDiskLocator wasreturned</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">{</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.4in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$thePvsDiskLocator.Name            #display the name</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">}</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Import-PvsDisk for VHD to PvsDiskLocator
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This example imports a VHD Disk and sets all of theother optional parameters to non-default values.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$thePvsDiskLocator = Import-PvsDisk -Name theDiskLocator-SiteName theSite -StoreName theStore -ServerName theServer -Description"The VHD disk." -MenuText "The VHD disk." -Enabled-RebalanceEnabled -rebalanceTriggerPercent 50 -SubnetAffinity 2</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">if ($thePvsDiskLocator -eq$null)      # check that the PvsDiskLocator wasreturned</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">{</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.4in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$thePvsDiskLocator.Name            #display the name</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">}</span></p>
##Import-PvsOemLicenses<a name="_Toc464196189"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Oem Only: Import the Oem Licenses from the contentsof the fileName specified.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or FileName: Name of the file toimport the Oem Licenses from. This must be a full file path name.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "medium". If -Confirm is specified, the operation willbe confirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "medium" or"low" to have confirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Import-PvsOemLicenses
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Import-PvsOemLicenses -Name"C:\import\theFileName"</span></p>
##Invoke-PvsActivateDeviceMAK<a name="_Toc464196190"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Proxy Activate with a Multiple Activation Key and/orapply the Confirmation ID to remote activate a Device DiskLocator pair.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or DeviceId: GUID of the Device toActivate.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or DeviceName: Name of the Device toActivate.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsPhysicalAddress[] DeviceMac: MAC of the Device toActivate.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] MakUsedToActivate: Multiple Activation Keyto Activate the Device with.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DeviceId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to haveconfirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Invoke-ActivateDeviceMAK for Name
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Invoke-ActivateDeviceMAK -Name theDevice-MakUsedToActivate "2FKWD-NYFC7-VH8G3-BK3GD-7T667"</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Invoke-ActivateDeviceMAK for DeviceMac
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Invoke-ActivateDeviceMAK -DeviceMac"00-11-22-33-44-55" -MakUsedToActivate"2FKWD-NYFC7-VH8G3-BK3GD-7T667"</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Invoke-ActivateDeviceMAK for PvsDevice Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The Get-PvsDevice output is piped to theInvoke-ActivateDeviceMAK.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDevice -Name theDevice -Fields Guid |Invoke-ActivateDeviceMAK -MakUsedToActivate"2FKWD-NYFC7-VH8G3-BK3GD-7T667"</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
##Invoke-PvsMarkDown<a name="_Toc464196191"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Mark Down a Device, Collection, View, Server orSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] DeviceId: GUID of the Device to Mark Down.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] DeviceName: Name of the Device to MarkDown.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsPhysicalAddress[] DeviceMac: MAC of the Device toMark Down.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] CollectionId: GUID of the Collection to MarkDown all Devices.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteViewId: GUID of the Site View to MarkDown all Devices.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site. Can be used aloneto Mark Down all Servers and Devices in the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site. Can be usedalone to Mark Down all Servers and Devices in the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] FarmViewId: GUID of the Farm View to MarkDown all Devices.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] FarmViewName: Name of the Farm View to MarkDown all Devices.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] DiskLocatorId: GUID of the DiskLocator toMark Down all Devices.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] ServerId: GUID of the Server to Mark Down.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] ServerName: Name of the Server to MarkDown.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or one of these required ; resolutions</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] CollectionName: Name of the Collection toMark Down all Devices.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteViewName: Name of the Site View to MarkDown all Devices.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] DiskLocatorName: Name of the DiskLocator toMark Down all Devices.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site. Can be used aloneto Mark Down all Servers and Devices in the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site. Can be usedalone to Mark Down all Servers and Devices in the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] StoreId: GUID of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] StoreName: Name of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DeviceId, CollectionId, SiteViewId, SiteId,FarmViewId, DiskLocatorId or ServerId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "medium". If -Confirm is specified, the operation willbe confirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "medium" or"low" to have confirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Invoke-PvsMarkDown for SiteName
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Invoke-PvsMarkDown -SiteName theSite</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Invoke-PvsMarkDown for PvsSite Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The Get-PvsSite output is piped to theInvoke-PvsMarkDown.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsSite -Name theSite -Fields Guid |Invoke-PvsMarkDown</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Invoke-PvsMarkDown for ServerName
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Invoke-PvsMarkDown -ServerName theServer</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 4: Invoke-PvsMarkDown for PvsServer Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The Get-PvsServer output is piped to theInvoke-PvsMarkDown.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsServer -Name theServer -Fields Guid |Invoke-PvsMarkDown</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 5: Invoke-PvsMarkDown for DeviceName
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Invoke-PvsMarkDown -DeviceName theDevice</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 6: Invoke-PvsMarkDown for PvsDevice Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The Get-PvsDevice output is piped to theInvoke-PvsMarkDown.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDevice -Name theDevice -Fields Guid |Invoke-PvsMarkDown</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 7: Invoke-PvsMarkDown for DeviceMac
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Invoke-PvsMarkDown -DeviceMac"00-11-22-33-44-55"</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 8: Invoke-PvsMarkDown for PvsDevice Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The Get-PvsDevice output is piped to theInvoke-PvsMarkDown.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDevice -DeviceMac"00-11-22-33-44-55" -Fields Guid | Invoke-PvsMarkDown</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 9: Invoke-PvsMarkDown for FarmViewName
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Invoke-PvsMarkDown -FarmViewName theFarmView</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 10: Invoke-PvsMarkDown for PvsFarmView Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The Get-PvsFarmView output is piped to theInvoke-PvsMarkDown.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsFarmView -Name theFarmView -Fields Guid | Invoke-PvsMarkDown</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 11: Invoke-PvsMarkDown for CollectionName
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Invoke-PvsMarkDown -CollectionName theCollection-SiteName theSite</span></p>
