<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or DiskLocatorName: Name of the DiskLocator File to Merge.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Access: Access to set the version to when mergeis finished. Default value is found in the Farm MergeMode setting. Values are:0 (Production), 1 (Test) and 2 (Maintenance), Min=0, Max=2</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter NewBase: If -NewBase is specified,create a new base from last base plus all updates from that base. The defaultis to merge all updates from the last base by default.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] StoreId: GUID of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] StoreName: Name of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the members belowcan be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "medium". If -Confirm is specified, the operation willbe confirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "medium" or "low"to have confirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Merge-PvsDisk for Name
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Merge-PvsDisk -Name theDiskLocator -SiteName theSite-StoreName theStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid can be used instead of Name so that theSiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Merge-PvsDisk for PvsDiskLocator Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The Get-PvsDiskLocator output is piped to theMerge-PvsDisk.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskLocator -Name theDiskLocator -SiteNametheSite -StoreName theStore -Fields Guid | Merge-PvsDisk</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid can be used instead of Name so that theSiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Merge-PvsDisk for Name with Access and NewBase
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Merge-PvsDisk -Name theDiskLocator -SiteName theSite-StoreName theStore -Access 2 -NewBase</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid can be used instead of Name so that theSiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 4: Merge-PvsDisk for PvsDiskLocator Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The Get-PvsDiskLocator output is piped to theMerge-PvsDisk.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDiskLocator -Name theDiskLocator -SiteNametheSite -StoreName theStore -Fields Guid | Merge-PvsDisk -Access 2 -NewBase</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid can be used instead of Name so that theSiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
##Mount-PvsDisk<a name="_Toc464196196"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Mount a disk. If successful, the drive letter or anempty string is returned. An empty string can be returned if a drive letter wasnot assigned by the operating system before the maxDiskLetterWaitSeconds isused up.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid Guid or DiskLocatorId: GUID of the Disk Locatorto Mount the Disk.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or this required ; resolution</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or DiskLocatorName: Name of the DiskLocator to Mount the Disk.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid ServerId: Specific Server GUID to use to Mountthe Disk.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string ServerName: Specific Server Name to use toMount the Disk.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint MaxDiskLetterWaitSeconds: Once mapping a diskis successful, this is the maximum amount of seconds spent waiting for theoperating system to return a drive letter. If the operating system does notreturn a drive letter before the maximum wait time, then an empty string isreturned. Default=30</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid SiteId: GUID of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string SiteName: Name of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid StoreId: GUID of the Store that is needed whena DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string StoreName: Name of the Store that is neededwhen a DiskLocatorName is used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DiskLocatorId or ServerId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to haveconfirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">String: If successful, the String value is returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Mount-PvsDisk
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$theDriveLetter = Start-PvsMapDisk -NametheDiskLocator -SiteName theSite -StoreName theStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">if ($theDriveLetter -ne $null -and$theDriveLetter.length -gt 0)</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">{</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.4in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$theDriveLetter    # display thedrive letter</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">}</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid can be used instead of Name so that theSiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Mount-PvsDisk for PvsServer with MaxDiskLetterWaitSeconds
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$theDriveLetter = Start-PvsMapDisk -NametheDiskLocator -SiteName theSite -StoreName theStore -ServerName theServer-MaxDiskLetterWaitSeconds 60</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">if ($theDriveLetter -ne $null -and$theDriveLetter.length -gt 0)</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">{</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.4in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$theDriveLetter    # display thedrive letter</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">}</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid can be used instead of Name so that theSiteName or SiteId and StoreName or StoreId are not also needed.</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CollectionId can be used instead of CollectionNameso that the SiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>

##New-PvsAuthGroup<a name="_Toc464196199"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Create a new authorization AuthGroup for an ActiveDirectory or Windows Group.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">All parameters that do not have a Default arerequired, unless only a few of a group are required.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or AuthGroupName: Name of the ActiveDirectory or Windows Group. Max Length=450</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Description: User description.Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to haveconfirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsAuthGroup: If successful, the new PvsAuthGroupobject is returned.</span></p>

####EXAMPLE 2: Create PvsAuthGroup with All Fields
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Creates a PvsAuthGroup for the"AD\PVSFarmAdminGroup" Active Directory security group with"Farm AuthGroup" as the description.</span></p>

####EXAMPLE 3: Create PvsAuthGroup and Assign to Site
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Creates a PvsAuthGroup for the"AD\PVSSiteAdminGroup" Active Directory security group and Assigns itto theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">New-PvsAuthGroup -Name"AD\PVSSiteAdminGroup" | Grant-PvsAuthGroup -SiteName theSite</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Create a new entry for CeipData table.</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to haveconfirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsCeipData: If successful, the new PvsCeipDataobject is returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Create PvsCeipData with Minimum Fields
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Creates a PvsCeipData with enabled as false.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">New-PvsCeipData -Enabled 0</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Create PvsCeipData with All Fields
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Creates a PvsCeipData with enabled as true and withall fields set different than defaults.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">New-PvsCeipData -Enabled 1 -NextUpload"2016-01-14 15:52:00"</span></p>

####EXAMPLE 1: Create PvsCisData with Minimum Fields
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Creates a PvsCisData with userName as userName andwith all fields set different than defaults.</span></p>

##New-PvsCollection<a name="_Toc464196202"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Create a new Collection for a Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">All parameters that do not have a Default arerequired, unless only a few of a group are required.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or CollectionName: Name of theCollection. It is unique within the Site. Max Length=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid SiteId: GUID of the Site that this Collectionis a member of. It is not used with SiteName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string SiteName: Name of the Site that thisCollection is a member of. It is not used with SiteId.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Description: User description.Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint LastAutoAddDeviceNumber: The Device Number ofthe last Auto Added Device. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Disabled: If -Disabled is specified,the Devices in the Collection can not be booted. By default the Devices can bebooted.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string AutoAddPrefix: The string put before theDevice Number for Auto Add. Default="" ASCII computer name charactersno end digit Max Length=12</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string AutoAddSuffix: The string put after theDevice Number for Auto Add. Default="" ASCII computer name charactersno begin digit Max Length=12</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter NoAutoAddZeroFill: If-NoAutoAddZeroFill is specified, zeros will not be placed before the DeviceNumber up to the AutoAddNumberLength for Auto Add.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint AutoAddNumberLength: The maximum length of theDevice Number for Auto Add. This length plus the AutoAddPrefix length plus theAutoAddSuffix length must be less than 16. Required that ((lenautoAddPrefix+lenautoAddSuffix)+AutoAddNumberLength)<=15.Min=3, Max=9, Default=4</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to have confirmationwithout the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsCollection: If successful, the new PvsCollectionobject is returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Create PvsCollection with Minimum Fields
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Creates a PvsCollection named theCollection intheSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">New-PvsCollection -Name theCollection -SiteNametheSite</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Create PvsCollection with All Fields
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Creates a PvsCollection named theCollection intheSite with "XenServer Collection" as the description that isDisabled and has all AutoAdd settings different than defaults.</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Creates a PvsCollection named theCollection intheSite and Assigns AuthGroup "AD\PVSCollectionAdminGroup" to it.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">New-PvsCollection -Name theCollection -SiteNametheSite | Grant-PvsAuthGroup -AuthGroupName"AD\PVSCollectionAdminGroup"</span></p>
##New-PvsDevice<a name="_Toc464196203"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Add a new Device to a Collection.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">All parameters that do not have a Default arerequired, unless only a few of a group are required.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or DeviceName: Computer name with nospaces. ASCII computer name characters Max Length=15</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid CollectionId: GUID of the Collection thisDevice is to be a member of. It is not used with CollectionName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string CollectionName: Name of the Collection thisDevice is to be a member of. SiteName or SiteId must also be used.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid SiteId: GUID of the Site the CollectionName isto be a member of. This or SiteName is used with CollectionName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string SiteName: Name of the Site the CollectionNameis to be a member of. This or SiteId is used with CollectionName.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Description: User description.Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsPhysicalAddress DeviceMac: Ethernet address canhave the form XX-XX-XX-XX-XX-XX. Uniquely identifies the Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint BootFrom: Device to boot from. Choices are 1for vDisk, 2 for Hard Disk, and 3 for Floppy. Min=1, Max=3, Default=1</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string ClassName: Used by Automatic Update featureto match new versions of Disks to a Device. Default="" Max Length=41</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Port: UDP port to use with Stream Service.Min=1025, Max=65534, Default=6901</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Disabled: If -Disabled is specified,the Device can not be booted. By default the Device can be booted.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter LocalDiskEnabled: If-LocalDiskEnabled is specified, there will be a local disk menu choice for theDevice.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Authentication: Device log in authentication.Choices are 0 for none, 1 for User Name/Password, and 2 for Extern. Min=0,Max=2, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string User: Name of user to authenticate before theboot process continues. Default="" ASCII Max Length=20</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Password: Password of user to authenticatebefore the boot process continues. Default="" ASCII Max Length=100</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter CopyTemplate: If -CopyTemplate isspecified, the Template Device for the collection, if it exists, will be usedfor the property settings of the new Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint AdTimestamp: The time the Active Directorymachine account password was generated. Do not set this field, it is only setinternally by PVS. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint AdSignature: The signature of the ActiveDirectory machine account password. Do not set this field, it is only setinternally by PVS. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint LogLevel: Level to perform logging at. Valuesare: 0 (None), 1 (Fatal), 2 (Error), 3 (Warning), 4 (Info), 5 (Debug), and 6(Trace). Min=0, Max=6, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string DomainName: Fully qualified name of thedomain that the Device belongs to. Do not set this field, it is only setinternally by PVS. Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string DomainObjectSID: The value of the objectSIDAD attribute of the same name for the Device's computer account. Do not setthis field, it is only set internally by PVS. Default="" MaxLength=186</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string DomainControllerName: The name of the DC usedto create the host's computer account. Do not set this field, it is only setinternally by PVS. Default="" Max Length=4000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DateTime DomainTimeCreated: The time that thecomputer account was created. Has the date and time including milliseconds. Donot set this field, it is only set internally by PVS. Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Type: 1 when it performs test of Disks, 2 whenit performs maintenance on Disks, 0 otherwise. Min=0, Max=2, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint LocalWriteCacheDiskSize: The size in GB toformat the Device cache file disk. If the value is 0, then the disk is notformatted. Min=0, Max=2048, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid VirtualHostingPoolId: GUID that uniquelyidentifies the Virtual Hosting Pool for a VM. This is needed when Adding a VM device.Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter BdmBoot: If -BdmBoot is 0, use PXE,1 use BDM. PXE boot is used by default.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint BdmType: Use PXE boot when set to 0, BDM (Bios)boot when set to 1 and BDM (Uefi) boot when set to 2.  Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint BdmFormat: 1 use VHD for BDMboot, 2 use ISO, 3use USB. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DateTime BdmUpdated: Timestamp of the last BDM bootdisk update. Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DateTime BdmCreated: Timstamp when BDM device wascreated  Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid XsPvsProxyUuid: UUID of XenServer PVS_proxyDefault=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter XsPvsProxyEnabled: Enable XenServerPVS proxy when set to true Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to haveconfirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsDevice: If successful, the new PvsDevice objectis returned.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Create PvsDevice with Minimum Fields
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Creates a PvsDevice named theDevice in theCollectionof theSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">New-PvsDevice -Name theDevice -DeviceMac"00-11-22-33-44-55" -SiteName theSite -CollectionName theCollection</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CollectionId can be used instead of CollectionNameso that the SiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Create PvsDevice with All Fields
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Creates a PvsDevice named theDevice in theCollectionof theSite with all fields set different than defaults.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">New-PvsDevice -Name theDevice -DeviceMac"00-11-22-33-44-55" -SiteName theSite -CollectionName theCollection-Description "XenServer Device" -BootFrom 2 -ClassName C -Port 6000-Disabled -LocalDiskEnabled -Authentication 1 -User U -Password P -CopyTemplate-LogLevel 3 -Type 2 -LocalWriteCacheDiskSize 100 -BdmBoot -VirtualHostingPoolId"15e0544e-4cf9-449e-b47f-8d836b16026f"</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Do not set AdTimestamp, AdSignature, DomainName,DomainObjectSID, DomainControllerName and DomainTimeCreated. They are only setinternally by PVS.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CollectionId can be used instead of CollectionNameso that the SiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Create PvsDevice and Boot it
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Creates a PvsDevice named theDevice in theCollectionof theSite and Boots it.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">New-PvsDevice -Name theDevice -DeviceMac"00-11-22-33-44-55" -SiteName theSite -CollectionName theCollection |Start-PvsBoot</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CollectionId can be used instead of CollectionNameso that the SiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>
