##Revoke-PvsAuthGroup<a name="_Toc464196239"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Remove Farm, Site or Collection Authorization for anAuthGroup. If no Site or Collection is specified, Farm Authorization is removedfor the AuthGroup.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] Guid or AuthGroupId: GUID of the AuthGroup toremove Authorization for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] Name or AuthGroupName: Name of theAuthGroup to remove Authorization for.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site to removeAuthorization for the AuthGroup.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to removeAuthorization for the AuthGroup.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] CollectionId: GUID of the Collection toremove Authorization for the AuthGroup.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or this optional ; resolution</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] CollectionName: Name of the Collection toremove Authorization for the AuthGroup.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid[] SiteId: GUID of the Site to removeAuthorization for the AuthGroup.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] SiteName: Name of the Site to removeAuthorization for the AuthGroup.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Instead of a parameter that matches one of themembers listed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsObject[] Object: PvsObjects with the membersbelow can be used as the Object parameter or from a pileline:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.1in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">AuthGroupId, SiteId or CollectionId</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "medium". If -Confirm is specified, the operation willbe confirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "medium" or"low" to have confirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Revoke-PvsAuthGroup for PvsAuthGroup to PvsFarm
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Revoke-PvsAuthGroup -Name theAuthGroup</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Revoke-PvsAuthGroup for PvsAuthGroup Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The Get-PvsAuthGroup output is piped to theRevoke-PvsAuthGroup.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuthGroup -Name theAuthGroup -Fields Guid |Revoke-PvsAuthGroup</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>

####EXAMPLE 4: Revoke-PvsAuthGroup for PvsAuthGroup Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The Get-PvsAuthGroup output is piped to theRevoke-PvsAuthGroup.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuthGroup -Name theAuthGroup -Fields Guid |Revoke-PvsAuthGroup -SiteName theSite</span></p>

####EXAMPLE 5: Revoke-PvsAuthGroup for PvsSite Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The Get-PvsSite output is piped to theRevoke-PvsAuthGroup.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsSite -Name theSite -Fields Guid |Revoke-PvsAuthGroup -Name theAuthGroup</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 6: Revoke-PvsAuthGroup for PvsAuthGroup to PvsCollection
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Revoke-PvsAuthGroup -Name theAuthGroup-CollectionName theCollection -SiteName theSite</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CollectionId can be used instead of CollectionNameso that the SiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 7: Revoke-PvsAuthGroup for PvsAuthGroup Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The Get-PvsAuthGroup output is piped to theRevoke-PvsAuthGroup.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuthGroup -Name theAuthGroup -Fields Guid |Revoke-PvsAuthGroup -CollectionName theCollection -SiteName theSite</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">CollectionId can be used instead of CollectionNameso that the SiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 8: Revoke-PvsAuthGroup for PvsCollection Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The Get-PvsCollection output is piped to theRevoke-PvsAuthGroup.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsCollection -Name theCollection -SiteName theSite-Fields Guid | Revoke-PvsAuthGroup -Name theAuthGroup</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>

##Set-PvsAuthGroup<a name="_Toc464196240"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set AuthGroup(s) changed values from PvsAuthGroupobject(s), or set one or more field values for a PvsAuthGroup.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsAuthGroup AuthGroup: PvsAuthGroup object(s) withchanged property value(s) to be set. The object(s) can come from a pileline.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">These values are in the PvsAuthGroup object, andonly will be set if the value has changed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or AuthGroupName: Name of the ActiveDirectory or Windows Group. Max Length=450</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Description: User description. Default=""Max Length=250</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">When AuthGroup is not passed, the parameters beloware used:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid Guid or AuthGroupId: GUID of the AuthGroup toSet.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or AuthGroupName: Name of the AuthGroupto Set.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional field values to set:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string NewName: Name of the Active Directory orWindows Group. Max Length=450</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Description: User description.Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter PassThru: If -PassThru is specified,the resulting PvsAuthGroup object(s) are returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to haveconfirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Set PvsAuthGroup for Individual Fields
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsAuthGroup into a $o variable. Change the$o field values and then Set the PvsAuthGroup with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o = Get-PvsAuthGroup -Name oldName -Fields Name</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o.Name = "newName"</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set-PvsAuthGroup $o</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Set PvsAuthGroup for a Field Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsAuthGroup into a $o variable. Change a $ofield to the correct value and then Set the PvsAuthGroup with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsAuthGroup -Name oldName -Fields Name |foreach { $o = $_; $o.Name = "newName"; $o } | Set-PvsAuthGroup</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The "foreach { $o = $_; $o.X = Y; $o }"sets the field X to value Y and returns the object again so it can be piped tothe Set command for update.</span></p>
##Set-PvsCeipData<a name="_Toc464196241"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set Ceip changed values from a PvsCeip object, orset one or more field values for a PvsCeip.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsCeipData CeipData: PvsCeipData object(s) withchanged property value(s) to be set. The object(s) can come from a pileline.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">These values are in the PvsCeipData object, and onlywill be set if the value has changed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Enabled: 1 if CEIP is enabled, otherwise 0.Min=0, Max=1</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DateTime NextUpload: Date and time next CEIP uploadis due if enabled is 1. Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint InProgress: 1 if an upload is currently inprogress, otherwise 0. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid ServerId: ID of server that is currentlyuploading, null if InProgress is 0.Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint OneTimeUpload: 1 to perform a one time upload.</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">When CeipData is not passed, the parameters beloware used:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Uuid: CEIP UUID of this Farm. This isoptional since there is only one.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional field values to set:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Enabled: 1 if CEIP is enabled, otherwise 0.Min=0, Max=1</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DateTime NextUpload: Date and time next CEIP uploadis due if enabled is 1. Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint InProgress: 1 if an upload is currently inprogress, otherwise 0. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid ServerId: ID of server that is currentlyuploading, null if InProgress is 0.Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint OneTimeUpload: 1 to perform a one time upload.</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter PassThru: If -PassThru is specified,the resulting PvsCeipData object(s) are returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to haveconfirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Set PvsCeipData for Individual Fields
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsCeipData into a $o variable. Change the$o field values and then Set the PvsCeipData with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o = Get-PvsCeipData -Fields Enabled, NextUpload</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o.Enabled = $true</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o.NextUpload = "2016-01-14 15:52:00"</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set-PvsCeipData $o</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Set PvsCeipData for a Field Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsCeipData into a $o variable for the fieldthat has the wrong value. Change the $o field to the correct value and then Setthe PvsCeipData with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsCeipData -Fields Enabled | Where-Object{$_.Enabled -ne $false} | foreach { $o = $_; $o.Enabled = $false; $o } | Set-PvsCeipData</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The "foreach { $o = $_; $o.X = Y; $o }"sets the field X to value Y and returns the object again so it can be piped tothe Set command for update.</span></p>
##Set-PvsCisData<a name="_Toc464196242"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set one or more field values for CIS data.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsCisData CisData: PvsCisData object(s) withchanged property value(s) to be set. The object(s) can come from a pileline.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">These values are in the PvsCisData object, and onlywill be set if the value has changed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string UserName: Username used to obtain the tokenDefault="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Path: Path where the last problem reportbundle was saved Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Password: Password of the user required toobtain the token. This is required only by Set and Add</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">When CisData is not passed, the parameters below areused:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid Guid or CisDataId: CIS UUID of this Farm. Thisis optional since there is only a single record.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional field values to set:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string UserName: Username used to obtain the tokenDefault="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Path: Path where the last problem reportbundle was saved Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Password: Password of the user required toobtain the token. This is required only by Set and Add</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter PassThru: If -PassThru is specified,the resulting PvsCisData object(s) are returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to haveconfirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Set PvsCisData for Individual Fields
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsCisData into a $o variable. Change the $ofield values and then Set the PvsCisData with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o = Get-PvsCisData -Fields UserName, UploadToken</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o.UserName = userName</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o.UploadToken = token</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set-PvsCisData $o</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Set PvsCisData for a Field Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsCisData into a $o variable for the fieldthat has the wrong value. Change the $o field to the correct value and then Setthe PvsCisData with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsCisData -Fields UserName | Where-Object {$_.UserName-ne newUserName} | foreach { $o = $_; $o.UserName = newUserName; $o } |Set-PvsCisData</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The "foreach { $o = $_; $o.X = Y; $o }"sets the field X to value Y and returns the object again so it can be piped tothe Set command for update.</span></p>
##Set-PvsCollection<a name="_Toc464196243"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set Collection(s) changed values from PvsCollectionobject(s), or set one or more field values for a PvsCollection.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsCollection Collection: PvsCollection object(s)with changed property value(s) to be set. The object(s) can come from apileline.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">These values are in the PvsCollection object, andonly will be set if the value has changed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or CollectionName: Name of theCollection. It is unique within the Site. Max Length=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Description: User description.Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid TemplateDeviceId: GUID of a Device in theCollection whose settings are used for initial values of new Devices. Not usedwith templateDeviceName. Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string TemplateDeviceName: Name of a Device in theCollection whose settings are used for initial values of new Devices. Not usedwith TemplateDeviceId. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint LastAutoAddDeviceNumber: The Device Number ofthe last Auto Added Device. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool Enabled: True when Devices in the Collectioncan be booted, false otherwise. Default=true</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string AutoAddPrefix: The string put before theDevice Number for Auto Add. Default="" ASCII computer name charactersno end digit Max Length=12</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string AutoAddSuffix: The string put after theDevice Number for Auto Add. Default="" ASCII computer name charactersno begin digit Max Length=12</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool AutoAddZeroFill: True when zeros be placedbefore the Device Number up to the AutoAddNumberLength for Auto Add, falseotherwise. Default=true</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint AutoAddNumberLength: The maximum length of theDevice Number for Auto Add. This length plus the AutoAddPrefix length plus theAutoAddSuffix length must be less than 16. Required that((lenautoAddPrefix+lenautoAddSuffix)+AutoAddNumberLength)<=15. Min=3, Max=9,Default=4</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">When Collection is not passed, the parameters beloware used:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid Guid or CollectionId: GUID of the Collection toSet.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or this required ; resolution</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or CollectionName: Name of theCollection to Set.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid SiteId: GUID of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string SiteName: Name of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional field values to set:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string NewName: Name of the Collection. It is uniquewithin the Site. Max Length=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Description: User description.Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid TemplateDeviceId: GUID of a Device in theCollection whose settings are used for initial values of new Devices. Not usedwith templateDeviceName. Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string TemplateDeviceName: Name of a Device in theCollection whose settings are used for initial values of new Devices. Not usedwith TemplateDeviceId. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint LastAutoAddDeviceNumber: The Device Number ofthe last Auto Added Device. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool Enabled: True when Devices in the Collectioncan be booted, false otherwise. Default=true</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string AutoAddPrefix: The string put before theDevice Number for Auto Add. Default="" ASCII computer name charactersno end digit Max Length=12</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string AutoAddSuffix: The string put after theDevice Number for Auto Add. Default="" ASCII computer name charactersno begin digit Max Length=12</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool AutoAddZeroFill: True when zeros be placedbefore the Device Number up to the AutoAddNumberLength for Auto Add, falseotherwise. Default=true</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint AutoAddNumberLength: The maximum length of theDevice Number for Auto Add. This length plus the AutoAddPrefix length plus theAutoAddSuffix length must be less than 16. Required that ((lenautoAddPrefix+lenautoAddSuffix)+AutoAddNumberLength)<=15.Min=3, Max=9, Default=4</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter PassThru: If -PassThru is specified,the resulting PvsCollection object(s) are returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to haveconfirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Set PvsCollection for Individual Fields
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsCollection into a $o variable. Change the$o field values and then Set the PvsCollection with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o = Get-PvsCollection -Name theCollection -SiteNametheSite -Fields AutoAddSuffix, AutoAddZeroFill</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o.AutoAddSuffix = "Ex"</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o.AutoAddZeroFill = $true</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set-PvsCollection $o</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid can be used instead of Name so that theSiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Set PvsCollection for a Field Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsCollection into a $o variable. Change a$o field to the correct value and then Set the PvsCollection with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsCollection -CollectionName theCollection-SiteName theSite -Fields AutoAddSuffix | foreach { $o = $_; $o.AutoAddSuffix ="Ex"; $o } | Set-PvsCollection</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The "foreach { $o = $_; $o.X = Y; $o }"sets the field X to value Y and returns the object again so it can be piped tothe Set command for update.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Get PvsCollection and Enable
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsCollection that are not Enabled and thenEnables them.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsCollection -Fields Enabled | Where-Object{$_.Enabled -eq $false} | foreach { $o = $_; $o.Enabled = $true; $o } |Set-PvsCollection</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The "foreach { $o = $_; $o.X = Y; $o }"sets the field X to value Y and returns the object again so it can be piped tothe Set command for update.</span></p>
##Set-PvsConnection<a name="_Toc464196244"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set the SoapServer connection, and if -Persist isspecified the connection settings are saved in the registry. A PvsConnectionobject can be used as the parameter.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsConnection Connection: PvsConnection object withchanged property value(s) to be set. The object can come from a pileline.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">These values are in the PvsConnection object, andonly will be set if the value has changed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or Server: Name or IP of the Server toconnect to. Default=localhost</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Port: The Port to use to connect.Default=54321</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string User: User name to use for Authentication. Ifit has a value, it will be *****. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Domain: Domain name to use forAuthentication. If it has a value, it will be *****. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Password: Password to use for Authentication.If it has a value, it will be *****. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Persist: True when the connection settingsshould be, for Set, or have been, for Get, saved to the registry.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsConnection can be created or modified usingmethods below:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.8in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">New-Object Citrix.PVS.SnapIn.PvsConnection: Createsdefault Server=localhost, Port=54321, and no authentication.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.8in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">New-ObjectCitrix.PVS.SnapIn.PvsConnection(Citrix.PVS.SnapIn copyFrom): Creates withsettings of the copyFrom Citrix.PVS.SnapIn.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.8in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SetServerToLocalHostDefaultSettings:Server=localhost, Port=54321, and no authentication.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.8in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Copy(Citrix.PVS.SnapIn copyFrom): Modifies thesettings to match the copyFrom Citrix.PVS.SnapIn.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.8in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Equals(Citrix.PVS.SnapIn compareTo): Returns truewhen the settings match what is in the compareTo.</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">When Connection is not passed, the parameters beloware used:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional field values to set:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or Server: Name or IP of the Server toconnect to. Default=localhost</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Port: The Port to use to connect.Default=54321</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string User: User name to use for Authentication. Ifit has a value, it will be *****. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Domain: Domain name to use forAuthentication. If it has a value, it will be *****. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Password: Password to use for Authentication.If it has a value, it will be *****. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Persist: True when the connection settingsshould be, for Set, or have been, for Get, saved to the registry.</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter PassThru: If -PassThru is specified,the resulting PvsConnection object is returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to haveconfirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Set PvsConnection for Individual Fields
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsConnection into a $o variable. Change the$o field values and then Set the PvsConnection with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o = Get-PvsConnection -Fields Port</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o.Port = 54322</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set-PvsConnection $o</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Set PvsConnection for a Field Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsConnection into a $o variable for thefield that has the wrong value. Change the $o field to the correct value andthen Set the PvsConnection with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsConnection -Fields Port | Where-Object{$_.Port -ne 54322} | foreach { $o = $_; $o.Port = 54322; $o } |Set-PvsConnection</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The "foreach { $o = $_; $o.X = Y; $o }"sets the field X to value Y and returns the object again so it can be piped tothe Set command for update.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Set PvsConnection Port with Parameter
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set the PvsConnection Port using the Port parameterinstead of a PvsConnection object.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set-PvsConnection -Port 54322</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This is the only Set command that has fieldparameters.</span></p>
##Set-PvsDevice<a name="_Toc464196245"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set Device(s) changed values from PvsDeviceobject(s), or set one or more field values for one or more PvsDevices.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsDevice Device: PvsDevice object(s) with changedproperty value(s) to be set. The object(s) can come from a pileline.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">These values are in the PvsDevice object, and onlywill be set if the value has changed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or DeviceName: Computer name with nospaces. ASCII computer name characters Max Length=15</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Description: User description.Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsPhysicalAddress DeviceMac: Ethernet address canhave the form XX-XX-XX-XX-XX-XX. Uniquely identifies the Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint BootFrom: Device to boot from. Choices are 1for vDisk, 2 for Hard Disk, and 3 for Floppy. This cannot be Set for a Devicewith Personal vDisk. Min=1, Max=3, Default=1</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string ClassName: Used by Automatic Update featureto match new versions of Disks to a Device. This cannot be Set for a Devicewith Personal vDisk. Default="" Max Length=41</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Port: UDP port to use with Stream Service.Min=1025, Max=65534, Default=6901</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool Enabled: True when it can be booted, falseotherwise. This cannot be Set for a Device with Personal vDisk. Default=true</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool LocalDiskEnabled: If there is a local disk menuchoice for the Device, this is true. This cannot be Set for a Device withPersonal vDisk. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Authentication: Device log in authentication.Choices are 0 for none, 1 for User Name/Password, and 2 for Extern. This cannotbe Set for a Device with Personal vDisk. Min=0, Max=2, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string User: Name of user to authenticate before theboot process continues. This cannot be Set for a Device with Personal vDisk.Default="" ASCII Max Length=20</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Password: Password of user to authenticatebefore the boot process continues. This cannot be Set for a Device with PersonalvDisk. Default="" ASCII Max Length=100</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint AdTimestamp: The time the Active Directorymachine account password was generated. Do not set this field, it is only setinternally by PVS. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint AdSignature: The signature of the ActiveDirectory machine account password. Do not set this field, it is only setinternally by PVS. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint LogLevel: Level to perform logging at. Valuesare: 0 (None), 1 (Fatal), 2 (Error), 3 (Warning), 4 (Info), 5 (Debug), and 6(Trace). Min=0, Max=6, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string DomainName: Fully qualified name of thedomain that the Device belongs to. Do not set this field, it is only setinternally by PVS. Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string DomainObjectSID: The value of the objectSIDAD attribute of the same name for the Device's computer account. Do not setthis field, it is only set internally by PVS. Default="" MaxLength=186</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string DomainControllerName: The name of the DC usedto create the host's computer account. Do not set this field, it is only setinternally by PVS. Default="" Max Length=4000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DateTime DomainTimeCreated: The time that thecomputer account was created. Has the date and time including milliseconds. Donot set this field, it is only set internally by PVS. Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Type: 1 when it performs test of Disks, 2 whenit performs maintenance on Disks, 3 when it has a Personal vDisk, 4 when it hasa Personal vDisk and performs tests, 0 otherwise. A Device with type 0 - 3 canonly be Set to 0 - 3, and a Device with type 3 - 4 can only be Set to 3 - 4. Min=0,Max=4, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint LocalWriteCacheDiskSize: The size in GB toformat the Device cache file disk. If the value is 0, then the disk is notformatted. Min=0, Max=2048, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool BdmBoot: Use PXE boot when set to false, BDMboot when set to true. Default is PXE Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint BdmType: Use PXE boot when set to 0, BDM (Bios)boot when set to 1 and BDM (Uefi) boot when set to 2.  Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint BdmFormat: 1 use VHD for BDMboot, 2 use ISO, 3use USB. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DateTime BdmUpdated: Timestamp of the last BDM bootdisk update. Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DateTime BdmCreated: Timstamp when BDM device wascreated  Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid XsPvsProxyUuid: UUID of XenServer PVS_proxyDefault=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool XsPvsProxyEnabled: Enable XenServer PVS proxywhen set to true Default=false</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">When Device is not passed, the parameters below areused:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid Guid or DeviceId: GUID of the Device to Set.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or DeviceName: Name of the Device toSet.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsPhysicalAddress DeviceMac: MAC of the Device toSet.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid CollectionId: GUID of the Collection to set allDevices. DeviceName and DeviceMac cannot be set.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid SiteViewId: GUID of the Site View to set allDevices. DeviceName and DeviceMac cannot be set.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid FarmViewId: GUID of the Farm View to set allDevices. DeviceName and DeviceMac cannot be set.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string FarmViewName: Name of the Farm View to setall Devices. DeviceName and DeviceMac cannot be set.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or one of these required ; resolutions</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string CollectionName: Name of the Collection to setall Devices. DeviceName and DeviceMac cannot be set.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string SiteViewName: Name of the Site View to setall Devices. DeviceName and DeviceMac cannot be set.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid SiteId: GUID of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string SiteName: Name of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional field values to set:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string NewName: Computer name with no spaces. ASCIIcomputer name characters Max Length=15</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Description: User description.Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsPhysicalAddress DeviceMac: Ethernet address canhave the form XX-XX-XX-XX-XX-XX. Uniquely identifies the Device.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint BootFrom: Device to boot from. Choices are 1for vDisk, 2 for Hard Disk, and 3 for Floppy. This cannot be Set for a Devicewith Personal vDisk. Min=1, Max=3, Default=1</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string ClassName: Used by Automatic Update featureto match new versions of Disks to a Device. This cannot be Set for a Devicewith Personal vDisk. Default="" Max Length=41</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Port: UDP port to use with Stream Service.Min=1025, Max=65534, Default=6901</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool Enabled: True when it can be booted, falseotherwise. This cannot be Set for a Device with Personal vDisk. Default=true</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool LocalDiskEnabled: If there is a local disk menuchoice for the Device, this is true. This cannot be Set for a Device withPersonal vDisk. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Authentication: Device log in authentication.Choices are 0 for none, 1 for User Name/Password, and 2 for Extern. This cannotbe Set for a Device with Personal vDisk. Min=0, Max=2, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string User: Name of user to authenticate before theboot process continues. This cannot be Set for a Device with Personal vDisk.Default="" ASCII Max Length=20</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Password: Password of user to authenticatebefore the boot process continues. This cannot be Set for a Device withPersonal vDisk. Default="" ASCII Max Length=100</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint AdTimestamp: The time the Active Directorymachine account password was generated. Do not set this field, it is only setinternally by PVS. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint AdSignature: The signature of the ActiveDirectory machine account password. Do not set this field, it is only setinternally by PVS. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint LogLevel: Level to perform logging at. Valuesare: 0 (None), 1 (Fatal), 2 (Error), 3 (Warning), 4 (Info), 5 (Debug), and 6(Trace). Min=0, Max=6, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string DomainName: Fully qualified name of thedomain that the Device belongs to. Do not set this field, it is only setinternally by PVS. Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string DomainObjectSID: The value of the objectSIDAD attribute of the same name for the Device's computer account. Do not setthis field, it is only set internally by PVS. Default="" MaxLength=186</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string DomainControllerName: The name of the DC usedto create the host's computer account. Do not set this field, it is only setinternally by PVS. Default="" Max Length=4000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DateTime DomainTimeCreated: The time that thecomputer account was created. Has the date and time including milliseconds. Donot set this field, it is only set internally by PVS. Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Type: 1 when it performs test of Disks, 2 whenit performs maintenance on Disks, 3 when it has a Personal vDisk, 4 when it hasa Personal vDisk and performs tests, 0 otherwise. A Device with type 0 - 3 canonly be Set to 0 - 3, and a Device with type 3 - 4 can only be Set to 3 - 4.Min=0, Max=4, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint LocalWriteCacheDiskSize: The size in GB toformat the Device cache file disk. If the value is 0, then the disk is notformatted. Min=0, Max=2048, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool BdmBoot: Use PXE boot when set to false, BDMboot when set to true. Default is PXE Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint BdmType: Use PXE boot when set to 0, BDM (Bios)boot when set to 1 and BDM (Uefi) boot when set to 2.  Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint BdmFormat: 1 use VHD for BDMboot, 2 use ISO, 3use USB. Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DateTime BdmUpdated: Timestamp of the last BDM bootdisk update. Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">DateTime BdmCreated: Timstamp when BDM device wascreated  Default=Empty</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid XsPvsProxyUuid: UUID of XenServer PVS_proxyDefault=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool XsPvsProxyEnabled: Enable XenServer PVS proxywhen set to true Default=false</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter PassThru: If -PassThru is specified,the resulting PvsDevice object(s) are returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to haveconfirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Set PvsDevice for Individual Fields
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsDevice into a $o variable. Change the $ofield values and then Set the PvsDevice with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o = Get-PvsDevice -Name theDevice -FieldsLocalWriteCacheDiskSize</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o.LocalWriteCacheDiskSize = 1024</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set-PvsDevice $o</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Set PvsDevice for a Field Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsDevice into a $o variable. Change a $ofield to the correct value and then Set the PvsDevice with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDevice -Name theDevice -FieldsLocalWriteCacheDiskSize | foreach { $o = $_; $o.LocalWriteCacheDiskSize = 1024;$o } | Set-PvsDevice</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The "foreach { $o = $_; $o.X = Y; $o }"sets the field X to value Y and returns the object again so it can be piped tothe Set command for update.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 3: Get PvsDevice and Enable
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get all PvsDevice that are not Enabled and thenEnables them.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsDevice -Fields Enabled | Where-Object{$_.Enabled -eq $false} | foreach { $o = $_; $o.Enabled = $true; $o } |Set-PvsDevice</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The "foreach { $o = $_; $o.X = Y; $o }"sets the field X to value Y and returns the object again so it can be piped tothe Set command for update.</span></p>
##Set-PvsDeviceBootstrap<a name="_Toc464196246"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set Device Bootstrap List(s) changed values fromPvsDeviceBootstrap object(s).</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsDeviceBootstrap[] DeviceBootstrap: Array ofPvsDeviceBootstrap objects with changed DeviceBootstrap. The object(s) can comefrom a pileline.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter PassThru: If -PassThru is specified,the resulting PvsDeviceBootstrap object(s) are returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will be confirmed.$ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to have confirmation withoutthe Confirm parameter.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">These exist in the DeviceBootstrap array within eachPvsDeviceBootstrap.</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">They are set using the Add, Insert, Remove, Set, andReorder methods in the PvsDeviceBootstrap.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or Bootstrap: Name of the bootstrapfile. Max Length=259</span></p>

####EXAMPLE 1: Set PvsDeviceBootstrap for Individual Fields
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The Get-PvsDeviceBootstrap returns aPvsDeviceBootstrap object with a PvsDeviceBootstrapList array in it calledDeviceBootstrap.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The DeviceBootstrap is manipulated using the Add,Insert, Remove, Set and Reorder Methods.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The Set-PvsDeviceBootstrap is called with the finalresult.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o = Get-PvsDeviceBootstrap -Name theDevice</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o.Add("addName", "addValue")</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o.Insert(0, "insertName","insertValue")</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o.Remove(1)</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o.Set(2, "setValue")</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o.Reorder(0, 1)</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set-PvsDeviceBootstrap $o</span></p>
