<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set Server Bootstrap(s) changed values fromPvsServerBootstrap object(s), or set one or more field values for aPvsServerBootstarp.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsServerBootstrap ServerBootstrap:PvsServerBootstrap object(s) with changed property value(s) to be set. Theobject(s) can come from a pileline.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">These values are in the PvsServerBootstrap object,and only will be set if the value has changed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver1_Ip: 1st boot server IP.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver1_Netmask: 1st boot server netmask.Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver1_Gateway: 1st boot server gateway.Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Bootserver1_Port: 1st boot server port.Min=1025, Max=65536, Default=6910</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver2_Ip: 2nd boot server IP.Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver2_Netmask: 2nd boot server netmask.Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver2_Gateway: 2nd boot server gateway.Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Bootserver2_Port: 2nd boot server port.Min=1025, Max=65536, Default=6910</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver3_Ip: 3rd boot server IP.Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver3_Netmask: 3rd boot server netmask.Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver3_Gateway: 3rd boot server gateway.Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Bootserver3_Port: 3rd boot server port. Min=1025,Max=65536, Default=6910</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver4_Ip: 4th boot server IP.Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver4_Netmask: 4th boot server netmask.Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver4_Gateway: 4th boot server gateway.Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Bootserver4_Port: 4th boot server port.Min=1025, Max=65536, Default=6910</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool VerboseMode: Display verbose diagnosticinformation when set to true. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool InterruptSafeMode: Interrupt safe mode (use iftarget device hangs during boot) when set to true. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool PaeMode: PAE mode (use if PAE enabled inboot.ini of target device) when set to true. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool BootFromHdOnFail: For network recovery rebootto hard drive when set to true, restore network connection when set to false.Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint RecoveryTime: When bootFromHdOnFail is 1, thisis the number of seconds to wait before reboot to hard drive. Min=10,Max=60000, Default=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint PollingTimeout: Login polling timeout inmilliseconds. Min=1000, Max=60000, Default=5000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint GeneralTimeout: Login general timeout inmilliseconds. Min=1000, Max=60000, Default=5000</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">When ServerBootstrap is not passed, the parametersbelow are used:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid Guid or ServerId: GUID of the Server to Set thenamed bootstrap file on.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string ServerName: Name of the Server to Set thenamed bootstrap file on.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name: Name of the bootstrap file.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional field values to set:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver1_Ip: 1st boot server IP.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver1_Netmask: 1st boot server netmask.Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver1_Gateway: 1st boot server gateway.Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Bootserver1_Port: 1st boot server port.Min=1025, Max=65536, Default=6910</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver2_Ip: 2nd boot server IP.Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver2_Netmask: 2nd boot server netmask.Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver2_Gateway: 2nd boot server gateway.Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Bootserver2_Port: 2nd boot server port.Min=1025, Max=65536, Default=6910</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver3_Ip: 3rd boot server IP.Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver3_Netmask: 3rd boot server netmask.Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver3_Gateway: 3rd boot server gateway.Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Bootserver3_Port: 3rd boot server port.Min=1025, Max=65536, Default=6910</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver4_Ip: 4th boot server IP.Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver4_Netmask: 4th boot server netmask.Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Bootserver4_Gateway: 4th boot server gateway.Default=0.0.0.0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Bootserver4_Port: 4th boot server port.Min=1025, Max=65536, Default=6910</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool VerboseMode: Display verbose diagnosticinformation when set to true. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool InterruptSafeMode: Interrupt safe mode (use iftarget device hangs during boot) when set to true. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool PaeMode: PAE mode (use if PAE enabled inboot.ini of target device) when set to true. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool BootFromHdOnFail: For network recovery rebootto hard drive when set to true, restore network connection when set to false.Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint RecoveryTime: When bootFromHdOnFail is 1, thisis the number of seconds to wait before reboot to hard drive. Min=10,Max=60000, Default=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint PollingTimeout: Login polling timeout inmilliseconds. Min=1000, Max=60000, Default=5000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint GeneralTimeout: Login general timeout inmilliseconds. Min=1000, Max=60000, Default=5000</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter PassThru: If -PassThru is specified,the resulting PvsServerBootstrap object(s) are returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to haveconfirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Set PvsServerBootstrap for Individual Fields
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsServerBootstrap into a $o variable.Change the $o field values and then Set the PvsServerBootstrap with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o = Get-PvsServerBootstrap -Name theBootstrapFile-ServerName theServer -Fields VerboseMode</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o.VerboseMode = $true</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set-PvsServerBootstrap $o</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Set PvsServerBootstrap for a Field Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsServerBootstrap into a $o variable.Change a $o field to the correct value and then Set the PvsServerBootstrap withthe result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsServerBootstrap -Name theBootstrapFile-ServerName theServer -Fields VerboseMode | foreach { $o = $_; $o.VerboseMode =$true; $o } | Set-PvsServerBootstrap</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The "foreach { $o = $_; $o.X = Y; $o }"sets the field X to value Y and returns the object again so it can be piped tothe Set command for update.</span></p>
##Set-PvsServerStore<a name="_Toc464196258"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set ServerStore(s) changed values fromPvsServerStore object(s), or set one or more field values for a PvsServerStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsServerStore ServerStore: PvsServerStore object(s)with changed property value(s) to be set. The object(s) can come from apileline.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">These values are in the PvsServerStore object, andonly will be set if the value has changed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Path: Directory path that the Server uses toaccess the Store. Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] CachePath: Cache path(s) that the Serveruses with the Store. If none are specified the caches will be placed in theStore cachePath. Default=None</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">When ServerStore is not passed, the parameters beloware used:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid Guid or ServerId: GUID of a Server that usesthe path to get to the Store.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or ServerName: Name of a Server thatuses the path to get to the Store.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid StoreId: GUID of the Store.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string StoreName: Name of the Store.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional field values to set:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Path: Directory path that the Server uses toaccess the Store. Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] CachePath: Cache path(s) that the Serveruses with the Store. If none are specified the caches will be placed in theStore cachePath. Default=None</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter PassThru: If -PassThru is specified,the resulting PvsServerStore object(s) are returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to haveconfirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Set PvsServerStore for Individual Fields
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsServerStore into a $o variable. Changethe $o field values and then Set the PvsServerStore with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o = Get-PvsServerStore -ServerName theServer-StoreName theStore -Fields CachePath</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o.CachePath = "\\Network\CachePath"</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set-PvsServerStore $o</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Set PvsServerStore for a Field Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsServerStore into a $o variable. Change a$o field to the correct value and then Set the PvsServerStore with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsServerStore -ServerName theServer -StoreNametheStore -Fields CachePath | foreach { $o = $_; $o.CachePath ="\\Network\CachePath"; $o } | Set-PvsServerStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The "foreach { $o = $_; $o.X = Y; $o }"sets the field X to value Y and returns the object again so it can be piped tothe Set command for update.</span></p>
##Set-PvsSite<a name="_Toc464196259"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set Site(s) changed values from PvsSite object(s),or set one or more field values for a PvsSite.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsSite Site: PvsSite object(s) with changedproperty value(s) to be set. The object(s) can come from a pileline.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">These values are in the PvsSite object, and onlywill be set if the value has changed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or SiteName: Name of the Site. MaxLength=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Description: User description.Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid DefaultCollectionId: GUID of the Collection toplace new Devices into automatically. Not used with defaultCollectionName.Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string DefaultCollectionName: Name of the Collectionto place new Devices into automatically. Not used with DefaultCollectionId.Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint InventoryFilePollingInterval: The number ofseconds between polls for Disk changes in the Stores. Min=1, Max=600,Default=60</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool EnableDiskUpdate: True when Disk Updated isenabled for the Site, false otherwise. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid DiskUpdateServerId: GUID of the Disk UpdateServer for the Site. Not used with DiskUpdateServerName.Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string DiskUpdateServerName: Name of the Disk UpdateServer for the Site. Not used with DiskUpdateServerId. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string MakUser: User name used for MAK activation.Default="" Max Length=64</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string MakPassword: User password used for MAKactivation. Default="" Max Length=64</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">When Site is not passed, the parameters below areused:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid Guid or SiteId: GUID of the Site to Set.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or SiteName: Name of the Site to Set.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional field values to set:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string NewName: Name of the Site. Max Length=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Description: User description.Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid DefaultCollectionId: GUID of the Collection toplace new Devices into automatically. Not used with defaultCollectionName.Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string DefaultCollectionName: Name of the Collectionto place new Devices into automatically. Not used with DefaultCollectionId.Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint InventoryFilePollingInterval: The number ofseconds between polls for Disk changes in the Stores. Min=1, Max=600,Default=60</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool EnableDiskUpdate: True when Disk Updated isenabled for the Site, false otherwise. Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid DiskUpdateServerId: GUID of the Disk UpdateServer for the Site. Not used with DiskUpdateServerName.Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string DiskUpdateServerName: Name of the Disk UpdateServer for the Site. Not used with DiskUpdateServerId. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string MakUser: User name used for MAK activation.Default="" Max Length=64</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string MakPassword: User password used for MAKactivation. Default="" Max Length=64</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter PassThru: If -PassThru is specified,the resulting PvsSite object(s) are returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to haveconfirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Set PvsSite for Individual Fields
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsSite into a $o variable. Change the $ofield values and then Set the PvsSite with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o = Get-PvsSite -Name theSite -FieldsInventoryFilePollingInterval</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o.InventoryFilePollingInterval = 120</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set-PvsSite $o</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Set PvsSite for a Field Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsSite into a $o variable. Change a $ofield to the correct value and then Set the PvsSite with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsSite -Name theSite -FieldsInventoryFilePollingInterval | foreach { $o = $_;$o.InventoryFilePollingInterval = 120; $o } | Set-PvsSite</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The "foreach { $o = $_; $o.X = Y; $o }"sets the field X to value Y and returns the object again so it can be piped tothe Set command for update.</span></p>
##Set-PvsSiteView<a name="_Toc464196260"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set Site View(s) changed values from PvsSiteViewobject(s), or set one or more field values for a PvsSiteView.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsSiteView SiteView: PvsSiteView object(s) withchanged property value(s) to be set. The object(s) can come from a pileline.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">These values are in the PvsSiteView object, and onlywill be set if the value has changed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or SiteViewName: Name of the Site View.Max Length=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Description: User description.Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">When SiteView is not passed, the parameters beloware used:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid Guid or SiteViewId: GUID of the Site View toSet.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or this required ; resolution</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or SiteViewName: Name of the Site Viewto Set.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid SiteId: GUID of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string SiteName: Name of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional field values to set:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string NewName: Name of the Site View. Max Length=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Description: User description.Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter PassThru: If -PassThru is specified,the resulting PvsSiteView object(s) are returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to haveconfirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Set PvsSiteView for Individual Fields
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsSiteView into a $o variable. Change the$o field values and then Set the PvsSiteView with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o = Get-PvsSiteView -Name oldSiteView -SiteNametheSite -Fields Name</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o.Name = "newSiteView"</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set-PvsSiteView $o</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid can be used instead of Name so that theSiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Set PvsSiteView for a Field Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsSiteView into a $o variable. Change a $ofield to the correct value and then Set the PvsSiteView with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsSiteView -Name oldSiteView -SiteName theSite-Fields Name | foreach { $o = $_; $o.Name = "newSiteView"; $o } |Set-PvsSiteView</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The "foreach { $o = $_; $o.X = Y; $o }"sets the field X to value Y and returns the object again so it can be piped tothe Set command for update.</span></p>
##Set-PvsStore<a name="_Toc464196261"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set Store(s) changed values from PvsStore object(s),or set one or more field values for a PvsStore.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsStore Store: PvsStore object(s) with changedproperty value(s) to be set. The object(s) can come from a pileline.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">These values are in the PvsStore object, and onlywill be set if the value has changed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or StoreName: Name of the Store. MaxLength=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid SiteId: GUID of the Site where Administratorsof that Site can change this Store. Not used for Farm Stores. SiteName can beused instead. Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string SiteName: Name of the Site whereAdministrators of that Site can change this Store. Not used for Farm Stores.SiteId can be used instead. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Description: User description.Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Path: Default directory path that the Serversuse to access this Store. Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] CachePath: Default Cache path(s) that theServers use with this Store. If none are specified the caches will be placed inthe WriteCache subdirectory of the Store path. Default=None</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">When Store is not passed, the parameters below areused:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid Guid or StoreId: GUID of the Store to Set.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or StoreName: Name of the Store to Set.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional field values to set:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string NewName: Name of the Store. Max Length=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid SiteId: GUID of the Site where Administratorsof that Site can change this Store. Not used for Farm Stores. SiteName can beused instead. Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string SiteName: Name of the Site whereAdministrators of that Site can change this Store. Not used for Farm Stores.SiteId can be used instead. Default=""</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Description: User description.Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Path: Default directory path that the Serversuse to access this Store. Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string[] CachePath: Default Cache path(s) that theServers use with this Store. If none are specified the caches will be placed inthe WriteCache subdirectory of the Store path. Default=None</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter PassThru: If -PassThru is specified,the resulting PvsStore object(s) are returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to haveconfirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Set PvsStore for Individual Fields
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsStore into a $o variable. Change the $ofield values and then Set the PvsStore with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o = Get-PvsStore -Name theStore -Fields CachePath</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o.CachePath = "\\Network\CachePath"</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set-PvsStore $o</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Set PvsStore for a Field Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsStore into a $o variable. Change a $ofield to the correct value and then Set the PvsStore with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsStore -Name theStore -Fields CachePath |foreach { $o = $_; $o.CachePath = "\\Network\CachePath"; $o } |Set-PvsStore</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The "foreach { $o = $_; $o.X = Y; $o }"sets the field X to value Y and returns the object again so it can be piped tothe Set command for update.</span></p>
##Set-PvsUpdateTask<a name="_Toc464196262"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set Update Task(s) changed values from PvsUpdateTaskobject(s), or set one or more field values for a PvsUpdateTask.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsUpdateTask UpdateTask: PvsUpdateTask object(s)with changed property value(s) to be set. The object(s) can come from apileline.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">These values are in the PvsUpdateTask object, andonly will be set if the value has changed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or UpdateTaskName: Name of the UpdateTask. It is unique within the Site. Max Length=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Description: User description.Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool Enabled: True when it will be processed, falseotherwise. Default=true</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Hour: The hour of the day to perform the task.Min=0, Max=23, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Minute: The minute of the hour to perform thetask. Min=0, Max=59, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Recurrence: The update will reoccur on thisschedule. 0 = None, 1 = Daily, 2 = Every Weekday, 3 = Weekly, 4 = Monthly Date,5 = Monthly Type. Min=0, Max=5, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint DayMask: Days selected values. 1 = Monday, 2 =Tuesday, 4 = Wednesday, 8 = Thursday, 16 = Friday, 32 = Saturday, 64 = Sunday,128 = Day. Default=0. This is used with Weekly and Monthly Type recurrence.Min=1, Max=255, Default=4</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint[] Date: Days of the month. Numbers from 1-31are the only valid values. This is used with Monthly Date recurrence.Default="" Max Length=83</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint MonthlyOffset: When to happen monthly. 0 =None, 1 = First, 2 = Second, 3 = Third, 4 = Forth, 5 = Last. This is used withMonthly Type recurrence. Min=0, Max=5, Default=3</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string EsdType: Esd to use. Valid values are SCCM orWSUS. If no value, a custom script is run on the client. Default=""Max Length=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string PreUpdateScript: Script file to run beforethe update starts. Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string PreVmScript: Script file to run before the VMis loaded. Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string PostUpdateScript: Script file to run afterthe update finishes. Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string PostVmScript: Script file to run after the VMis unloaded. Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Domain: Domain to add the Disk UpdateDevice(s) to. If not included, the first Domain Controller found on the Serveris used. Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string OrganizationUnit: Organizational Unit to addthe Disk Update Device(s) to. This parameter is optional. If it is notspecified, the device is added to the built in Computers container. Child OU'sshould be delimited with forward slashes, e.g. "ParentOU/ChildOU".Special characters in an OU name, such as '"', '#', '+', ',', ';', '>','=', must be escaped with a backslash. For example, an OU called"commaIn,TheMiddle" must be specified as "commaIn\,TheMiddle".The old syntax of delimiting child OU's with a comma is still supported, butdeprecated. Note that in this case, the child OU comes first, e.g."ChildOU,ParentOU". Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint PostUpdateApprove: Access to place the versionin after the update has occurred. 0 = Production, 1 = Test, 2 = Maintenance.Min=0, Max=2, Default=0</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">When UpdateTask is not passed, the parameters beloware used:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid Guid or UpdateTaskId: GUID of the Update Taskto Set.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or this required ; resolution</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or UpdateTaskName: Name of the UpdateTask to Set.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid SiteId: GUID of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string SiteName: Name of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional field values to set:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string NewName: Name of the Update Task. It isunique within the Site. Max Length=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Description: User description.Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool Enabled: True when it will be processed, falseotherwise. Default=true</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Hour: The hour of the day to perform the task.Min=0, Max=23, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Minute: The minute of the hour to perform thetask. Min=0, Max=59, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Recurrence: The update will reoccur on thisschedule. 0 = None, 1 = Daily, 2 = Every Weekday, 3 = Weekly, 4 = Monthly Date,5 = Monthly Type. Min=0, Max=5, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint DayMask: Days selected values. 1 = Monday, 2 =Tuesday, 4 = Wednesday, 8 = Thursday, 16 = Friday, 32 = Saturday, 64 = Sunday,128 = Day. Default=0. This is used with Weekly and Monthly Type recurrence.Min=1, Max=255, Default=4</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint[] Date: Days of the month. Numbers from 1-31are the only valid values. This is used with Monthly Date recurrence.Default="" Max Length=83</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint MonthlyOffset: When to happen monthly. 0 =None, 1 = First, 2 = Second, 3 = Third, 4 = Forth, 5 = Last. This is used withMonthly Type recurrence. Min=0, Max=5, Default=3</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string EsdType: Esd to use. Valid values are SCCM orWSUS. If no value, a custom script is run on the client. Default=""Max Length=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string PreUpdateScript: Script file to run beforethe update starts. Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string PreVmScript: Script file to run before the VMis loaded. Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string PostUpdateScript: Script file to run afterthe update finishes. Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string PostVmScript: Script file to run after the VMis unloaded. Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Domain: Domain to add the Disk UpdateDevice(s) to. If not included, the first Domain Controller found on the Serveris used. Default="" Max Length=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string OrganizationUnit: Organizational Unit to addthe Disk Update Device(s) to. This parameter is optional. If it is notspecified, the device is added to the built in Computers container. Child OU'sshould be delimited with forward slashes, e.g. "ParentOU/ChildOU".Special characters in an OU name, such as '"', '#', '+', ',', ';', '>','=', must be escaped with a backslash. For example, an OU called"commaIn,TheMiddle" must be specified as"commaIn\,TheMiddle". The old syntax of delimiting child OU's with acomma is still supported, but deprecated. Note that in this case, the child OUcomes first, e.g. "ChildOU,ParentOU". Default="" MaxLength=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint PostUpdateApprove: Access to place the versionin after the update has occurred. 0 = Production, 1 = Test, 2 = Maintenance.Min=0, Max=2, Default=0</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter PassThru: If -PassThru is specified,the resulting PvsUpdateTask object(s) are returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to haveconfirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Set PvsUpdateTask for Individual Fields
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsUpdateTask into a $o variable. Change the$o field values and then Set the PvsUpdateTask with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o = Get-PvsUpdateTask -Name theUpdateTask -SiteNametheSite -Fields Date, Recurrence</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o.Date = 1, 15</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o.Recurrence = 4</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set-PvsUpdateTask $o</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid can be used instead of Name so that theSiteName or SiteId is not also needed.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 2: Set PvsUpdateTask for a Field Using Pipe
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsUpdateTask into a $o variable. Change a$o field to the correct value and then Set the PvsUpdateTask with the result.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get-PvsUpdateTask -Name theUpdateTask -SiteName theSite-Fields Recurrence | foreach { $o = $_; $o.Recurrence = 1; $o } |Set-PvsUpdateTask</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The -Fields parameter with only the needed fieldsspecified makes the Get work faster because only those fields are retrieved.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">The "foreach { $o = $_; $o.X = Y; $o }"sets the field X to value Y and returns the object again so it can be piped tothe Set command for update.</span></p>
##Set-PvsVirtualHostingPool<a name="_Toc464196263"></a>
<p style="margin-left:.4in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Set Virtual Hosting Pool(s) changed values fromPvsVirtualHostingPool object(s), or set one or more field values for a PvsVirtualHostingPool.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">PvsVirtualHostingPool VirtualHostingPool:PvsVirtualHostingPool object(s) with changed property value(s) to be set. Theobject(s) can come from a pileline.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">These values are in the PvsVirtualHostingPoolobject, and only will be set if the value has changed.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or VirtualHostingPoolName: Name of theVirtual Hosting Pool. It is unique within the Site. Max Length=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Type: Type of the Virtual Hosting Pool. 0 =Citrix XenServer, 1 = Microsoft SCVMM/Hyper-V, 2 = VMWare vSphere/ESX. Min=0,Max=2, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Description: User description.Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Server: Name or IP of the Host Server. MaxLength=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Port: Port of the Host Server. Min=80,Max=65534, Default=80</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Datacenter: Datacenter of the Virtual HostingPool. Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint UpdateLimit: Number of updates at the sametime. Min=2, Max=1000, Default=1000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint UpdateTimeout: Timeout for updates. Min=2,Max=240, Default=60</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint ShutdownTimeout: Timeout for shutdown. Min=2,Max=30, Default=10</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string UserName: Name to use when logging into theServer.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Password: Password to use when logging intothe Server.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid XdHostingUnitUuid: UUID of XenDesktop HostingUnit Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool XsPvsProxyEnabled: Enable XenServer PVS proxywhen set to true Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool PrepopulateEnabled: Enable prepopulate when setto true Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid XsPvsSiteUuid: UUID of XenServerPVS_site  Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">When VirtualHostingPool is not passed, theparameters below are used:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">This required</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid Guid or VirtualHostingPoolId: GUID of theVirtual Hosting Pool to Set.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">or this required ; resolution</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Name or VirtualHostingPoolName: Name of theVirtual Hosting Pool to Set.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">One of these resolutions when needed</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid SiteId: GUID of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string SiteName: Name of the Site.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional field values to set:</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string NewName: Name of the Virtual Hosting Pool. Itis unique within the Site. Max Length=50</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Type: Type of the Virtual Hosting Pool. 0 =Citrix XenServer, 1 = Microsoft SCVMM/Hyper-V, 2 = VMWare vSphere/ESX. Min=0,Max=2, Default=0</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Description: User description.Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Server: Name or IP of the Host Server. MaxLength=255</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint Port: Port of the Host Server. Min=80,Max=65534, Default=80</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string Datacenter: Datacenter of the Virtual HostingPool. Default="" Max Length=250</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint UpdateLimit: Number of updates at the sametime. Min=2, Max=1000, Default=1000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint UpdateTimeout: Timeout for updates. Min=2,Max=240, Default=60</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">uint ShutdownTimeout: Timeout for shutdown. Min=2,Max=30, Default=10</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">string UserName: Name to use when logging into theServer.</span></p>

<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid XdHostingUnitUuid: UUID of XenDesktop HostingUnit Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool XsPvsProxyEnabled: Enable XenServer PVS proxywhen set to true Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">bool PrepopulateEnabled: Enable prepopulate when setto true Default=false</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Guid XsPvsSiteUuid: UUID of XenServerPVS_site  Default=00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</span></p>
<p></p>
<p style="margin-left:.7in;text-indent:-.2in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Optional</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter PassThru: If -PassThru is specified,the resulting PvsVirtualHostingPool object(s) are returned.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">SwitchParameter Confirm: The impact of thisoperation is "low". If -Confirm is specified, the operation will beconfirmed. $ConfirmPreference can be set to "low" to haveconfirmation without the Confirm parameter.</span></p>
####EXAMPLE 1: Set PvsVirtualHostingPool for Individual Fields
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">Get the PvsVirtualHostingPool into a $o variable.Change the $o field values and then Set the PvsVirtualHostingPool with theresult.</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o = Get-PvsVirtualHostingPool -NametheVirtualHostingPool -SiteName theSite -Fields Port</span></p>
<p style="margin-left:2.0in;text-indent:-1.4in"><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"">$o.Port = 180</span></p>
